original: tshor ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'o //

original: spangs zhes bya ba ni zas yongs su btang ba'o //
analyzed: spangs zhes bya ba ni zas yongs su btang ba'o //

original: ji cam gyis chog pa @153b zhes bya ba ni ji tsam 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ji cam gyis chog pa @153b zhes bya ba ni ji tsam 'dod pa'o //

analyzed: zas brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni zas bza' bar brtsams pa'o //

analyzed: chu bzhin du spong zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis chu'i rgyun 'bab pa'i tshul gyis lo ma la sogs pa gang dang gang 'ong ba de dang des spong bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Abandoning like water” means that one abandons by whatever leaf, etc., comes along, in the manner of a stream of water flowing along, taking whatever path there may be.

analyzed: skam tshod ces bya ba ni tshod ma khu ba med pa'o// bca' ba lnga po dag gis ni spang bar mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga po dag la ni zas nyid yongs su rdzogs pa med pa'i phyir zas ma yin pa spangs pas zas spangs bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bca' ba lnga po dag la
translated: “Dry” means without juice.🔽“One does not abandon by the five cooked foods” means that one does not abandon food by abandoning non-food, because the five cooked foods are not complete food.

original: ni spangs pa med do //
analyzed: ni spangs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no abandoning of the five cooked foods.

original: bza' ba lnga po dag gis ni spang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gtso bo spangs pas gtso bo ma yin pa yang spang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bza' ba lnga po dag spangs nas bca' ba lnga po 'cha' na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha🔽tshig go // bca' ba lnga po 'chos nas ni bza' ba lnga po dag bza' bar bya'i zhes bya ba ni bca' ba dag ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: bca' ba dag ni bca' bar mi bya ste /🔽spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes don gyi shugs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: bca' ba dag ni bca' bar mi bya ste / spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes don gyi shugs kyis bstan to //

original: bza' ba lnga po dag zos nas ni bca' ba lnga po dag bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bza' ba gtso bo spangs pas bca' ba gtso bo ma yin pa yang spangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽bza' ba dag kyang bza' bar mi bya bar yang don gyi shugs kyis bstan to //

translated: The phrase “after eating the five cooked foods, one should not eat the five uncooked foods” means that one should not eat the five uncooked foods because one has abandoned the five cooked foods.🔽The phrase “one should not eat the five cooked foods” means that one should not eat the five cooked foods because one has abandoned them.

original: des bsags pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba 'bags pa'o //
analyzed: des bsags pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba 'bags pa'o //
translated: “Accumulated” means soiled by food.

original: de gos pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i snum gyis gos pa'o //
analyzed: de gos pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i snum gyis gos pa'o //
translated: “Soiled” means soiled by the oiliness of food.

analyzed: zas yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir zas la sogs pa snang ba'i spyod yul na yod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: “Having food” and so on: “light” means that food and so on are known to be present in the range of the appearance of food.

analyzed: kun du brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni ma blangs pa dang zas spyi spungs la sogs par gzhag pas stobs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: spangs pa zhes bya tha tshig go //
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya tha tshig go //

original: zas med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zas la sogs pa med na don med pas spangs kyang ma spangs pa nyid yin no //🔽spangs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gnas btang ba med na spangs par mi 'gyur bas ma spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: zas med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zas la sogs pa med na don med pas spangs kyang ma spangs pa nyid yin no //🔽spangs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gnas btang ba med na spangs par mi 'gyur bas ma spangs pa yin no //
translated: “Without food” and so on: “food” means that food and so on are not present.🔽“Without food”

original: rung ba spong bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rung ba zhes bya ba ni bzar rung ba'i rdzas kyi ngo @154a * //🔽bo nyid ston pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba spong bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rung ba zhes bya ba ni bzar rung ba'i rdzas kyi ngo @154a * // bo nyid ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase abandoning what is suitable and so on. Suitable refers to the nature of substances that are suitable to be eaten.

original: stsog 'jog ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni g-yos byas pa'i rdzas bzar rung ba nyid spangs na spangs pa yin gyi bzar mi rung ba nyid kyis ni spangs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stsog 'jog ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni g-yos byas pa'i rdzas bzar rung ba nyid spangs na spangs pa yin gyi bzar mi rung ba nyid kyis ni spangs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase not set aside means that if one abandons the suitability of a substance that has been prepared as food, then it is abandoned. It does not mean that it is abandoned by becoming unsuitable to be eaten.

original: tshig lhag ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'i tshig med pa'o//
analyzed: tshig lhag ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'i tshig med pa'o//
translated: The phrase without remainder and so on means that there is no word such as for now.

original: thong zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig lnga ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe yin te mi dgos so //
analyzed: thong zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa tshig lnga ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe yin te mi dgos so //
translated: The five phrases beginning with give up are examples that are well known in the world and are not necessary.

original: mi len to zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang spangs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi len to zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang spangs par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is also abandoned by the phrases beginning with I do not accept.

original: byin cig ces bya ba gzhan la byin cig ces gtong bar byed pa yin gyi bdag nyid la byin cig ces bya ba ni ma yin par shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: byin cig ces bya ba gzhan la byin cig ces gtong bar byed pa yin gyi bdag nyid la byin cig ces bya ba ni ma yin par shes par bya'o ;
translated: One should understand that give it means give it to another, not give it to oneself.

original: / yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zas zos zin cing zhes bya ba ni zas zos zin pa las gzhan las spangs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la zas zos zin cing zhes bya ba ni zas zos zin pa las gzhan las spangs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As for the phrase, a certain monk, etc., having eaten means that he has eaten and is no longer able to reject food.

original: spangs pa las zhes bya ba ni zas zos zin kyang spangs pa nyid la nyes pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa las zhes bya ba ni zas zos zin kyang spangs pa nyid la nyes pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phrase, having rejected means that even though he has eaten, there is no offense if he rejects the food.

original: bya rog gi sgra 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni bya rog gi skrod rad kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: bya rog gi sgra 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni bya rog gi skrod rad kyi sgra'o //
translated: The phrase, having made the sound of a crow means having made the sound of a crow's caw.

original: lhag por zhes bya ba ni lhag mar byas bzhin bor ba ste /
analyzed: lhag por zhes bya ba ni lhag mar byas bzhin bor ba ste /
translated: The phrase, having made a pretense of eating means that he has eaten and then discarded the food.

original: lhag bor byed pa'i dge slong gis zos pa'i lhag bor ba ni lhag bor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag bor byed pa'i dge slong gis zos pa'i lhag bor ba ni lhag bor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase, having made a pretense of eating means that the monk who has made a pretense of eating has discarded the food.

original: yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa zhes bya ba ni tshim zhing bya ba rdzogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa zhes bya ba ni tshim zhing bya ba rdzogs par byas pa'o //
translated: “Having completed and finished” means having satisfied and completed the action.

original: kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma nyid la 'dod pa che ba la sogs pa rnam par gcad pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma nyid la 'dod pa che ba la sogs pa rnam par gcad pa bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Having eaten two or three mouthfuls” is in order to establish the remainder itself, and to eliminate great desire, and so on.

original: bza' bar mi bya bar zhes bya ba ni yid kyis spangs pa'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur na mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bza' bar mi bya bar zhes bya ba ni yid kyis spangs pa'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur na mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “One should not eat” means that it is not right that it should be a misdeed by the mind’s rejection.

original: lag par byin nas zhes bya ba ni lhag por nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag par byin nas zhes bya ba ni lhag por nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Having given it in the hand” is in order to establish the remainder itself.

original: rgyu lngas lhag por ma byas par brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshams kyi phyi rol du zhes bya ba ni chu dang nam mkha' la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu lngas lhag por ma byas par brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshams kyi phyi rol du zhes bya ba ni chu dang nam mkha' la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One should not say that it is not enough” and so on, means that one should not say that it is not enough for five reasons: “Outside the boundary” means that it is separated by water, sky, and so on.

original: mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su zhes bya ba ni nam blang ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su zhes bya ba ni nam blang ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “In a direction where one cannot reach it” means that it is not a place where one can take it.

original: rgyab nas dang / glo nas zhes bya ba gnyis ni mdun na 'dug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyab nas dang / glo nas zhes bya ba gnyis ni mdun na 'dug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two, “from behind” and “from the side,” are not in front.🔽“Degraded from deportment” means not in a squatting position.

original: spyod lam las nyams pa zhes bya ba ni tsog pu ma yin pa'i phyir te lhag ma sbyin pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir de dag lhag bor mi 'chags so //
analyzed: spyod lam las nyams pa zhes bya ba ni tsog pu ma yin pa'i phyir te lhag ma sbyin pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir de dag lhag bor mi 'chags so //
translated: The remainder are not confessed to them because they are not the field for confession.

original: lhung bzed kyi gzhir zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed kyi snod dang byug ris la sogs @154b pa 'og gzhir te lhag bor byas pa za ba ni mi rnams kyis spyod pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi lus kyis blang bar bya ba yin pas rang gi lus las
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi gzhir zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed kyi snod dang byug ris la sogs @154b pa 'og gzhir te lhag bor byas pa za ba ni mi rnams kyis spyod pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi lus kyis blang bar bya ba yin pas rang gi lus las
translated: “The basis of the begging bowl” means the bowl, the stand, the painting, etc. Since eating what is left over is the practice of humans, it is to be taken with one’s own body.

original: gzhan pa dag la mi 'chags so //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag la mi 'chags so //
translated: Therefore, it is not confessed to others.

original: gcig gis lhag bor byas pa mang po dag gis bza' bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams ni chog gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis lhag bor byas pa mang po dag gis bza' bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams ni chog gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Many may eat what is left over by one” means that those who practice pure conduct are of the same rank.

original: lhag bor ma byas par zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang por ba nyid ni lhag por te gang la ma byas pa ni lhag bor ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: lhag bor ma byas par zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang por ba nyid ni lhag por te gang la ma byas pa ni lhag bor ma byas pa ste /
translated: Not having made it leftover means that it is not leftover.

original: lhag ma byas shing ma bor ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma byas shing ma bor ba'o //
translated: It is leftover if it is made leftover.

original: lhag mar byas shing zhes bya ba ni kha chu dang 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mar byas shing zhes bya ba ni kha chu dang 'dres pa'o //
translated: It is made leftover if it is mixed with saliva.

original: ma bor ba zhes bya ba ni bsam pas yongs su ma btang bar ro //
analyzed: ma bor ba zhes bya ba ni bsam pas yongs su ma btang bar ro //
translated: It is not discarded if it is not given away with the intention to give it away.

original: yongs su ma btang bar zhes bya ba ni bya bar yongs su ma btang bar ro //🔽skyo ma zhes bya ba ni phyes btab pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma btang bar zhes bya ba ni bya bar yongs su ma btang bar ro // skyo ma zhes bya ba ni phyes btab pa'o //
translated: It is not given away if it is not given away with the action of giving it away.🔽It is not drunk if it is not drunk through the mouth.

original: mgul du btung ba la ni spangs pa med do zhes bya ba ni skom du btung ba la dus nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mgul du btung ba la ni spangs pa med do zhes bya ba ni skom du btung ba la dus nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: There is no prohibition against drinking it through the mouth.

original: spangs kyang yang nyi ma gzhan bzhin du btung du rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spangs kyang yang nyi ma gzhan bzhin du btung du rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that if it is discarded, it is suitable to drink it again on another day.

original: stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed de sum cu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed de sum cu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The bases of training for the thirty-four downfalls are complete.

original: // / shan pa'i gnas su btang ba zhes bya ba ni shan pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni phyugs gsod pa'i srang ngo //
analyzed: // / shan pa'i gnas su btang ba zhes bya ba ni shan pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni phyugs gsod pa'i srang ngo //
translated: The butcher's place is the street where animals are slaughtered.

original: der btang ba ni der bkye ba'o //🔽des bla'i rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen par byas nas 'doms par mi byed rjes su ston par mi byed pa ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni rab tu phyung rdzogs par bsnyen par byas nas 'doms par mi byed rjes su ston par mi byed pa
analyzed: der btang ba ni der bkye ba'o // des bla'i rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen par byas nas 'doms par mi byed rjes su ston par mi byed pa ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni rab tu phyung rdzogs par bsnyen par byas nas 'doms par mi byed rjes su ston par mi byed pa
translated: To be sent there means to be sent to that place.🔽It is not proper for him to give the full ordination to someone who has been sent there, but it is proper for him to give the full ordination to someone who has not been sent there.🔽It is not proper for him to give the full ordination to someone who has been sent there, but it is proper for him to give the full ordination to someone who has not been sent there means that it is not proper for him to give the full ordination to someone who has been sent there by the king, the king's minister, the king's priest, the king's counselor, or by the king's family, saying Give the full ordination to this person.

original: ni gzhan mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'khor dang bcas pa dag la nges par sbyar bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa bla na med pa sgo log par 'jug tu bcug pas mi rung gi de bas snga ma ches bla'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: ni gzhan mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'khor dang bcas pa dag la nges par sbyar bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa bla na med pa sgo log par 'jug tu bcug pas mi rung gi de bas snga ma ches bla'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: It is not proper for him to give the full ordination to someone who has been sent there by the king, the king's minister, the king's priest, the king's counselor, or by the king's family, saying Give the full ordination to this person, because he would be causing them to enter the unsurpassed teaching of the Tathagata through a wrong door by definitely engaging them in the ten unwholesome courses of action along with their retinue.🔽 The meaning is that the former is much better.

original: // khyod nyid ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni g-yo byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: // khyod nyid ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni g-yo byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: You yourself would become one who has fallen means that he would become one who has fallen because of his deception.

original: dus kyis stobs zhes bya ba ni tshig la mngon bar zhen pas stobs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus kyis stobs zhes bya ba ni tshig la mngon bar zhen pas stobs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The power of time means that one is empowered by attachment to words.

original: de'i ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi dus la ltung byed du 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi dus la ltung byed du 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one commits a downfall by the time of the verbal informative form.

original: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed de sum cu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /🔽// / kun dga' ra ba'i nang zhes bya ba ni gtsug @155a * //
analyzed: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed de sum cu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so / // / kun dga' ra ba'i nang zhes bya ba ni gtsug @155a * //
translated: The thirty-fifth downfall of abandoning the training is explained.

original: lag khang gi nang ngo //
analyzed: lag khang gi nang ngo //
translated: In the monastery means in the temple.

original: 'dus shing zab zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi tshogs gsum la sogs pa dang / dge 'dun las tha dad par za ba ste bza' bar bya ba bza' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dus shing zab zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi tshogs gsum la sogs pa dang / dge 'dun las tha dad par za ba ste bza' bar bya ba bza' zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To eat in a group means to eat separately from the Saṅgha, in a group of three or more monks, and so on. This means to eat what is to be eaten.

original: 'dus pa chen po zhes bya ba ni stong la sogs pa'i grangs kyi skye bo mang po 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa chen po zhes bya ba ni stong la sogs pa'i grangs kyi skye bo mang po 'dus pa'o //
translated: A large gathering is a gathering of many people, such as a thousand or more.

original: kun du 'tsho dag las phrogs te bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dge 'dun la phul lo zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i blos phul ba yin pas /
analyzed: kun du 'tsho dag las phrogs te bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dge 'dun la phul lo zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i blos phul ba yin pas /
translated: and gave them to the community of disciples of the Bhagavat.🔽This is the offering of the arhat mind.

original: kun du 'tsho dag la dgra bcom pa med pa'i phyir dang / dge 'dun la yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽na ba dus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kun du 'tsho dag la dgra bcom pa med pa'i phyir dang / dge 'dun la yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o // na ba dus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because the arhats do not exist in the community of Pūraṇa, and because they do exist in the community of the Buddha.

original: na ba dang las dang / lam dang / grur zhugs pa'i dus dag la ni phongs par gyur pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
analyzed: na ba dang las dang / lam dang / grur zhugs pa'i dus dag la ni phongs par gyur pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
translated: When sick, when working, when traveling, when on a boat, there is no offense, because they are in a state of distress.

original: 'dus pa chen po'i dus la ni sbyin pa po rnams kyi bsod nams kyi sgo yin pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun nyid kyis phongs pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'dus pa chen po'i dus la ni sbyin pa po rnams kyi bsod nams kyi sgo yin pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun nyid kyis phongs pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
translated: When there is a great assembly, there is no offense, because it is the door of merit for the donors, and because it is a time of mutual need.

original: dge sbyong gi zas su ste zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa gcad pa'i phyir dang / bstan pa la gzhug par bya ba'i phyir ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi zas su ste zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa gcad pa'i phyir dang / bstan pa la gzhug par bya ba'i phyir ltung ba med do //
translated: When it is food for ascetics, there is no offense, because it is in order to cut off the views of the tīrthikas and to introduce them to the teaching.

original: de yang dge sbyong zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa zhi bar bya ba dang / rab tu byung ba blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dge sbyong zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa zhi bar bya ba dang / rab tu byung ba blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, one is counted as a spiritual practitioner because one pacifies attachment and so on, and because one has taken up the life of a renunciate.

original: gzhi'i gnas zhes bya ba ni gang du nges par za ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi'i gnas zhes bya ba ni gang du nges par za ba'o //
translated: A fixed place is where one eats at a fixed time.

original: khang khyim gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni gang du zas nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: khang khyim gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni gang du zas nges pa med pa'o //
translated: A house is where one eats at an unspecified time.

original: gzhi'i gnas su za bdag la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gnas spo ba ma byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhi'i gnas su za bdag la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gnas spo ba ma byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Eating at a fixed place is a minor offense because one has not moved the place of those who are sick.

original: dngos gzhi med do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi med do //
translated: There is no actual basis for this.

original: khang khyim du za ba dag la ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi spo ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khang khyim du za ba dag la ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi spo ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Eating at a house is a downfall because one has moved the place of those who are sick.

original: gsum zhing gcig las byed pa la ltung ba med pa ni bdag nyid gsum la sogs pa dang lhan cig za bar ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum zhing gcig las byed pa la ltung ba med pa ni bdag nyid gsum la sogs pa dang lhan cig za bar ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no downfall for one who is sick and who eats in three places or in one place because one has not eaten together with three or more people.

original: gsum rdzogs par bsnyen cing gcig rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa la ltung ba med pa ni dge slong gi tshogs 'dus shing za ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum rdzogs par bsnyen cing gcig rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa la ltung ba med pa ni dge slong gi tshogs 'dus shing za ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if the three are complete but one is not complete because the monks do not gather and eat.

original: zas brim par byas pa la ltung ba med pa ni tha dad par za ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas brim par byas pa la ltung ba med pa ni tha dad par za ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if the food is distributed because they do not eat separately.

original: sbyin bdag na re gang dag 'di na 'khod pa de dag la sbyin no zhes zer na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag gis nges par byas na rnyed pa'i mtshams tha dad pa'i phyir gnas gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag na re gang dag 'di na 'khod pa de dag la sbyin no zhes zer na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag gis nges par byas na rnyed pa'i mtshams tha dad pa'i phyir gnas gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if the donor says, “I give to those who are here,” because the donor has made a definite decision and the boundary of the acquisition is different, so it is not the same place.

original: 'dus @155b shing za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dus @155b shing za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The thirty-sixth downfall in the training of monks, “Eating in a group,” is finished.

original: // /'di dag skyes pa gang dag gis 'di dag skyes ma thag gi kha lan tshvas 'gegs par ma nus pa de dag gis ci thob ces bya ba ni gal te bkang bar gyur na de'i mod la shi bar gyur pas gnas skabs 'di lta bu mthong bar mi
analyzed: // /'di dag skyes pa gang dag gis 'di dag skyes ma thag gi kha lan tshvas 'gegs par ma nus pa de dag gis ci thob ces bya ba ni gal te bkang bar gyur na de'i mod la shi bar gyur pas gnas skabs 'di lta bu mthong bar mi
translated: What do those obtain who are born in these rebirths but are unable to immediately counter them with salt water?

original: 'gyur bas legs so snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽brla dbrag tu khron pa bcug ste 'brang bar mi nus pa de dag gis ci thob ces bya ba ni gal te bla dbrag tu khron pa'i kha gtad de 'brang bar gyur pa de'i mod la shi bar gyur pas gnas skabs 'di ltar bu mthong bar mi 'gyur
analyzed: 'gyur bas legs so snyam du bsams pa'o // brla dbrag tu khron pa bcug ste 'brang bar mi nus pa de dag gis ci thob ces bya ba ni gal te bla dbrag tu khron pa'i kha gtad de 'brang bar gyur pa de'i mod la shi bar gyur pas gnas skabs 'di ltar bu mthong bar mi 'gyur
translated: If they were to fill them, they would die immediately, so they think, “It is better not to see such a state.”🔽What do those obtain who are born in these rebirths but are unable to immediately counter them with salt water?

original: bas legs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bas legs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If they were to fill them, they would die immediately, so they think, “It is better not to see such a state.”

original: grong khyer gyi skab mo can dag ces bya ba ni grong khyer gyi mi dag ste grong khyer rdal na de dag la skab mo'i khyim yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi skab mo can dag ces bya ba ni grong khyer gyi mi dag ste grong khyer rdal na de dag la skab mo'i khyim yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those with city-gates means the people of the city, because they have houses with gates in the city.

original: rgyu dang mi rgyu'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni sems yod pa dang sems med 'jig rten de rgyu ba dang gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyu'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni sems yod pa dang sems med 'jig rten de rgyu ba dang gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The world of the animate and inanimate is synonymous with the world of the sentient and insentient.

original: chos mngon bar rjod par byed ces bya ba ni mngon sum du bye dpa'o //
analyzed: chos mngon bar rjod par byed ces bya ba ni mngon sum du bye dpa'o //
translated: The Abhidharma is the one who speaks.

original: gnas lnga zhes bya ba ni gzhi lnga'o //
analyzed: gnas lnga zhes bya ba ni gzhi lnga'o //
translated: The five topics are the five bases.

original: sbobs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sbobs pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Eloquence is the practice of wisdom.

original: dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The thirty-seventh downfall of eating at the wrong time has been explained.

original: // /'bras chan gsher ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras kyi 'o thug la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // /'bras chan gsher ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras kyi 'o thug la sogs pa'o //
translated: Cooked grain is rice gruel and so forth.

original: 'bras chan skam po zhes bya ba ni 'bras chan nyi tshe'o //
analyzed: 'bras chan skam po zhes bya ba ni 'bras chan nyi tshe'o //
translated: Dry grain is just dry rice.

original: rlung ldang ba zhes bya ba ni rlung che ba'o //
analyzed: rlung ldang ba zhes bya ba ni rlung che ba'o //
translated: A strong wind is a strong wind.

original: yul ngan 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nam rmus pa 'am sa 'gred pa'o //
analyzed: yul ngan 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nam rmus pa 'am sa 'gred pa'o //
translated: A bad place is a place of danger or a place of danger.

original: char pa 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni char chu zhod pa'o //
analyzed: char pa 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni char chu zhod pa'o //
translated: Rain is heavy rain.

original: lhags pa byung ba zhes bya ba ni skam lhags che ba'o //
analyzed: lhags pa byung ba zhes bya ba ni skam lhags che ba'o //
translated: “The occurrence of a wind” means a great dry wind.

original: stsog 'jog byed pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis legs par blangs te stsogs pa'o //
analyzed: stsog 'jog byed pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis legs par blangs te stsogs pa'o //
translated: “Storing” means storing it oneself after taking it properly.

original: stsog 'jog byas pa rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni zas kyi dus rnam pa gnyis las yol ba las stsog 'jog byas pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stsog 'jog byas pa rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni zas kyi dus rnam pa gnyis las yol ba las stsog 'jog byas pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: “There are two kinds of storing” means that there are two kinds of storing that are past the two times for eating.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa stsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa za na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bca' ba dang / bza' ba la sogs byas pas 'bags pa za na'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa stsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa za na thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bca' ba dang / bza' ba la sogs byas pas 'bags pa za na'o //
translated: “If one eats what is spoiled by being stored in a begging bowl, etc., it is a fault in all cases” means if one eats what is spoiled by being stored with food, etc.

original: 'dis yang lhung bzed la sogs pa la bca' ba dang / bza' ba stsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa mgul du mid par mi mngon pa la dngos gzhi'i gnas su nyes byas su gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis yang lhung bzed la sogs pa la bca' ba dang / bza' ba stsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa mgul du mid par mi mngon pa la dngos gzhi'i gnas su nyes byas su gsungs so //
translated: This also says that if one eats what is spoiled by being stored with food, etc., in a begging bowl, etc., and it is not obvious that it is stored around the neck, it is a basic offense.

original: kha cig @156a * //
analyzed: kha cig @156a * //
translated: Some say:

original: 'di la dngos gzhi nyid du 'dod pa ni lhung bzed la sogs pa la bca' ba dang bza' ba stsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pas mgul du mid pa las bsams te smra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la dngos gzhi nyid du 'dod pa ni lhung bzed la sogs pa la bca' ba dang bza' ba stsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pas mgul du mid pa las bsams te smra ba yin no //
translated: The assertion that this is the actual basis is spoken of with reference to the neck being soiled by the storing of food and drink in the begging bowl and so on.

original: stsog 'jog gi ltung byed de sum cu brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: stsog 'jog gi ltung byed de sum cu brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The thirty-eighth downfall in the smrtipatra tradition is now complete.

original: // / thams cad dur khrod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa thams cad pa dur khrod pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: // / thams cad dur khrod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa thams cad pa dur khrod pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Possessing the charnel ground means that all the requisites such as the begging bowl are from the charnel ground.

original: rje'u zhes bya ba ni rdza bo chung ngu'o //🔽gyo mo kha bzhogs te zhes bya ba ni bdar te'o //
analyzed: rje'u zhes bya ba ni rdza bo chung ngu'o // gyo mo kha bzhogs te zhes bya ba ni bdar te'o //
translated: A pot is a small earthenware vessel.🔽A shard is a piece of broken pottery.

original: dgang dka' ba zhes bya ba ni lto'o //
analyzed: dgang dka' ba zhes bya ba ni lto'o //
translated: A difficult stomach is an upset stomach.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan dus byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling na grags pa'i rang len pa mngon du byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan dus byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling na grags pa'i rang len pa mngon du byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having consecrated the stomach in Kuru means that one has actualized the vow known in the northern continent of Kuru.

original: mes rung ba zhes bya ba ni mes reg pa'o //🔽mtshon gyis rung ba zhes bya ba ni mtshon gyis rma phyung ba'o //
analyzed: mes rung ba zhes bya ba ni mes reg pa'o // mtshon gyis rung ba zhes bya ba ni mtshon gyis rma phyung ba'o //
translated: “Suitable for fire” means suitable for contact with fire.🔽“Suitable for a weapon” means suitable for a wound from a weapon.

original: sen mos rung ba zhes bya ba ni sen mos rma phyung ba'o //
analyzed: sen mos rung ba zhes bya ba ni sen mos rma phyung ba'o //
translated: “Suitable for a fingernail” means suitable for a wound from a fingernail.

original: rnyis pas rung ba zhes bya ba ni rnyis pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnyis pas rung ba zhes bya ba ni rnyis pa nyid do //
translated: “Suitable for a hook” means suitable for a hook.🔽“Suitable for a beak” means suitable for a beak.🔽“Suitable for a claw” means suitable for a claw.

original: ne tshos rma phyung bas rung ba zhes bya ba ni ne tshos zos pa'o //🔽phyung ba zhes bya ba ni sa las bton pa'o //🔽gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni tshal ba'o //
analyzed: ne tshos rma phyung bas rung ba zhes bya ba ni ne tshos zos pa'o // phyung ba zhes bya ba ni sa las bton pa'o // gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni tshal ba'o //
translated: “Suitable for a tooth” means suitable for a tooth.🔽“Suitable for a root” means suitable for a root.🔽“Suitable for a branch” means suitable for a branch.

original: bcad pa zhes bya ba ni gtubs pa'o //
analyzed: bcad pa zhes bya ba ni gtubs pa'o //
translated: “Suitable for a trunk” means suitable for a trunk.🔽“Suitable for a flower” means suitable for a flower.🔽“Suitable for a fruit” means suitable for a fruit.

original: phug pa zhes bya ba ni btsugs pa'o //
analyzed: phug pa zhes bya ba ni btsugs pa'o //
translated: “Suitable for a seed” means suitable for a seed.

original: sa bon gyi chos med pa nyid ces bya ba ni sa bon mi skye ba nyid do ;
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos med pa nyid ces bya ba ni sa bon mi skye ba nyid do ;
translated: “Without the nature of a seed” means not producing a seed.

original: / phung por byas te mes gnas pa gnyis sam gsum du reg par byas na thams cad du rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mes reg pa'i phyir bkra mi shis pa nyid kyi sa bon nyid kyi tha snyad las log pa'i phyir phung por byas nas🔽yang dang yang du reg pas rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: / phung por byas te mes gnas pa gnyis sam gsum du reg par byas na thams cad du rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mes reg pa'i phyir bkra mi shis pa nyid kyi sa bon nyid kyi tha snyad las log pa'i phyir phung por byas nas yang dang yang du reg pas rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: If it is made into a bundle and touched by fire two or three times, it becomes suitable everywhere.🔽This means that by touching it with fire, the seed of inauspiciousness is removed from the convention of being a seed, and by repeatedly touching it as a bundle, it becomes suitable.

original: mtshon dang sen mos ni re re nas so zhes bya ba ni rma phyung na snying po med pa ni phyir sa bon nyid tha snyad ldog pas gang la rma phyung ba de nyid la sa bon nyid med pa'i phyir re re nas rma dbyung bar bya'o zhes
analyzed: mtshon dang sen mos ni re re nas so zhes bya ba ni rma phyung na snying po med pa ni phyir sa bon nyid tha snyad ldog pas gang la rma phyung ba de nyid la sa bon nyid med pa'i phyir re re nas rma dbyung bar bya'o zhes
translated: By a weapon or nail, each one. This means that if a wound is inflicted, the seed is removed from the convention of being a seed, so each one should be wounded, because the seed is removed from that very one.

original: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: dge slong dag gis dang po gzung bar bya ba ni byin len 'jig pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag gis dang po gzung bar bya ba ni byin len 'jig pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Monks should first take hold of it in order to abandon the destruction of the gift.

original: stsog 'jog byas pa yin no zhes 'dor bar byed nas zhes bya ba ni phyed yol phan chad stsog 'jog tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stsog 'jog byas pa yin no zhes 'dor bar byed nas zhes bya ba ni phyed yol phan chad stsog 'jog tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having set it aside means that it is set aside after noon.

original: dang po dge slong dag gis gtang bar bya zhing phyis khyim pa dag gis gtang bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni sog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir byin len pa bzhi po bsgrubs pa @156b yin no //
analyzed: dang po dge slong dag gis gtang bar bya zhing phyis khyim pa dag gis gtang bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni sog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir byin len pa bzhi po bsgrubs pa @156b yin no //
translated: The phrase first the monks should give it away and later the householders should give it away means that the four who have received the gift should do this in order to prevent it from being set aside.

original: rung ba'i khang par bcug ste zhes bya ba ni zas skom gyi khang par ro //
analyzed: rung ba'i khang par bcug ste zhes bya ba ni zas skom gyi khang par ro //
translated: The phrase having placed it in a suitable house means in a house for food and drink.

original: lag pa khas phub pa zhes bya ba ni lag pa kha bub tu bzhag pa ste de ni len pa la mi phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir byin len mi 'chags so //
analyzed: lag pa khas phub pa zhes bya ba ni lag pa kha bub tu bzhag pa ste de ni len pa la mi phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir byin len mi 'chags so //
translated: The phrase with the hands hanging down means with the hands hanging down. Because it is not facing the receiver, it does not make a formal offering.

original: len pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni len shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: len pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni len shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase with a receiver means with one who knows how to receive.

original: chu dang so shing ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni zas ma yin pa'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur ba de yang bkag go //
analyzed: chu dang so shing ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni zas ma yin pa'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur ba de yang bkag go //
translated: The phrase except for water and tooth cleaners means that this is also prohibited because it would be a minor offense, since they are not food.

original: mi'i lag pa zhes bya ba ni mi'i lag mthil lo //
analyzed: mi'i lag pa zhes bya ba ni mi'i lag mthil lo //
translated: The “palm of a human” is the palm of a human hand.

original: de'i bag chags kyis zhes bya ba ni goms pas te de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i bag chags kyis zhes bya ba ni goms pas te de dang mthun pa'i 'du byed thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “By its latent impression” means by its habit; it means that one obtains a formation that is in conformity with it.

original: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The thirty-ninth downfall, “Eating without having received it,” is finished.

original: // / kha shin tu chen po zhes bya ba ni kha che ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: // / kha shin tu chen po zhes bya ba ni kha che ba nyid kyis so //
translated: “With a very large mouth” means with a large mouth.

original: gzhan gyi khyim dag nas zhes bya ba ni nye du ma yin pa'i khyim dag nas te ma bstabs pa'i khyim dag nas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyim dag nas zhes bya ba ni nye du ma yin pa'i khyim dag nas te ma bstabs pa'i khyim dag nas so //
translated: “In the houses of others” means in the houses of those who are not relatives, in the houses of those who have not invited you.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: “How does one commit a downfall?” and so on.

original: slong ba dang za ba gnyis ka'i dus su min pa yin na sbyor ba la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: slong ba dang za ba gnyis ka'i dus su min pa yin na sbyor ba la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If it is not the time for begging and eating, there is an offense of wrong conduct for the preparation.

original: dngos gzhi la ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos gzhi la ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: There is a downfall for the actual act.

original: gcig mi na pa yin na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig mi na pa yin na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one of them is not sick, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gnyis ka na ba yin na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gnyis ka na ba yin na ltung ba med do //
translated: If both are sick, there is no downfall.

original: bstabs par brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ci bzhed 'dri bas 'dod pa'i don la slong ba'i skabs bye ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bstabs par brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ci bzhed 'dri bas 'dod pa'i don la slong ba'i skabs bye ba yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phrase should be expressed as being offered means that it is the occasion for requesting the desired object by asking what is desired.

original: ci 'dod pa de bslang bar bya zhes bya ba ni bstabs pas rang nyid kyir grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa de bslang bar bya zhes bya ba ni bstabs pas rang nyid kyir grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase what is desired should be requested means that by offering, it is accomplished as one's own.

original: zho sbyin pa chur khu la sogs pa slong ba la ltung ba med pa ni dman pa slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zho sbyin pa chur khu la sogs pa slong ba la ltung ba med pa ni dman pa slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense for requesting milk and so on for the purpose of giving yogurt and so on, because it is inferior.

original: bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the forty-first line of the Four Hundred Verses on the Yogic Deeds of Bodhisattvas.

original: // / nang gir spyad pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyis nye bar spyad pa'o //
analyzed: // / nang gir spyad pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyis nye bar spyad pa'o //
translated: The phrase using it internally means using it for one's own body.

original: phyi rol gyir spyad par zhes bya ba ni lus kyi yo byad du nye bar spyad pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyir spyad par zhes bya ba ni lus kyi yo byad du nye bar spyad pa'o //
translated: The phrase using it externally means using it for one's body's requisites.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the forty-first line of the Four Hundred Verses on the Yogic Deeds of Bodhisattvas.

original: // / bsam pa'i nor bu rig pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos gang gis bsam pa'i mtshan ma nor bu dag shes pa'o //🔽bud med ni skyes pa'i nyal po bya ba yin la skyes pa ni bud med kyi nyal po bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / bsam pa'i nor bu rig pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos gang gis bsam pa'i mtshan ma nor bu dag shes pa'o // bud med ni skyes pa'i nyal po bya ba yin la skyes pa ni bud med kyi nyal po bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The treatise called “The Jewel of Thought” is the treatise by which one knows the characteristics of the jewel of thought.🔽A woman is for the sexual intercourse of a man, and a man is for the sexual intercourse of a woman.🔽“Sexual intercourse” means to enjoy.

original: nyal po'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni longs spyod pa dang @157a * //🔽bcas pa ste /
analyzed: nyal po'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni longs spyod pa dang @157a * // bcas pa ste /
translated: “To enjoy” means to have sex.

original: reg pa ni kham gyi zas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa ni kham gyi zas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is food by the mouthful.

original: nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim na 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim na 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The forty-second downfall is finished.

original: // /'dom gang gi nang du 'greng na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang gi nang tshun chad du 'greng zhing sdod na nye 'khor de tsam yin pa'i phyir 'dom gang gi phyi rol du ni nyes byas te mthong ba dang thos pa tshun chad do zhes bya ba'i tha
analyzed: // /'dom gang gi nang du 'greng na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang gi nang tshun chad du 'greng zhing sdod na nye 'khor de tsam yin pa'i phyir 'dom gang gi phyi rol du ni nyes byas te mthong ba dang thos pa tshun chad do zhes bya ba'i tha
translated: “Standing within an arm’s reach” means that if one stands and stays within an arm’s reach, that much is the vicinity. Therefore, outside of an arm’s reach, there is an offense. “Within sight and hearing” means that if one stands within sight and hearing, there is an offense.

original: tshig go // nyal po byed par shom pa'i phyir na 'greng ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: tshig go // nyal po byed par shom pa'i phyir na 'greng ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The forty-third case of a partial defeat is finished.

original: // / shul dag tu ji tsam du gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni gshegs dgongs kyi tshad ji tsam du gshegs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: // / shul dag tu ji tsam du gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni gshegs dgongs kyi tshad ji tsam du gshegs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How far is it to go? means how much is the distance to go?

original: tshogs dag ces bya ba ni 'dir dgongs pa lam gyi gnas dag yin no //
analyzed: tshogs dag ces bya ba ni 'dir dgongs pa lam gyi gnas dag yin no //
translated: The assembly means the assembly of the path is intended here.

original: bkres pa zhes bya ba ni ltogs pa'o //
analyzed: bkres pa zhes bya ba ni ltogs pa'o //
translated: Hunger means starvation.

original: sprang zan zhes bya ba ni slong mo'o //
analyzed: sprang zan zhes bya ba ni slong mo'o //
translated: Alms means begging.

original: sdug bsngal la reg pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la reg pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Contact with suffering means with pain.

original: slong por khur bas byur bur byas zhes bya ba ni shing gi lhung bzed byur bur bkang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽nyod pa nyod dam zhes bya ba la nyod pa zhes bya ba ni zas so //
analyzed: slong por khur bas byur bur byas zhes bya ba ni shing gi lhung bzed byur bur bkang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // nyod pa nyod dam zhes bya ba la nyod pa zhes bya ba ni zas so //
translated: The beggar filled his bowl to overflowing means he filled his wooden begging bowl to overflowing.🔽Have you eaten? means food.

original: nyod dam zhes bya ba ni zos sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyod dam zhes bya ba ni zos sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Have you eaten? means have you eaten?

original: des ni zan zos sam zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni zan zos sam zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: This shows, “Have you eaten your meal?”

original: khyim bdag sgre byi zhes bya ba ni khyim na gnas pa kho na yin la mgo 'ba' zhig bregs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyim bdag sgre byi zhes bya ba ni khyim na gnas pa kho na yin la mgo 'ba' zhig bregs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The householder named Śreṣṭhika was a householder only, the meaning is that he had his head shaved.

original: des tshigs su bcad pa dag smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis ni byas pa mi shes pa nyid kyis nyes par ston no //
analyzed: des tshigs su bcad pa dag smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis ni byas pa mi shes pa nyid kyis nyes par ston no //
translated: The verses beginning with “He spoke these verses” show the fault of ingratitude with verses.

original: byas pa mi shes pa ni sas kyang 'dzin par mi byed pas na ngan pa khyod lta bu ci'i phyir sa la 'bying bar mi byed pa ngo mtshar che bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa mi shes pa ni sas kyang 'dzin par mi byed pas na ngan pa khyod lta bu ci'i phyir sa la 'bying bar mi byed pa ngo mtshar che bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since ingratitude is not even held by the earth, it is shown that it is amazing that someone like you, a bad person, does not sink into the earth.

original: ngan pa ci'i phyir sa la 'bying mi byed //
analyzed: ngan pa ci'i phyir sa la 'bying mi byed //
translated: For what reason does a bad person not sink into the earth?

original: ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: This is stated.

original: byas pa mi shes pa'i lce yang 'gas par 'gyur bas ngan pa khyod lta bu byas pa'i lce mi 'gas pa yang ngo mtshar che bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa mi shes pa'i lce yang 'gas par 'gyur bas ngan pa khyod lta bu byas pa'i lce mi 'gas pa yang ngo mtshar che bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the tongue of an ingrate also splits, it is shown that it is amazing that someone like you, a bad person, does not split the tongue of an ingrate.

original: ci'i phyir lce yang tshal pa brgyar mi 'gas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir lce yang tshal pa brgyar mi 'gas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Why does your tongue not split into a hundred parts?

original: byas pa mi shes pa'i lus la gnod sbyin dag rdo rje la sogs pa 'phen par byed na ngan pa khyod lta bu byas pa mi shes pa'i lus la gnod sbyin dag rdo rje la sogs pa dag mi 'phen pa yang ngo mtshar che bar @157b bstan pa'i🔽phyir / khyod kyi lus la ci'i phyir gsang ba dag ces bya ba ni //🔽rdo rje ser ba mang du mnga' mi 'phen //
analyzed: byas pa mi shes pa'i lus la gnod sbyin dag rdo rje la sogs pa 'phen par byed na ngan pa khyod lta bu byas pa mi shes pa'i lus la gnod sbyin dag rdo rje la sogs pa dag mi 'phen pa yang ngo mtshar che bar @157b bstan pa'i phyir / khyod kyi lus la ci'i phyir gsang ba dag ces bya ba ni // rdo rje ser ba mang du mnga' mi 'phen //
translated: If yakshas throw vajras and so on at a body that does not repay kindness, it is amazing that yakshas do not throw vajras and so on at a body that is so evil and does not repay kindness.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽gsang ba dag ces bya ba ni gnod sbyin 'jig rten skyong ba dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / gsang ba dag ces bya ba ni gnod sbyin 'jig rten skyong ba dag go //
translated: To show this, he says:🔽Why do yakshas not throw vajras at your body?🔽Vajra hail

original: rdo rje ser ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje char ba phyi brgyud du bab pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ser ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje char ba phyi brgyud du bab pa'o //
translated: Vajra hail is a continuous rain of vajras.🔽Yakshas are world protectors.

original: ji ltar seng ge'i lhag ma za ba'i wa ;
analyzed: ji ltar seng ge'i lhag ma za ba'i wa ;
translated: Just as a fox, who eats the remains of a lion,

original: / seng ge nyid la gsod par 'dod pa ltar //
analyzed: / seng ge nyid la gsod par 'dod pa ltar //
translated: wishes to kill the lion itself,

original: de bzhin khyod kyang stobs bcu'i khyod za zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin khyod kyang stobs bcu'i khyod za zhing //
translated: so you, who eat the remains of the one with ten powers,🔽wish to kill him.

original: stobs bcu nyid la smod byed ma 'phags pa //
analyzed: stobs bcu nyid la smod byed ma 'phags pa //
translated: The one who reviles the one with the ten powers is not a noble person.

original: zhes bya ba ni byas pa mi shes pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byas pa mi shes pa'i dpe'o //
translated: This is an example of ingratitude.

original: ma 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig ste nyon mongs pa can gyi blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di skad bstan te kva ye ma 'phags pa ji ltar 'jig rten 'di ni seng ge'i lhag ma za ba'i wa ni byas pa mi shes par phyir seng ge de nyid la gsod par 'dod pa de bzhin du khyod kyang rgyal ba stobs bcu dang ldan pa slob
analyzed: ma 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig ste nyon mongs pa can gyi blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'di skad bstan te kva ye ma 'phags pa ji ltar 'jig rten 'di ni seng ge'i lhag ma za ba'i wa ni byas pa mi shes par phyir seng ge de nyid la gsod par 'dod pa de bzhin du khyod kyang rgyal ba stobs bcu dang ldan pa slob
translated: The one who is not a noble person is a Tibetan word meaning one who has an afflicted mind. It means one who is not a noble person.

original: ma dang bcas pa'i pham 'babs zas ni khyod za zhing stobs bcu slob ma dang bcas pa nyid la smod par byed pas byas pa mi shes pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ma dang bcas pa'i pham 'babs zas ni khyod za zhing stobs bcu slob ma dang bcas pa nyid la smod par byed pas byas pa mi shes pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught: “Hey, you who are not a noble person! Just as a fox who eats the leftovers of a lion is ungrateful and wants to kill that very lion, so you also eat the leftovers of the Victorious One who possesses the ten powers and his disciples, and you revile the one with the ten powers and his disciples. You are ungrateful.”

original: gang du gang la nye bar bstan byas na //
analyzed: gang du gang la nye bar bstan byas na //
translated: Where and to whom should one teach?

original: mi ngan 'di 'dras 'tsho ba thob pa las //
analyzed: mi ngan 'di 'dras 'tsho ba thob pa las //
translated: From this kind of evil person, one obtains livelihood.

original: de ni nges par mdza' bshes dgra rnams la //
analyzed: de ni nges par mdza' bshes dgra rnams la //
translated: That is certainly for friends and enemies.

original: mnyam mdzad blo ldan thams cad mkhyen pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la brten na mi ngan pa 'di 'dra ba dag gis kyang 'tsho ba thob pa las na sangs rgyas de ni nges pa kho nar mdza' bshes dang dgra bo rnams la mnyam par mdzad pa'i blo dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa
analyzed: mnyam mdzad blo ldan thams cad mkhyen pa yin // zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la brten na mi ngan pa 'di 'dra ba dag gis kyang 'tsho ba thob pa las na sangs rgyas de ni nges pa kho nar mdza' bshes dang dgra bo rnams la mnyam par mdzad pa'i blo dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa
translated: The wise one who acts equally is omniscient.

original: yin par mngon no zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: yin par mngon no zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: This shows that if one relies on the Buddha, even such evil people obtain a livelihood. Therefore, the Buddha is clearly omniscient, the wise one who acts equally toward friends and foes.

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni gnas so //
translated: Where? In a place.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la'o ;
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la'o ;
translated: To whom? To the Buddha.

original: / nye bar bsten byas na zhes bya ba ni skyabs su gsol na'o //
analyzed: / nye bar bsten byas na zhes bya ba ni skyabs su gsol na'o //
translated: If one relies on him, if one goes for refuge.

original: mi ngan 'di 'dras zhes bya ba ni mi ngan pa byas pa mi shes pa 'di dra ba dag gis so //
analyzed: mi ngan 'di 'dras zhes bya ba ni mi ngan pa byas pa mi shes pa 'di dra ba dag gis so //
translated: Even such evil people, evil doers, such as these.

original: 'tsho ba dag thob pa las zhes bya ba ni zan rnyed pa las so //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dag thob pa las zhes bya ba ni zan rnyed pa las so //
translated: They obtain a livelihood, they find food.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: He, the Buddha.

original: mnyam mdzad blo ldan zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir sems mnyam par mdzad do //
analyzed: mnyam mdzad blo ldan zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir sems mnyam par mdzad do //
translated: The intelligent one acts equally is explained as follows: He acts with an equal mind, because he is free from attachment and aversion.

original: mi rnams gang dag byas pa mi shes pa //
analyzed: mi rnams gang dag byas pa mi shes pa //
translated: Those who do not know how to repay kindness

original: de dag khyi bas shin tu ngan par bsam //
analyzed: de dag khyi bas shin tu ngan par bsam //
translated: are considered to be worse than dogs.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi gang dag byas pa mi shes pa de dag ni khyi dag pas kyang shin tu ngan pa yin par kho bos bsams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @158a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi gang dag byas pa mi shes pa de dag ni khyi dag pas kyang shin tu ngan pa yin par kho bos bsams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @158a * //
translated: Those who do not know how to repay kindness are considered to be worse than even dogs.

original: go ; /'dir rgyu ba stan pa'i phyir /🔽khyi yang mi la byas pa shes snang na //
analyzed: go ; /'dir rgyu ba stan pa'i phyir / khyi yang mi la byas pa shes snang na //
translated: Here, in order to teach the cause of that, he says:🔽Even dogs seem to know how to repay kindness,

original: sprul 'dra'i mi dag dug ni gtong bar byed //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /🔽'di ltar khyi yang bdag por gyur pa'i mi dag la zas kyi lhag ma la sogs pa cung zad tsam byin pa'i byas pa shes te /
analyzed: sprul 'dra'i mi dag dug ni gtong bar byed // ces bya ba gsungs te / 'di ltar khyi yang bdag por gyur pa'i mi dag la zas kyi lhag ma la sogs pa cung zad tsam byin pa'i byas pa shes te /
translated: but people, like snakes, spread poison.🔽Thus, even dogs seem to know how to repay kindness,

original: bdag po'i khyim la sogs pa bsrung bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po'i khyim la sogs pa bsrung bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they guard the house of their master and so on, by giving a little something, such as the remains of their food.🔽But people, like snakes, spread poison.

original: mi byas pa mi shes pa sprul dug myur du khyab par byed pa dang 'dra ba'i skye bo ngan pa dag ni dug gtong bar byed de yon tan ma yin pa sgrogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi byas pa mi shes pa sprul dug myur du khyab par byed pa dang 'dra ba'i skye bo ngan pa dag ni dug gtong bar byed de yon tan ma yin pa sgrogs par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Evil people who do not know how to repay kindness are like a swift-acting poison that spreads throughout the body. They are like a poison because they proclaim the faults of others.

original: de bas mi gang dag byas pa mi shes pa de dag ni khyi bas kyang shin tu ngan par bsams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas mi gang dag byas pa mi shes pa de dag ni khyi bas kyang shin tu ngan par bsams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, those who do not know how to repay kindness are considered to be even worse than dogs.

original: re zhig 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi yul la sbyin pa lam zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pas so //
analyzed: re zhig 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni bud med kyi yul la sbyin pa lam zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pas so //
translated: The Buddha did not establish a training precept for monks to avoid women, thinking that it would be difficult for monks to avoid women.

original: gzugs can rgyan zhes bya ba ni mchan gyi phyogs mdzes pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzugs can rgyan zhes bya ba ni mchan gyi phyogs mdzes pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Having a beautiful body means that the body is beautiful in all its parts.

original: / gzugs can gsal ba zhes bya ba ni thon kor mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gzugs can gsal ba zhes bya ba ni thon kor mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having a clear body means that the body is beautiful in its entirety.

original: gzugs can lta bu'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la bsod nams gzugs can du grags pa lta bu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can lta bu'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la bsod nams gzugs can du grags pa lta bu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Having a Dharma body means having a body that is renowned in the world as having the visible marks of a great person.

original: bsreg byas btab pa'i me lta bu zhes bya ba ni zhun mar gyi rgyun gyis btab pa'i me lta bu'o ;
analyzed: bsreg byas btab pa'i me lta bu zhes bya ba ni zhun mar gyi rgyun gyis btab pa'i me lta bu'o ;
translated: Like a fire that is being fed by a stream of melted butter.

original: / gser gyi snod na 'dug pa'i mar me lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: / gser gyi snod na 'dug pa'i mar me lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Like a lamp in a golden vessel.

original: gser gyi ri bo 'gro ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni brjid bag chags pa'o //
analyzed: gser gyi ri bo 'gro ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni brjid bag chags pa'o //
translated: Like a golden mountain that moves.

original: gser gyi mchod sdod zhes bya ba ni gser gyi ka ba'o //
analyzed: gser gyi mchod sdod zhes bya ba ni gser gyi ka ba'o //
translated: Like a golden pillar.

original: grags pa dang / gsal ba dang / mi bsnyengs pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: grags pa dang / gsal ba dang / mi bsnyengs pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are endowed with the intellect of fame, clarity, fearlessness, purity, and purity of liberation.

original: de mthong zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de mthong zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word “seeing” is to be supplied.

original: de la grags pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: de la grags pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: Here, “fame” means being well known.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni spyod pa g-yer ba'o //🔽mi bsnyengs pa zhes bya ba ni gags med pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni spyod pa g-yer ba'o // mi bsnyengs pa zhes bya ba ni gags med pa'o //
translated: “Clarity” means being dignified in one’s behavior.🔽“Fearlessness” means being free of impediments.

original: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: “Purity” means being free of afflictions.🔽“Purity of liberation” means being free of the obscurations of afflictions and the knowable.

original: rnam par dag pa'i zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: “Pure” means uncontaminated.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'phangs pa'o //
translated: “Accumulation of wholesome roots” means the projection of the factors conducive to liberation.

original: nyams bad ba zhes bya ba ni rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: nyams bad ba zhes bya ba ni rung ba nyid do //
translated: “Comfortable” means suitable.

original: 'di dag dang bdag nyid kyi k'arsh'a pa na gzhan dag bsres te zhal zas bsod pa sta gon gyi sa la zhes bya ba ni bslang ba ste khyim bdag @158b gis 'phags pa kun dga' bo la snga nas bstabs zin pas nyes pa med par shes par bya'o
analyzed: 'di dag dang bdag nyid kyi k'arsh'a pa na gzhan dag bsres te zhal zas bsod pa sta gon gyi sa la zhes bya ba ni bslang ba ste khyim bdag @158b gis 'phags pa kun dga' bo la snga nas bstabs zin pas nyes pa med par shes par bya'o
translated: “Mixed with my own kārṣāpaṇas” means mixed with my own money. “Prepared food” means food that has been set out. This should be understood as faultless, since the householder has already offered it to the noble Ānanda.

original: // dri ma'i rtsab can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // dri ma'i rtsab can zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Muddy” means

original: rdul dang snum gyi dri ma ni 'dir dri ma zhes bya ba'o //🔽der rdul chags pa ni rdzab po //
analyzed: rdul dang snum gyi dri ma ni 'dir dri ma zhes bya ba'o // der rdul chags pa ni rdzab po //
translated: “mud” and “oil stain” are called “mud” here.🔽“Muddy” means covered with mud.

original: gcer bu ba dang gcer bu ma zhes bya ba ni sgren mo'o //
analyzed: gcer bu ba dang gcer bu ma zhes bya ba ni sgren mo'o //
translated: “Naked” and “naked woman” means naked.

original: kun du rgyu dang kun du rgyu mo zhes smos pas ni gcer bu pa dang gcer bu ma nyid yi dam du yang dag par blang ba sngon du btang ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: kun du rgyu dang kun du rgyu mo zhes smos pas ni gcer bu pa dang gcer bu ma nyid yi dam du yang dag par blang ba sngon du btang ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The words ascetic and ascetic woman indicate that they have previously taken up the vow of a naked ascetic or a naked ascetic woman.

original: nye du yin na ltung ba med pa ni nye du nyid yin na mu stegs can la mchod pa byed pa yin par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nye du yin na ltung ba med pa ni nye du nyid yin na mu stegs can la mchod pa byed pa yin par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if they are relatives, because if they are relatives, they are not tīrthikas.

original: nad pa yin na ltung ba med pa ni snying brtse bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: nad pa yin na ltung ba med pa ni snying brtse bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: There is no offense if they are sick, because they are objects of compassion.

original: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa las dbral bar 'dod pa yin na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni chos la gzhug pa'i phyir ro //🔽dum bur byas te sbyin pa la ltung ba med pa ni gus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa las dbral bar 'dod pa yin na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni chos la gzhug pa'i phyir ro // dum bur byas te sbyin pa la ltung ba med pa ni gus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if they wish to separate them from sinful views, in order to introduce them to the Dharma.🔽There is no offense if they give them pieces, because they are not respectful.

original: gzhan sbyin du 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni phag nas sbyin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan sbyin du 'jug pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni phag nas sbyin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if they cause others to give, because they are not the ones who give.

original: mngon sum du sbyin du 'jug pa ni nyes byas te mchod pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du sbyin du 'jug pa ni nyes byas te mchod pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Making someone give directly is a minor offense, because it is a form of worship.

original: gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The forty-fourth downfall is finished.

original: // / gsus po che zhes bya ba ni lto ba che ba'o //
analyzed: // / gsus po che zhes bya ba ni lto ba che ba'o //
translated: “Fat” means having a large belly.

original: til gyi chu zhes bya ba ni shi ba dag la til dang bcas pa'i chu sbyin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: til gyi chu zhes bya ba ni shi ba dag la til dang bcas pa'i chu sbyin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Sesame water” is the water given to the dead together with sesame seeds.

original: glang po che'i phru gu 'dra zhes bya ba ni ba glang gi phru gu 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i phru gu 'dra zhes bya ba ni ba glang gi phru gu 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Like an elephant calf” means like a young bull.

original: gzhal med khang 'dra zhes bya ba ni khang pa brtsegs pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal med khang 'dra zhes bya ba ni khang pa brtsegs pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: “Like a celestial mansion” means like a multi-storied building.

original: gnod sbyin gdug pa 'dra zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gtso bo dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gdug pa 'dra zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gtso bo dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: “Like a malevolent yakṣa” means like a chief yakṣa.

original: ras yug chen glegs par 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni ras mtshon gyis dras pa gyon pa'o //
analyzed: ras yug chen glegs par 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni ras mtshon gyis dras pa gyon pa'o //
translated: “Wearing a large cloth” means wearing a cloth that has been cut with a weapon.

original: chas pa zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: chas pa zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o //
translated: “Preparing to fight” means preparing to go to war.

original: g-yul 'gyed par mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: g-yul 'gyed par mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed par 'dod pa'o //
translated: One who delights in battle is one who desires to fight.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa la dmag la 'gro ba la sogs pa la ni zhar la dmag mthong ba yin pas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa la dmag la 'gro ba la sogs pa la ni zhar la dmag mthong ba yin pas ltung ba med do //
translated: If a monk who has entered for almsfood sees a battle by chance, there is no offense.

original: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The forty-fifth permutation of the downfall of watching an army has been completed.

original: // / phru ba zhes bya ba ni dmag go //
analyzed: // / phru ba zhes bya ba ni dmag go //
translated: An army is called a “host.”

original: srog shing dag nas zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo 'dzin pa'i shing dag nas so //🔽rgyal po la sogs pa na re 'dug shig ces zer ba la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang @159a * //
analyzed: srog shing dag nas zhes bya ba ni 'phang lo 'dzin pa'i shing dag nas so // rgyal po la sogs pa na re 'dug shig ces zer ba la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang @159a * //
translated: From the flagpole means from the flagpole that holds the wheel.

original: yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if the king or another person says, “Stay here,” because one is under the control of another.

original: bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yongs su bskyab ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yongs su bskyab ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if one of the eight obstructions occurs, because one is protected from suffering.

original: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The forty-sixth case is concluded.

original: // / g-yul zhes bya ba ni zla ba la sogs pa'i rnam par gnas pa'i dmag go //
analyzed: // / g-yul zhes bya ba ni zla ba la sogs pa'i rnam par gnas pa'i dmag go //
translated: Battle means an army arranged in the form of a half-moon, and so on.

original: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog ces bya ba ni rtags mtshan no //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog ces bya ba ni rtags mtshan no //
translated: The best of banners means a sign.

original: dpung gi mchog ces bya ba ni rung ba'o //
analyzed: dpung gi mchog ces bya ba ni rung ba'o //
translated: The best of armies means a suitable army.

original: bkod cing bshams pa'i dmag ces bya ba ni nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma la sogs pa lta bur gnas pa'i dmag go //
analyzed: bkod cing bshams pa'i dmag ces bya ba ni nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma la sogs pa lta bur gnas pa'i dmag go //
translated: An army arranged and arrayed means an army arranged like the wings of a garuḍa, and so on.

original: lta ba nyams su myong bar byas zhes bya ba ni de'i nang du zhugs te blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lta ba nyams su myong bar byas zhes bya ba ni de'i nang du zhugs te blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To view it means to enter it and to look, that is the meaning.

original: glang po che bcos ma zhes bya ba ni glang po che sgyu ma ste ko ba la sogs pa las byas pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che bcos ma zhes bya ba ni glang po che sgyu ma ste ko ba la sogs pa las byas pa'o //
translated: A constructed elephant means an illusory elephant, made of leather and so on.

original: rdzong nas rlugs te byung zhes bya ba ni mkhar nas 'phungs te byung ba'o //
analyzed: rdzong nas rlugs te byung zhes bya ba ni mkhar nas 'phungs te byung ba'o //
translated: To come out from the fortress means to come out from the castle.

original: khrom gyi ru sna zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed pa'i mi'o //
analyzed: khrom gyi ru sna zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed pa'i mi'o //
translated: The head of the army is the man who leads the army into battle.

original: nang par snga ba kho nar zhes bya ba ni nang par gyi dus te nyi ma 'char ka zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nang par snga ba kho nar zhes bya ba ni nang par gyi dus te nyi ma 'char ka zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the morning, early, means at the time of dawn, at sunrise.

original: bshams pa 'khrug tu 'gro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bshams pa 'khrug tu 'gro zhes bya ba la /
translated: He goes to the disturbance of the array means

original: bshams pa 'khrug ces bya ba ni bshams pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: bshams pa 'khrug ces bya ba ni bshams pa nyams pa'o //
translated: the disturbance of the array is the destruction of the array.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa'o zhes kha cig 'chad do //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa'o zhes kha cig 'chad do //
translated: He goes to it means he acts in it.

original: kha cig na re bshams pa 'khrug ces bya ba ni bshams ba glong ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re bshams pa 'khrug ces bya ba ni bshams ba glong ba'o //
translated: Some say that the disturbance of the array is the agitation of the array.

original: der 'jug pa ni 'gro ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: der 'jug pa ni 'gro ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: To enter there is to go to it.

original: 'bru'i kha lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdun du yang ru ba dngar rgyab tu yang ru ba dngar la /
analyzed: 'bru'i kha lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdun du yang ru ba dngar rgyab tu yang ru ba dngar la /
translated: Like a basket of grain means that in front and in back there are rows of soldiers,

original: dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa ste 'bru'i 'bras bu'i rnam pa ltar dmag bshams pa'o //🔽shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdun du yang ru ba dngar /
analyzed: dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa ste 'bru'i 'bras bu'i rnam pa ltar dmag bshams pa'o // shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdun du yang ru ba dngar /
translated: and in the middle is the king. The army is arranged like a basket of grain.

original: glor yang ru ba dngar la /
analyzed: glor yang ru ba dngar la /
translated: Like the shape of a chariot means that in front and in the flanks there are rows of soldiers,🔽and in the middle is the king. The army is arranged like the shape of a chariot.

original: rgyab na rgyal po 'dug ste /
analyzed: rgyab na rgyal po 'dug ste /
translated: The king is in the rear.

original: shing rta'i dbyibs 'dra bar gru gsum du bshams pa'o //🔽zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdun du yang ru ba dngar /
analyzed: shing rta'i dbyibs 'dra bar gru gsum du bshams pa'o // zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdun du yang ru ba dngar /
translated: The army is arranged in the shape of a chariot.🔽The shape of a half-moon is when the army is arranged in the shape of a half-moon, with the king in front.

original: rgyab tu yang ru ba dngar /
analyzed: rgyab tu yang ru ba dngar /
translated: The army is arranged in the shape of a half-moon, with the king in the rear.🔽The army is arranged in the shape of a half-moon, with the king in the middle.🔽The army is arranged in the shape of a half-moon.🔽The shape of a garuḍa's wings is when the army is arranged with the king in front, with wings on the left and right.🔽The army is arranged in the shape of a garuḍa's wings, with the wings on the left and right extended.🔽The shape of a tortoise is when the army is arranged with the king in the middle, with the wings on the left and right drawn in.

original: glor yang dngar la /
analyzed: glor yang dngar la /
translated: The army is arranged in the shape of a tortoise.

original: dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa ste zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bur dmag bshams pa'o //🔽nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni glor ru ba dngar mdun na rgyal po 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa ste zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bur dmag bshams pa'o // nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni glor ru ba dngar mdun na rgyal po 'dug pa ste /
translated: The shape of a needle is when the army is arranged with the king in the middle, with the wings on the left and right drawn in.🔽The army is arranged in the shape of a needle.🔽The shape of a staff is when the army is arranged with the king in the middle, with the wings on the left and right drawn in.🔽The army is arranged in the shape of a staff.

original: nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma ltar glo g-yas g-yon du ring bar dmag bshams pa'o //🔽go bskon pa dang go ma bskon pa zhes bya ba ni bye @159b brag gis chas pa dang ma chas pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma ltar glo g-yas g-yon du ring bar dmag bshams pa'o // go bskon pa dang go ma bskon pa zhes bya ba ni bye @159b brag gis chas pa dang ma chas pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The shape of a crescent moon is when the army is arranged with the king in the middle, with the wings on the left and right drawn in.

original: shing rta bcas pa zhes bya ba ni brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta bcas pa zhes bya ba ni brgyan pa'o //
translated: The army is arranged in the shape of a crescent moon.
