original: dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /🔽// / sor mo gcig gis rdeg par byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe sor mo tha dad pas rdeg par byed pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so / // / sor mo gcig gis rdeg par byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe sor mo tha dad pas rdeg par byed pa de'i tshe na /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the forty-seventh downfall.

original: rdeg par tha dad par bsams pa'i phyir ltung ba yang tha dad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rdeg par tha dad par bsams pa'i phyir ltung ba yang tha dad par 'gyur la /
translated: If one hits with one finger, etc. When one hits with a different finger, then the downfalls are different because the hitting is different.

original: gang gi tshe gcig nyid kyis rdeg par byed pa de'i tshe ni rdeg pa tha dad par sems pa med pa'i phyir ltung ba yang gcig pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig nyid kyis rdeg par byed pa de'i tshe ni rdeg pa tha dad par sems pa med pa'i phyir ltung ba yang gcig pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: But when one hits with the same finger, then the downfalls should be understood as being the same because there is no difference in the hitting.

original: brnangs pa zhes bya ba ni zas mgul bar thogs pa'o //
analyzed: brnangs pa zhes bya ba ni zas mgul bar thogs pa'o //
translated: Choking means that food is stuck in the throat.

original: thal lcag gi rig sngags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thal lcag gi rig sngags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Hand spell means a spell of the hand.

original: sngags pa gang gis bzlas brjod byas nas thal lcag gis bsnun nas 'tsho bar 'dod par byed pa ste 'di la ni 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sngags pa gang gis bzlas brjod byas nas thal lcag gis bsnun nas 'tsho bar 'dod par byed pa ste 'di la ni 'khrug pa med pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
translated: If a mantra practitioner, having recited a mantra, wishes to kill by striking with a palm-strike, then since there is no conflict here, there is no downfall.

original: rdeg pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rdeg pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the forty-eighth downfall is finished.

original: // / gzas zhes bya ba ni bshams pa'o //🔽thal mo zhes bya ba ni thal lcag go //
analyzed: // / gzas zhes bya ba ni bshams pa'o // thal mo zhes bya ba ni thal lcag go //
translated: “To strike” means to prepare.🔽“Palm-strike” means to strike with the palm of the hand.

original: thur ma'i chags pa zhes bya ba ni thur ma'i bam po'o //
analyzed: thur ma'i chags pa zhes bya ba ni thur ma'i bam po'o //
translated: “A bundle of sticks” means a bundle of sticks.

original: thag pa'i chun po zhes bya ba ni thag pa bsdoms pa'o //
analyzed: thag pa'i chun po zhes bya ba ni thag pa bsdoms pa'o //
translated: “A bundle of rope” means a bundle of rope.

original: gzas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the forty-ninth downfall is finished.

original: // / so sor brtag gam zhes bya ba ni mtho btsams pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: // / so sor brtag gam zhes bya ba ni mtho btsams pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “To examine” means to investigate.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan pa'i yul te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan pa'i yul te /
translated: “The level of the spiritual practitioner” refers to the object of meditation.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “to enter into meditative absorption.”

original: rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi mdo zhes bya ba ni yang dag par ldan pa'i lung las 'byung ste /🔽gleng gzhi ni mnyan yod na ste /
analyzed: rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi mdo zhes bya ba ni yang dag par ldan pa'i lung las 'byung ste / gleng gzhi ni mnyan yod na ste /
translated: The Sutra of the Jeta Grove states:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said to the monks:🔽Monks, you should abandon what is not yours.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyi ma yin pa gang yin pa de spongs shig / khyed kyis chos de spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyi ma yin pa gang yin pa de spongs shig / khyed kyis chos de spang bar bya'o //
translated: You should abandon that phenomenon.

original: khyed kyis chos de spangs na yun ring po'i don dang phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed kyis chos de spangs na yun ring po'i don dang phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you abandon that phenomenon, it will be for your benefit and happiness for a long time.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyi ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyi ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, what is not yours?

original: dge slong dag mig ni khyed kyi ma yin te spongs shig / khyed kyis chos de spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag mig ni khyed kyi ma yin te spongs shig / khyed kyis chos de spang bar bya'o //
translated: Monks, the eyes are not yours. Abandon them.

original: khyed kyis chos de spangs na yun ring po'i don dang phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed kyis chos de spangs na yun ring po'i don dang phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you abandon them, it will be for your benefit and happiness for a long time.

original: dge slong dag / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni khyed kyi ma yin te spongs shig /
analyzed: dge slong dag / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni khyed kyi ma yin te spongs shig /
translated: Monks, the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty are not yours. Abandon them.

original: @160a * // khyod kyis chos de spangs na yun ring po'i don dang phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @160a * // khyod kyis chos de spangs na yun ring po'i don dang phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you give up that dharma, it will be for your long-term benefit and welfare.

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: Monks, what do you think?

original: rgyal byed tshal de na rtsva dang / shing dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma gang yin pa de skye bos brkus sam /
analyzed: rgyal byed tshal de na rtsva dang / shing dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma gang yin pa de skye bos brkus sam /
translated: Have people stolen the grass, sticks, leaves, and foliage in the Jeta Grove?

original: bsregs sam / bcad dam /
analyzed: bsregs sam / bcad dam /
translated: Have they burned them, cut them down, destroyed them, or let them dry up?

original: bshig gam / chud gsan tam rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du byas na 'di ltar khyed 'di snyam du bdag gi 'di skye bos brkus sam /🔽bsregs sam / bcad dam /
analyzed: bshig gam / chud gsan tam rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du byas na 'di ltar khyed 'di snyam du bdag gi 'di skye bos brkus sam / bsregs sam / bcad dam /
translated: Or have they used them as conditions? In this way, do you think, ‘People have stolen our grass, sticks, leaves, and foliage,🔽burned them, cut them down, destroyed them, or let them dry up?

original: bshig gam / chud gsan tam rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du byas so snyam du sems sam /
analyzed: bshig gam / chud gsan tam rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du byas so snyam du sems sam /
translated: Or have they used them as conditions?’”

original: btsun pa mi sems so //
