translated: It is the sun means it is also a wheel like the sun.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo yang byed ces bya ba ni mgal me rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo 'dra bar bskor ba'o //🔽reg gam zhes bya ba ni reg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo yang byed ces bya ba ni mgal me rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo 'dra bar bskor ba'o // reg gam zhes bya ba ni reg par byed pa'o //
translated: It is a fire wheel means it is a wheel like a fire wheel.🔽It is touch means it is touch.

original: reg tu 'jud na zhes bya ba ni reg tu 'jud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: reg tu 'jud na zhes bya ba ni reg tu 'jud par byed pa'o //
translated: If it is made to touch means if it is made to touch.

original: dbu skra dang sen mo'i mchod rten zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu skra dang / sen mo dag blangs nas mchod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbu skra dang sen mo'i mchod rten zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu skra dang / sen mo dag blangs nas mchod pa'i phyir /
translated: The so-called stupas of hair and nail are stupas made from the Tathagata's hair and nails that were taken for worship.

original: mchod rten gang dag byas pa'o //
analyzed: mchod rten gang dag byas pa'o //
translated: “Stūpas of hair and nails” are those stūpas that were made in order to venerate the Tathāgata’s hair and nails that were taken.

original: dus yun ring du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni las zin gyi bar gyi yun ring por ro //🔽dus byin gyis brlabs par sbar bar byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus kyang med la byin gyis kyang ma brlabs par spang bar byed pa la sogs pa la ltung byed du 'gyur bar gsungs so //
analyzed: dus yun ring du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni las zin gyi bar gyi yun ring por ro // dus byin gyis brlabs par sbar bar byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus kyang med la byin gyis kyang ma brlabs par spang bar byed pa la sogs pa la ltung byed du 'gyur bar gsungs so //
translated: “For a long time” means for a long time until the work is finished.🔽If one lights a fire without a reason and without consecrating the time, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dus yod la byin gyis ma brlabs par sbar bar byed pa la sogs pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dus yod la byin gyis ma brlabs par sbar bar byed pa la sogs pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: If one lights a fire without a reason and without consecrating the time, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: me ma mur zhes bya ba ni thal bar gyur pa la thug pa'o //
analyzed: me ma mur zhes bya ba ni thal bar gyur pa la thug pa'o //
translated: “Embers” means up to ashes.

original: mer skra la sogs pa 'jud pa nyes byas zhes gsungs pa ni reg tu 'jud pa dang gnyis kyis bcug pa med pa'i phyir na smad do //
analyzed: mer skra la sogs pa 'jud pa nyes byas zhes gsungs pa ni reg tu 'jud pa dang gnyis kyis bcug pa med pa'i phyir na smad do //
translated: The statement that it is a minor offense to place one’s hair, etc., in a fire is a deprecation because it is not a case of placing it in a fire with both hands.

original: me la reg pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: me la reg pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fiftieth chapter on the offense of touching fire is completed.

original: // / brel ba zhes bya ba ni yid brel ba nyid do //
analyzed: // / brel ba zhes bya ba ni yid brel ba nyid do //
translated: “Distraction” means mental distraction.

original: @162a * // bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbyung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: @162a * // bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dbyung bar bya ba'o //
translated: “Should be produced” means should be emitted.

original: gya tshom du zhes bya ba ni ci de rgyu de nye bar zhi ba'am 'on te ma zhi zhes rnam par ma dpyad par ro //
analyzed: gya tshom du zhes bya ba ni ci de rgyu de nye bar zhi ba'am 'on te ma zhi zhes rnam par ma dpyad par ro //
translated: “Carelessly” means without investigating whether the cause has been pacified or not.

original: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni rigs pas yin yang btsan thabs kyis ma gus pas so //
analyzed: nan gyis zhes bya ba ni rigs pas yin yang btsan thabs kyis ma gus pas so //
translated: “Forcefully” means with disrespect, even if it is done with reason.

original: kho bos 'dun pa ma phul lo zhes bya ba ni yul de las ma dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bos 'dun pa ma phul lo zhes bya ba ni yul de las ma dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “I did not offer the invitation” means because of lack of faith in that place.

original: kho bos 'dun pa nyes par phul lo zhes bya ba ni ma brtags par phul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bos 'dun pa nyes par phul lo zhes bya ba ni ma brtags par phul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “I offered the invitation improperly” means because it was offered without examination.

original: spong ba'i chos su byed cing zhes bya ba ni ston cing 'gog par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spong ba'i chos su byed cing zhes bya ba ni ston cing 'gog par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase they make it a point to reject means that they teach and stop it.

original: 'dun pa phyir sgyur ba'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dun pa phyir sgyur ba'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fifty-third downfall of a novice monk is explained.

original: // / re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni nub gnyis las lhag par ma nyal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni nub gnyis las lhag par ma nyal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase at that time the Buddha was not yet establishing the bases of training for the monks means that he had not yet prohibited sleeping more than two nights in a non-monastery.

original: lo ma ma yin pa'i spyil bu zhes bya ba ni sprul pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma ma yin pa'i spyil bu zhes bya ba ni sprul pa byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase a hut without leaves means a hut made of grass.

original: sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa'i gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa chen po'o //
analyzed: sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa'i gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa chen po'o //
translated: The phrase a great snake with virulent poison means a large snake with virulent poison.

original: tshad ces bya ba ni khung ngo //
analyzed: tshad ces bya ba ni khung ngo //
translated: The phrase a hole means a hole.

original: dngos btsan pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur na pha rol gyi yul 'khor phebs par nus na bdag nyid ma song na phebs par mi nus so //
analyzed: dngos btsan pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur na pha rol gyi yul 'khor phebs par nus na bdag nyid ma song na phebs par mi nus so //
translated: The phrase a powerful army means an army that can conquer the territory of another country if it is present, but cannot do so if it is not present.

original: dge slong ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni zhes par mdzad la zhes bya ba ni sdod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni zhes par mdzad la zhes bya ba ni sdod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “The nuns who have not yet come” means those who have not yet arrived. “He will not send them away” means he will not dismiss them.

original: phyir gtong bar mi mdzad ces bya ba ni 'jog par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: phyir gtong bar mi mdzad ces bya ba ni 'jog par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “He will not expel them” means he will not banish them.

original: dgra bcom pa'i sgo nga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sgo nga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Possessing the egg of an arhat” means possessing the seed of an arhat.

original: 'khru ba'i nad ces bya ba ni 'khru bag gi nad do //
analyzed: 'khru ba'i nad ces bya ba ni 'khru bag gi nad do //
translated: “A disease of the bowels” means a disease of the intestines.

original: lhan cig 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gcig tu'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gcig tu'o //
translated: “Sitting together” means in the same maṇḍala.

original: nye 'khor du spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas khang gi sgo dang 'brel ba'i khyams kyi phyogs su spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye 'khor du spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas khang gi sgo dang 'brel ba'i khyams kyi phyogs su spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: “To be abandoned in the vicinity” means to be abandoned in the direction of the courtyard connected to the door of the dwelling.

original: dge slong sdig can zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //🔽gnas par khas ma blangs pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi gnas khas ma blangs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong sdig can zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o // gnas par khas ma blangs pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi gnas khas ma blangs pa'o //
translated: “A sinful monk” means one who causes downfall.🔽“Not having accepted a residence” means not having accepted a summer residence.

original: gnas gcig tu nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas khang gcig tu nyal bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas gcig tu nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas khang gcig tu nyal bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: “One should not sleep in the same place” means one should not sleep in the same dwelling.

original: rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed de lnga bcu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed de lnga bcu bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fifty-fourth chapter, called “The Downfalls,” is completed.

original: // / sdig pa can gyi lta ba rnam pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / sdig pa can gyi lta ba rnam pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The view of what is objectionable as non-objectionable

original: sdig pa can gyi lta ba zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa'i chos la skur ba 'debs pas log pa'i shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi lta ba zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa'i chos la skur ba 'debs pas log pa'i shes pa yin gyi /
translated: The view of what is objectionable as non-objectionable is a wrong view, because it is a denial of the factors that obstruct.

original: log pa'i lta @162b ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: log pa'i lta @162b ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a wrong view,

original: lta ba log na sdom pa yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba log na sdom pa yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were a wrong view, then the vows would not exist.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: The term “view” means a category.

original: byung ste zhes bya ba ni skyes pa ste khyim pa dag gis kyang dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir bar du gcad pa'i chos de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa skyes pa'o //
analyzed: byung ste zhes bya ba ni skyes pa ste khyim pa dag gis kyang dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir bar du gcad pa'i chos de dag bsten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa skyes pa'o //
translated: “Arises” means is produced. It arises in the form of the view that even householders who see the result of the religious life think that even if they practice those factors that obstruct, they will not be obstructed.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos kyi gegs byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos kyi gegs byed pa'o //
translated: “Factors that obstruct” means that which obstructs virtuous qualities.

original: bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos kyi bgegs byed par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos kyi bgegs byed par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “There will be no obstacles” means that they will not be able to create an obstruction to wholesome dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das la skur ba ma 'debs shig ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma spong shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la skur ba ma 'debs shig ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma spong shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “Do not disparage the Lord” means do not reject the omniscience of the Lord.

original: bcom ldan 'das la skur bas legs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la skur bas legs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “It will not be good for you to disparage the Lord” means that an undesirable karmic maturation will occur.

original: zhal gyi bzhes pa'i phyir skur par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: zhal gyi bzhes pa'i phyir skur par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: Thinking that “it will not be a disparagement because of the Lord’s acceptance,”

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni de skad mi gsung ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the Lord said, “The Lord does not speak in that way.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de skad mi gsung bar ji ltar shes snyam pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de skad mi gsung bar ji ltar shes snyam pa la /
translated: Thinking, “How do I know that the Lord does not speak in that way?”

original: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams kyi bar du gcod pa nyid do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams kyi bar du gcod pa nyid do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mar gsungs te /
translated: the Lord said, “The Lord has said in many ways that the obstruction of the dharmas that obstruct is obstruction.”

original: gang gi phyir bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams ni tshul khrims 'chal bar byed pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas de lta bu byas ma thag tu dge slong du mi rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams ni tshul khrims 'chal bar byed pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas de lta bu byas ma thag tu dge slong du mi rung bar 'gyur //
translated: Because the Lord has said that those who interrupt the path to the higher realms and liberation are immoral, and that as soon as they commit such an act, they are no longer monks.

original: dge sbyong du mi rung /
analyzed: dge sbyong du mi rung /
translated: They are no longer ascetics.

original: sh'akya'i sras kyi mi rung /
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras kyi mi rung /
translated: They are no longer sons of the Śākya.

original: dge slong gi dngos po las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dngos po las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: They have fallen from the state of a monk.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul zhig par 'gyur zhing nyams pas bcom pa ltung ba pham par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul zhig par 'gyur zhing nyams pas bcom pa ltung ba pham par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They have destroyed the ascetic path, and have fallen, been defeated, and are ruined.🔽Their ascetic path is beyond training.

original: de'i dge sbyong gi tshul phyir bslab du med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs du mas bar du gcod pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la ni lan 'ga' yang de skad mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: de'i dge sbyong gi tshul phyir bslab du med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs du mas bar du gcod pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la ni lan 'ga' yang de skad mi gsung ngo //
translated: The Lord has never said such things.

original: lung dang 'gal ba nyid du bstan nas mngon sum dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba nyid du bstan nas mngon sum dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having shown how this contradicts scripture, to show how it contradicts direct perception, he says:

original: de dag brten na bar du gcod pa nyid du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag brten na bar du gcod pa nyid du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: If one relies on them, they become obstacles.

original: ma chags pa la stsogs pa dang mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma chags pa la stsogs pa dang mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are in opposition to nonattachment, etc., and to direct intuition.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: In every way means by one’s inner nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyis so //🔽gtam 'dre bar mi byed ces bya ba @163a * //🔽ni lung 'bogs pa sbyin pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyis so // gtam 'dre bar mi byed ces bya ba @163a * // ni lung 'bogs pa sbyin pas so //
translated: In every respect means by one’s outer nature.🔽One should not converse with them means one should not give instruction.

original: phebs par smra bar mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis 'dri ba sbyin pas so //
analyzed: phebs par smra bar mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis 'dri ba sbyin pas so //
translated: One should not speak to them means one should not ask questions.

original: dper na gdol bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nges pa kho nar yongs su spang bar bya ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na gdol bu bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nges pa kho nar yongs su spang bar bya ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like an outcaste means this is stated in order to demonstrate that they are to be definitely rejected.

original: smad pa zhes bya ba ni smad par bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ste bshung zhing smad pa yin no //
analyzed: smad pa zhes bya ba ni smad par bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ste bshung zhing smad pa yin no //
translated: They are despised means they are established as despised, i.e., they are to be shunned and despised.

original: mchog tu smad pa zhes bya ba ni gnas nas dbyung zhing spang ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu smad pa zhes bya ba ni gnas nas dbyung zhing spang ba'o //
translated: The most reprehensible means that one is expelled and abandoned.

original: dge slong gi tshul gyis bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong gi tshul gyis bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said, it does not become an obstruction to the state of a monk.

original: 'dir dge slong gi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims ma 'chal ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir dge slong gi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims ma 'chal ba'o //
translated: Here, the state of a monk means not having corrupted morality.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa mi gtong ba'i ltung byed de lnga bcu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa mi gtong ba'i ltung byed de lnga bcu lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fifty-fifth downfall of abandoning the aspects of the view is completed.

original: // / de skad zer ba zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams log par smra ba'o //🔽chos bzhin ma byas pa ni phyir bcos pa ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: // / de skad zer ba zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams log par smra ba'o // chos bzhin ma byas pa ni phyir bcos pa ma byas pa'o //
translated: Saying thus means speaking falsely about the obstructing factors.🔽Not acting in accordance with the Dharma means not making amends.

original: chos dang mthun par ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin phyir ma blangs pa ste legs par ma sbyangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos dang mthun par ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin phyir ma blangs pa ste legs par ma sbyangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not acting in accordance with the Dharma means not taking back one's nature, which means not properly purifying.

original: na bar gyur pa dang sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa de dang dpral bar 'dod pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i dbang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: na bar gyur pa dang sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa de dang dpral bar 'dod pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i dbang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: There is no offense if one is sick, or if one has the view of sinners, or if one has the view that one falls into bad rebirths by saying, “There is no offense.”

original: ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense.

original: spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fifty-sixth permutation of the downfall of turning away from the training is finished.

original: // / rdzu 'phrul yang mngon par bsgrubs so zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: // / rdzu 'phrul yang mngon par bsgrubs so zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: “Having accomplished supernatural powers” means having generated them.

original: thos pa'i nyen kor nas spangs te zhes bya ba ni gang du las de mi thos pa der bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thos pa'i nyen kor nas spangs te zhes bya ba ni gang du las de mi thos pa der bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having turned away from the vicinity of the ears” means having been led to a place where one does not hear that karma.

original: bsnyil gyis gzhan du song shig ces bya ba ni thag shin tu ring por gzhan song shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsnyil gyis gzhan du song shig ces bya ba ni thag shin tu ring por gzhan song shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having been dismissed, go elsewhere” means having been sent far away to another place.

original: bsnyil ba sdud pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsnyil ba sdud pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The fifty-seventh permutation of the downfall of turning away from the training is finished.

original: // / ri rab kyi bang rim zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi bar rim ltar byung ba'i bang rim mo //
analyzed: // / ri rab kyi bang rim zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi bar rim ltar byung ba'i bang rim mo //
translated: The “steps of Meru” are the steps that occur like the steps of a stupa.

original: gzhal med khang pa'i cha lugs zhes bya ba ni lha gang dag gzhal med khang na gnas pa dag gi cha lugs so ;
analyzed: gzhal med khang pa'i cha lugs zhes bya ba ni lha gang dag gzhal med khang na gnas pa dag gi cha lugs so ;
translated: The “appearance of a celestial palace” is the appearance of those gods who dwell in a celestial palace.

original: / rgyal rigs ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yin pas zhes bya ba ni dpa' rtul phod pa'i nga rgyal can te gzi byin dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / rgyal rigs ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yin pas zhes bya ba ni dpa' rtul phod pa'i nga rgyal can te gzi byin dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The “kṣatriyas” are those who have the pride of being heroes; they are endowed with splendor, that is, the meaning.

original: dag pa'i mtha' can zhes bya ba ni yid brtan zhing gsang ba la gtogs pa rgyal po'i drung gi mtha' na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i mtha' can zhes bya ba ni yid brtan zhing gsang ba la gtogs pa rgyal po'i drung gi mtha' na 'dug pa'o //
translated: The “end of the pure ones” are those who are trusted and belong to the secret, who sit at the end of the king’s court.

original: dam pa'i chos la gus par @163b mdzad ces bya ba ni de dag dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa lam dang bcas tshogs dang bcas pa la gus par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la gus par @163b mdzad ces bya ba ni de dag dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa lam dang bcas tshogs dang bcas pa la gus par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “They are devoted to the true Dharma” means that they are devoted to the true Dharma, nirvana together with the path and the accumulations.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa dag kyang bla mar byed de zhes bya ba gsungs te gang gi phyir rigs gsum dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos bla mar sgrub par byed cing de'i don du tshogs chen po sogs par byed pa
analyzed: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa dag kyang bla mar byed de zhes bya ba gsungs te gang gi phyir rigs gsum dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos bla mar sgrub par byed cing de'i don du tshogs chen po sogs par byed pa
translated: Because all Arhats who possess the three lineages establish the Dharma of Nirvana as supreme and for that purpose, they accumulate the great collection.

original: de'i phyir / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dam pa'i chos la gus par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dam pa'i chos la gus par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed Buddhas respect the excellent Dharma.

original: mya ngan sel mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni rga ba dang 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mya ngan gtan du zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan sel mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni rga ba dang 'chi ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mya ngan gtan du zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase who remove sorrow means that they completely pacify the sorrow of aging, death, separation from the pleasant, and so on.

original: bdag la legs 'dod ces bya ba ni bdag nyid la phan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la legs 'dod ces bya ba ni bdag nyid la phan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase who desire what is good for oneself means that they desire what is beneficial for oneself.

original: bdag nyid chen po zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase great beings means that they are nonlearners.

original: sangs rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos gus par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos gus par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase the teaching of the Buddha means the teaching of the Dharma of the Tathagata with respect.

original: rab tu dang sems med pa zhes bya ba ni ma dad pas kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dang sems med pa zhes bya ba ni ma dad pas kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: Lacking faith means being bound by lack of faith.

original: zhe sdang can zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang can zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Being angry means being associated with anger.

original: 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Being disturbed means being associated with wrath.

original: dam chos zhes bya ba ni lam dang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dam chos zhes bya ba ni lam dang bstan pa'o //
translated: The true Dharma means the path and the teachings.

original: nyes rtsom zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang zhe sdang gi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes rtsom zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang zhe sdang gi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Misdeeds means following anger and hatred.

original: btul byas shing zhes bya ba ni so sor gsal bar byas shing ngo //
analyzed: btul byas shing zhes bya ba ni so sor gsal bar byas shing ngo //
translated: Having been disciplined means having been made to understand.

original: rab dang med pa zhes bya ba ni ma dad pa'o //
analyzed: rab dang med pa zhes bya ba ni ma dad pa'o //
translated: Lacking faith means lack of faith.

original: kun nas mnar sems zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang zhe sdang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang zhe sdang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Malice means the nature of anger and hatred.

original: spong ba zhes bya ba ni mi phyogs pa'o //🔽ngam grog chung ngu dag ces bya ba ni g-yang sa chung ngu dag go //
analyzed: spong ba zhes bya ba ni mi phyogs pa'o // ngam grog chung ngu dag ces bya ba ni g-yang sa chung ngu dag go //
translated: Abandoning means not turning away.🔽Small ravines means small precipices.

original: ngam grog chen po dag ces bya ba ni g-yang sa chen po dag go //
analyzed: ngam grog chen po dag ces bya ba ni g-yang sa chen po dag go //
translated: Great ravines means great precipices.

original: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni skyes gnas dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni skyes gnas dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Loss” means being separated from what has arisen.

original: shi ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: shi ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Death” means being separated from the body.

original: bros pa zhes bya ba ni rang dag song ba'o //
analyzed: bros pa zhes bya ba ni rang dag song ba'o //
translated: “Escape” means going away on one’s own.

original: gzung ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod bzhin du khrid pa'o //🔽ma rung bas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzung ba zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod bzhin du khrid pa'o // ma rung bas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Capture” means being led away against one’s will.🔽“Ruin” means being destroyed by something else.

original: bas so zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ltar 'gyur srid par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bas so zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ltar 'gyur srid par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “also” indicates that such things are possible.

original: mi gtso bo dag ces bya ba ni rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtso bo dag ces bya ba ni rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Chief men” are kings and so on.

original: 'chos zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan byed pa'o //🔽'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug po dag ces bya ba ni rgyal chen bzhi pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mthun 'byung dang / dga' ldan dang / @164a * //
analyzed: 'chos zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan byed pa'o // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug po dag ces bya ba ni rgyal chen bzhi pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mthun 'byung dang / dga' ldan dang / @164a * //
translated: “To alter” means to make a counterfeit.

original: 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa drug po dag go //
analyzed: 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa drug po dag go //
translated: The six gods of the desire realm are the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: lan gsum yongs su sbyang ba byed du bcug ste zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'jig rten du skye bar bya ba'i phyir lan gsum gyi bar du khas len du bcug ste'o //
analyzed: lan gsum yongs su sbyang ba byed du bcug ste zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'jig rten du skye bar bya ba'i phyir lan gsum gyi bar du khas len du bcug ste'o //
translated: He made them promise three times to be reborn in the human world.

original: de yang 'dul ba'i gzhi las bzod ldan dag kho bo ni dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris 'di nas 'phos nas mi rnams kyi nang du rgyal po zas gtsang gi btsun mo dam pa'i mngal du nying mtshams sbyor ba len par 'gyur gyi khyed cang las gang bdud rtsi
analyzed: de yang 'dul ba'i gzhi las bzod ldan dag kho bo ni dga' ldan gyi lha'i ris 'di nas 'phos nas mi rnams kyi nang du rgyal po zas gtsang gi btsun mo dam pa'i mngal du nying mtshams sbyor ba len par 'gyur gyi khyed cang las gang bdud rtsi
translated: The Bases of Discipline says, “The patient ones said, ‘We will take rebirth in the womb of the chief queen of King Shuddhodana among humans, after we have passed away from this Tushita god realm.

original: don du gnyer ba des kyang yul dbus kyi grong khyer chen po drug tu nying mtshams sbyor ba long shig ces lan gsum khas len du bcug go zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba des kyang yul dbus kyi grong khyer chen po drug tu nying mtshams sbyor ba long shig ces lan gsum khas len du bcug go zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: You who seek nectar, take rebirth in the six great cities of the central country.’ He made them promise three times.”

original: bla re zhes bya ba ni steng du bri ba'i bla re'o //
analyzed: bla re zhes bya ba ni steng du bri ba'i bla re'o //
translated: “Canopies” are canopies that are drawn above.

original: ae ma'o gar byas so zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar che bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o gar byas so zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar che bar bstan pa'o //
translated: “Oh, what a dance!” teaches the wonder.

original: gad mo'i sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni gad rgyangs chen po'o //
analyzed: gad mo'i sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni gad rgyangs chen po'o //
translated: A great sound of laughter is a loud laugh.

original: bcos so zhes grag ces bya ba la grag ces smod pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcos so zhes grag ces bya ba la grag ces smod pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that it is a fabrication is said in order to indicate a hidden meaning.

original: sgra mi snyan zhes bya ba ni rgyal po sgra mi snyan gyi byung ba'i mtha' des brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgra mi snyan zhes bya ba ni rgyal po sgra mi snyan gyi byung ba'i mtha' des brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The story of King Druma is told in order to illustrate that.

original: tha dad pa ma yin par gdags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin par gdags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to indicate that it is not different, he says,

original: cha lugs zhes bya ba ni cha lugs kyi ched kyi gos so //
analyzed: cha lugs zhes bya ba ni cha lugs kyi ched kyi gos so //
translated: Costume refers to clothing for the sake of costume.

original: gsar pa gsar pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni de dga' ba yin pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsar pa gsar pa yin par dgongs so zhes bya ba ni de dga' ba yin pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He intends that it is new, because it is delightful and because it is primary.

original: btsag ces bya ba ni sa'i khams te /
analyzed: btsag ces bya ba ni sa'i khams te /
translated: Dye refers to the element earth.

original: de ni grags pa'i phyir dpe yin no //
analyzed: de ni grags pa'i phyir dpe yin no //
translated: That is an example because it is well known.

original: shing shun zhes bya ba ni bsku ba'i tshon te de ni me tog la sogs pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: shing shun zhes bya ba ni bsku ba'i tshon te de ni me tog la sogs pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: Bark is a dye that is an example of a flower, etc.

original: gyon na'o zhes bya ba ni gos kyi longs spyod ni lus dkri ba yin pas de bstan pa yin pas de bsten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyon na'o zhes bya ba ni gos kyi longs spyod ni lus dkri ba yin pas de bstan pa yin pas de bsten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one wears it means that the enjoyment of clothing is to cover the body, so that is taught. Therefore, it is for the purpose of using it.

original: tha na lhung bzed kyi kha yogs kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re lhung bzed kyi kha yogs zhes bya bar khru gang gi tshad tsam yod pa de dang mnyam par gos sar pa zhig rnyed na yang kha bsgyur bar bya ba'i don yin
analyzed: tha na lhung bzed kyi kha yogs kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re lhung bzed kyi kha yogs zhes bya bar khru gang gi tshad tsam yod pa de dang mnyam par gos sar pa zhig rnyed na yang kha bsgyur bar bya ba'i don yin
translated: Even a bowl cover means that some say that a bowl cover is the size of a cubit, and if one finds a new cloth that size, it is for the purpose of dyeing it.

original: gyi lhung bzed kyi kha yogs dngos ni gos su bgo ba ma yin pas kha bsgyur mi dgos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gyi lhung bzed kyi kha yogs dngos ni gos su bgo ba ma yin pas kha bsgyur mi dgos so zhes zer ro //
translated: But the actual bowl cover is not to be worn as clothing, so it does not need to be dyed, they say.

original: kha cig na re lhung bzed kyi kha yogs kyang kha bsgyur ba nyid yin no zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re lhung bzed kyi kha yogs kyang kha bsgyur ba nyid yin no zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: Some say that even a bowl cover is to be dyed.

original: kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the fifty-eighth downfall, wearing undyed cloth, is complete.

original: // / bskal ba dang po'i mi zhes bya ba ni bskal ba @164b thog ma'i mi'o //
analyzed: // / bskal ba dang po'i mi zhes bya ba ni bskal ba @164b thog ma'i mi'o //
translated: The men of the first eon are the men of the first eon.

original: lam lam lam zhing 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni 'bar zhing 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: lam lam lam zhing 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni 'bar zhing 'dug pa'o //
translated: The burning, etc., is the burning, the blazing, the glowing.

original: sbrul dug myur du khyad par byed pa dang sbrul dug drag pa zhes smos pa ni nor ni 'jig rten gnyi gar gnon pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbrul dug myur du khyad par byed pa dang sbrul dug drag pa zhes smos pa ni nor ni 'jig rten gnyi gar gnon pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The swift-acting poison and the strong poison are mentioned in order to show that they are to be abandoned because they destroy wealth and oppress both worlds.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po lhas byin gyis nye bar bskor bas zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po lhas byin gyis nye bar bskor bas zhes bya ba ni sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa'o //
translated: The wicked friend Devadatta is the wicked friend who is close by.

original: khyim gyi 'byor ba dag ces bya ba ni khyim gyi longs spyod bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: khyim gyi 'byor ba dag ces bya ba ni khyim gyi longs spyod bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The household goods are the household goods, the food, drink, etc.

original: gnya' zungs brgyud mo zhes bya ba ni gnya' ba nas dbul ba brgyud pa ste dang pos gnya' ba nas phul te gnyis pa'i lag tu btang ba la ;
analyzed: gnya' zungs brgyud mo zhes bya ba ni gnya' ba nas dbul ba brgyud pa ste dang pos gnya' ba nas phul te gnyis pa'i lag tu btang ba la ;
translated: The succession of the yoke is the succession of the yoke from the neck, that is, the first yoke is placed on the neck and the second is placed on the hand.

original: gnyis pas gnya' ba nas bzung ste gsum pa'i lag tu btang ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis pas gnya' ba nas bzung ste gsum pa'i lag tu btang ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The second one takes him by the neck, and the third one hands him over to the executioners.

original: mi gos sngon po gyon pa zhes bya ba ni gshed ma rnams kyi rtag yin no //
analyzed: mi gos sngon po gyon pa zhes bya ba ni gshed ma rnams kyi rtag yin no //
translated: He is dressed in a blue robe, which is the usual dress of executioners.

original: ka ra b'i ra'i me tog dmar po dag mgrin par bcings pa zhes bya ba ni gsad pa dag gi rtags yin no //
analyzed: ka ra b'i ra'i me tog dmar po dag mgrin par bcings pa zhes bya ba ni gsad pa dag gi rtags yin no //
translated: He has a garland of red karavīra flowers around his neck, which is the sign of those who are to be executed.

original: byung rgyal du smras zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par glong pos su smra ba'o //
analyzed: byung rgyal du smras zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par glong pos su smra ba'o //
translated: He is shouting out incoherently, which means that he is talking incoherently.

original: 'di ni re zhig 'byung ba yin te zhes bya ba ni rin po che la reg pa'i nyes dmigs snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig 'byung ba yin te zhes bya ba ni rin po che la reg pa'i nyes dmigs snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the way it happens, which means that the disadvantages of touching precious things are evident.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dge slong rnams kyi ma reg phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni dge slong rnams kyi ma reg phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha does not lay down a training rule right away, because the monks have not yet touched the precious things.

original: 'phong gi dpong sa zhes bya ba ni mtshon gyi sgyu rtsal la bslab pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'phong gi dpong sa zhes bya ba ni mtshon gyi sgyu rtsal la bslab pa'i gnas so //
translated: The archery range is the place where they train in the art of handling weapons.

original: g-yon 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni lag pa g-yon pas mda' 'phags pa ste nyam nga lag tu 'phen du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: g-yon 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni lag pa g-yon pas mda' 'phags pa ste nyam nga lag tu 'phen du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The left-handed is one who shoots arrows with the left hand, meaning one who shoots arrows with the left hand.

original: g-yas 'phangs la sogs pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas 'phangs la sogs pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The right-handed and so on should be understood in the same way.

original: gom stangs zhes bya ba ni g-yas brkyang la sogs par rkang pa gzhag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: gom stangs zhes bya ba ni g-yas brkyang la sogs par rkang pa gzhag par byas pa'o //
translated: The gait is the placement of the foot in the right-extended and so on.

original: rked chings kyis bcings te zhes bya ba ni rked chings kyis bdag nyid kyi lto phyogs bcings pa'o //
analyzed: rked chings kyis bcings te zhes bya ba ni rked chings kyis bdag nyid kyi lto phyogs bcings pa'o //
translated: The waist-bound is one who binds the stomach area with a waist-band.

original: bcad pa byas pas zhes bya ba ni dbyug pa la sogs pa'i 'ben btsugs pa bcad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcad pa byas pas zhes bya ba ni dbyug pa la sogs pa'i 'ben btsugs pa bcad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The target-cutter is one who cuts a target set up with a stick and so on, meaning one who cuts a target.

original: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rin po che la ma reg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rin po che la ma reg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, the Blessed One does not lay down a training precept for the hearers in the Vinaya, saying, One should not touch precious things.

original: rol mo'i dpong sa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rol mo'i dpong sa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regarding the music ground,

original: rol mo zhes bya ba ni lha rnams kyi g-yog 'khor ba dri za zhes bya ba la glu dang rol mo'i sgra la mkhas pa de dag gi sgyu rtsal glu dbyangs gang yin pa de rol mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rol mo zhes bya ba ni lha rnams kyi g-yog 'khor ba dri za zhes bya ba la glu dang rol mo'i sgra la mkhas pa de dag gi sgyu rtsal glu dbyangs gang yin pa de rol mo zhes bya'o //
translated: “Music” refers to the gandharvas, who are the attendants of the gods. They are skilled in singing and playing instruments. The art of singing and playing instruments is called “music.”

original: @165a * // de ston pa'i gnas ni rol mo'i dpong sa yin no //
analyzed: @165a * // de ston pa'i gnas ni rol mo'i dpong sa yin no //
translated: The place where that is taught is called “the music hall.”

original: drug ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra'i bye brag go //
analyzed: drug ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra'i bye brag go //
translated: “Six-fold” and so on refers to the different types of sound.

original: de dag 'byin pa ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'byin pa ni byed pa'o //
translated: “Producing” means making.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rin po che la reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rin po che la reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not establish the bases of training” because he does not touch jewels.

original: gnod sbyin gyi nor zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gyi phyir byin pa'i nor ro //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi nor zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gyi phyir byin pa'i nor ro //
translated: “Wealth of the yakshas” is wealth given to the yakshas.

original: rdul gyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni sa rdul gyi gnas so //
analyzed: rdul gyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni sa rdul gyi gnas so //
translated: “A heap of dust” is a place of dust.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba yang rin po che'i la sogs pa la reg par 'jig rten gyis smad pa ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar mi mdzad do zhes bya ba yang rin po che'i la sogs pa la reg par 'jig rten gyis smad pa ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He does not establish the bases of training” because the world would criticize him for touching jewels and so on.

original: yo byad rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang / ril ba la sogs pa khrus kyi snod dag go ;
analyzed: yo byad rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang / ril ba la sogs pa khrus kyi snod dag go ;
translated: “Various articles” are the various articles for bathing, such as pitchers and ewers.

original: / so phag ces bya ba ni drud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: / so phag ces bya ba ni drud par bya ba'o //
translated: “Bricks” are for rubbing.

original: bska ba zhes bya ba ni spu dbyi ba la sogs pa'i sman no //
analyzed: bska ba zhes bya ba ni spu dbyi ba la sogs pa'i sman no //
translated: “Astringent” is a medicine for removing body hair, etc.

original: skyed mos tshal du spyad pa zhes bya ba ni skyed mos tshal du dgos pa'o //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal du spyad pa zhes bya ba ni skyed mos tshal du dgos pa'o //
translated: “For use in a pleasure garden” is for use in a pleasure garden.

original: g-yul ngor spyad pa'i zhes bya ba ni g-yul ngor dgos pa'o //🔽rin po che zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog zhing rin chen gser la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yul ngor spyad pa'i zhes bya ba ni g-yul ngor dgos pa'o // rin po che zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog zhing rin chen gser la sogs pa'o //
translated: “For use in battle” is for use in battle.🔽“Precious” means precious things such as gold.

original: rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba ni rin po che dang 'dra ba mtshon cha dang rol mo'i cha spyad do //
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba ni rin po che dang 'dra ba mtshon cha dang rol mo'i cha spyad do //
translated: “Precious things” are weapons and musical instruments that are like precious things.

original: rin po che dang 'dra bar bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che dang 'dra bar bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called “precious things” because they are like precious things and because they bring about happiness.

original: sna ma'i yal ga zhes bya ba ni sna ma'i lcug phran gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: sna ma'i yal ga zhes bya ba ni sna ma'i lcug phran gyi tshogs so //
translated: “A branch of jasmine” is a cluster of jasmine sprouts.

original: kun dga'i ra ba gtogs pa na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi sa gzhir gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du ltung ba'o //
analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba gtogs pa na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi sa gzhir gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du ltung ba'o //
translated: Sitting in the courtyard of the monastery means falling outside the monastery on the ground of the monastery.

original: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang gi nang du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang gi nang du 'dug pa'o //
translated: Sitting in the dwelling means sitting inside the dwelling.

original: rgyan la nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan 'dod cing rgyan don du gnyer ba ste /
analyzed: rgyan la nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ba ni rgyan 'dod cing rgyan don du gnyer ba ste /
translated: Using ornaments means desiring ornaments and striving for ornaments.

original: yang dang yang du rgyan tshol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dang yang du rgyan tshol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means seeking ornaments again and again.

original: nor chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du nor nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nor chud mi za ba zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du nor nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not wasting wealth means wealth does not diminish for as long as one lives.

original: sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu zhes bya ba ni sre mo'i rnam pa 'dra ba kha rub pa'i snod do //
analyzed: sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu zhes bya ba ni sre mo'i rnam pa 'dra ba kha rub pa'i snod do //
translated: A bag like a cat means a container with a mouth that can be closed.

original: 'di ni sprul dug myur du khyab par byed pa yin sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu ni de na ra dag gis gang ba ma yin gyi mi len to zhes bya ba ni las kyi dbang gis de ltar mi 'khrul ba yin gyi dngos po nyid de ltar
analyzed: 'di ni sprul dug myur du khyab par byed pa yin sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu ni de na ra dag gis gang ba ma yin gyi mi len to zhes bya ba ni las kyi dbang gis de ltar mi 'khrul ba yin gyi dngos po nyid de ltar
translated: This is like the swift spread of snake venom.🔽The bladder of a tortoise is not filled with the feces of a tortoise.

original: gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is due to the power of karma, not due to the nature of the things themselves.

original: su'i yin pa de len par 'gyur grang snyam pa zhes bya ba ni sus thob par 'gyur ba des phyis len par 'gyur grang snyam pa'o //
analyzed: su'i yin pa de len par 'gyur grang snyam pa zhes bya ba ni sus thob par 'gyur ba des phyis len par 'gyur grang snyam pa'o //
translated: One might think, Who would take that which belongs to someone else?

original: cho ga zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'i gzhung lags so //🔽ma bdar ba len na nyes @165b byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nor bu ma grub pas ches na smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cho ga zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'i gzhung lags so // ma bdar ba len na nyes @165b byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nor bu ma grub pas ches na smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ritual refers to the scriptures of philosophical systems.🔽If one takes what has not been offered, it becomes a misdeed means that if one takes a gem that has not been established, it is censured.

original: nor bu mchid bu len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bu dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu mchid bu len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bu dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one takes a gem that has been offered, it also becomes a misdeed means that it is like taking a son.

original: sog ma'i phreng ba len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rin po che'i phreng ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sog ma'i phreng ba len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rin po che'i phreng ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one takes a garland of straw, there is an offense of wrong conduct, because it is like a garland of jewels.

original: 'od ma zhes bya ba ni ku ba 'od ma can la 'dir 'od ces bya ba'i gling bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'od ma zhes bya ba ni ku ba 'od ma can la 'dir 'od ces bya ba'i gling bu ni ma yin te /
translated: Reed means a reed plant, not a flute called “reed” here,

original: de la rgyud kyi sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rgyud kyi sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no application of a reed to it.

original: ba la ri dang ma ha ti dang su ko sha ka zhes bya ba dag kyang rgyud can gyi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: ba la ri dang ma ha ti dang su ko sha ka zhes bya ba dag kyang rgyud can gyi bye brag yin no //
translated: Bheri, mahati, and sukoshaka are also varieties of reed.

original: mchu sbrang zhes bya ba ni shing bu las byas pa rgyud gcig par 'dug pa byis pa dag rtse ba'i cha spyad yin no /
analyzed: mchu sbrang zhes bya ba ni shing bu las byas pa rgyud gcig par 'dug pa byis pa dag rtse ba'i cha spyad yin no /
translated: Beak-bee means a toy of children made of wood, which is a single reed.

original: sgra 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni bud du rung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni bud du rung ba'o //
translated: Sound-maker means suitable for making sound.

original: rdza rnga kha gcig pa len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sgra chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdza rnga kha gcig pa len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sgra chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one takes a single-headed drum, there is an offense of wrong conduct, because it makes little sound.

original: gzhu'u zhes bya ba ni ras bal rmal ba la dgos pa'i gzhu'o //
analyzed: gzhu'u zhes bya ba ni ras bal rmal ba la dgos pa'i gzhu'o //
translated: Bow means a bow needed for spinning cotton.

original: mda' ltar bcos pa zhes bya ba ni shing bu la sogs pa dag las ltong tsam gtod cing 'ol byi tsam mda' 'dra ba byis pa dag 'phen pa yang yin no //
analyzed: mda' ltar bcos pa zhes bya ba ni shing bu la sogs pa dag las ltong tsam gtod cing 'ol byi tsam mda' 'dra ba byis pa dag 'phen pa yang yin no //
translated: The arrow-shaped is when one makes a hole in a piece of wood, etc., and makes a notch in the end, and then shoots it like an arrow.

original: sku gdung dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: sku gdung dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: If one takes it with a relic, there is an immediate offense.🔽If one takes it without a relic, there is an offense.

original: sku gdung med pa len na nyes su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sku gzugs rin po che las byas pa nyid yin yang sku gdung med na mthar thug pa ma yin pas na smad do //
analyzed: sku gdung med pa len na nyes su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sku gzugs rin po che las byas pa nyid yin yang sku gdung med na mthar thug pa ma yin pas na smad do //
translated: This means that even if the image is made of precious materials, if it does not have a relic, it is not ultimate and is therefore despised.

original: ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag ste len na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i blos rin po che'i blo ldog pa'i phyir ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag ste len na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i blos rin po che'i blo ldog pa'i phyir ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: If one takes it with the perception of the Teacher, there is no offense. This means that there is no offense because one turns away from the perception of precious materials with the perception of the Teacher.

original: sgra 'byin pa'i tshal gseb dag tu zhes bya ba ni sgra 'byin pas mdzes pa byas pa'i tshal gseb dag tu'o //
analyzed: sgra 'byin pa'i tshal gseb dag tu zhes bya ba ni sgra 'byin pas mdzes pa byas pa'i tshal gseb dag tu'o //
translated: In groves that are beautiful with the sounds of birds means in groves that are made beautiful by the sounds of birds.

original: bya dga' zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bya dga' zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: A reward means a gift of joy.

original: longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the fifty-ninth line of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra is finished.

original: // / chu dron gsum zhes bya ba ni khrus kyi 'bab chu gsum mo //
analyzed: // / chu dron gsum zhes bya ba ni khrus kyi 'bab chu gsum mo //
translated: “Three hot springs” means three hot spring baths.

original: de'i tshe na bdag stong par bgyid la zhes bya ba ni bsdad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na bdag stong par bgyid la zhes bya ba ni bsdad par bya ba'o //
translated: “I will purify myself” means I will stay there.

original: dri ma'i rdzas kyis gos pa'i lus zhes bya ba ni dri ma'i rdzas kyis 'bags pa'i lus so //
analyzed: dri ma'i rdzas kyis gos pa'i lus zhes bya ba ni dri ma'i rdzas kyis 'bags pa'i lus so //
translated: “A body soiled by filth” means a body smeared with filth.

original: dri ma'i rdzas 'chang bas 'dag par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni de la nyon mongs pa spong par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dri ma'i rdzas 'chang bas 'dag par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni de la nyon mongs pa spong par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Will purification come from carrying filth?” means will defilement be removed from that?

original: skya bo bseng bseng po zhes bya ba ni skya bo'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: skya bo bseng bseng po zhes bya ba ni skya bo'i rnam pa'o //
translated: “Pale and emaciated” means pale in appearance.

original: mngon par ltar zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsher ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par ltar zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsher ba'o //
translated: “Very moist” means very wet.

original: zla ba phyed cing khrus bya bar gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi @166a * //
analyzed: zla ba phyed cing khrus bya bar gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi @166a * //
translated: “It is taught that one should bathe every half month” means that one should bathe every fifteen days.

original: nyin mo khrus byas par gyur pa de nyid kyi nyin mo yang khrus gzhan mi bya ste nyi ma de nyid kyang nyi ma gcig tu brtsi zhing de nas brtsams te /
analyzed: nyin mo khrus byas par gyur pa de nyid kyi nyin mo yang khrus gzhan mi bya ste nyi ma de nyid kyang nyi ma gcig tu brtsi zhing de nas brtsams te /
translated: On the very day that one bathes, one should not bathe again on that very day, but should count that day as one day.

original: zhag bco lnga'i mdun rol zhag bcu bzhi pa tshun chad kyi bar du ni khrus byar mi rung gi zhag bco lnga la khrus byar rung bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhag bco lnga'i mdun rol zhag bcu bzhi pa tshun chad kyi bar du ni khrus byar mi rung gi zhag bco lnga la khrus byar rung bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: From that day on, it is said that bathing is not allowed until the fourteenth day, prior to the fifteenth day. Bathing is allowed on the fifteenth day.

original: de las 'dums par byed na zhes bya ba ni gang gi nyin mo khrus byas par gyur pa de nyid kyi nyin mo yang nyi ma gcig tu brtsi zhing de nas brtsams te zhag bco lnga pa la khrus bya bar gsungs pa de las 'dums par byed pa
analyzed: de las 'dums par byed na zhes bya ba ni gang gi nyin mo khrus byas par gyur pa de nyid kyi nyin mo yang nyi ma gcig tu brtsi zhing de nas brtsams te zhag bco lnga pa la khrus bya bar gsungs pa de las 'dums par byed pa
translated: “If one reduces that” means that on the very day that one bathes, one should count that day as one day. From that day on, it is said that bathing is allowed on the fifteenth day. If one reduces that,

original: ste / zhag bzhi bcu pa tshun chad du khrus byed na ltung byed du 'gyur bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ste / zhag bzhi bcu pa tshun chad du khrus byed na ltung byed du 'gyur bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said that if one bathes prior to the fortieth day, one commits an offense.

original: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis zhes bya ba ni lo ga'i dus rnams la zla ba gnyis yod de dpyid zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug nas /
analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis zhes bya ba ni lo ga'i dus rnams la zla ba gnyis yod de dpyid zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug nas /
translated: The remaining one and a half months of spring are the two months of spring.

original: dbyar zlar ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig dang / dbyar zlar ba tshes bcu drug nas /
analyzed: dbyar zlar ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig dang / dbyar zlar ba tshes bcu drug nas /
translated: One month is from the sixteenth day of the last spring month until the full moon of the first summer month.🔽The second month is from the sixteenth day of the first summer month until the full moon of the middle summer month.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig ni so ga'i dus rnams kyi zla ba gnyis yin no //
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig ni so ga'i dus rnams kyi zla ba gnyis yin no //
translated: The remaining one and a half months of spring are the two months of spring.

original: de la dpyid zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug nas /🔽dpyid zla tha chungs gnam stong gi bar gyi zla ba phyed bzhag ste de'i lhag ma dbyar zla ba tshes nas /🔽dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis so //
analyzed: de la dpyid zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug nas / dpyid zla tha chungs gnam stong gi bar gyi zla ba phyed bzhag ste de'i lhag ma dbyar zla ba tshes nas / dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba phyed dang gnyis so //
translated: The first half of the last spring month is from the sixteenth day of the last spring month until the thirtieth day of the last spring month.🔽The remaining one and a half months are from the first day of the first summer month until the full moon of the middle summer month.

original: dbyar rnams kyi dang po zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma'i dus rnams kyi dang po zla ba gcig ste /
analyzed: dbyar rnams kyi dang po zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma'i dus rnams kyi dang po zla ba gcig ste /
translated: The first of the summer months is the first month of the summer rainy season.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po'i chos bcu drug nas /
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po'i chos bcu drug nas /
translated: The middle month of summer has sixteen days.🔽

original: dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig go //🔽dpag tshad gcig tu song ngam zhes bya ba ni rang gi gnas nas phar song yang rung /
analyzed: dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig go // dpag tshad gcig tu song ngam zhes bya ba ni rang gi gnas nas phar song yang rung /
translated: The middle summer month is the month from the sixteenth day of the middle summer month🔽up to the full moon of the last summer month.

original: gzhan gyi gnas nas tshur 'ongs kyang rung ste spyir dpag tshad gcig pa rkyang par song ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnas nas tshur 'ongs kyang rung ste spyir dpag tshad gcig pa rkyang par song ba'o //
translated: “He has gone one league” means that he has gone just one league in total, whether he has gone from his own dwelling or come from another’s dwelling.

original: dpag tshad phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs zhes bya ba ni rang gi gnas nas phar song ste phyir 'ongs kyang rung gzhan gyi gnas nas tshur 'ongs shing phyir log kyang rung ste spyir dpag tshad phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa la dpag tshad gcig rangs par
analyzed: dpag tshad phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs zhes bya ba ni rang gi gnas nas phar song ste phyir 'ongs kyang rung gzhan gyi gnas nas tshur 'ongs shing phyir log kyang rung ste spyir dpag tshad phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa la dpag tshad gcig rangs par
translated: “He has gone half a league and returned” means that he has gone and returned, whether he has gone from his own dwelling or come from another’s dwelling, and that he has gone and returned just half a league in total.

original: song ba'i tshad dang mnyam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: song ba'i tshad dang mnyam par shes par bya'o //
translated: He should be understood to have gone the distance of one league.

original: gos kyi grva zhes bya ba ni gos kyi mtha' ma'o //
analyzed: gos kyi grva zhes bya ba ni gos kyi mtha' ma'o //
translated: “The edge of the robe” means the edge of the robe.

original: bsgul ba zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgul ba zhes bya ba ni bskyod pa'o //
translated: “To move” means to shake.

original: rdzi char zhes bya ba ni rlung dang char 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: rdzi char zhes bya ba ni rlung dang char 'dres pa ste /
translated: Rain showers are a mixture of wind and rain.

original: de'i phyir rlung dang char gyi dus gnyis las tha dad par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir rlung dang char gyi dus gnyis las tha dad par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, they are posited as separate from the two times of wind and rain.

original: dbang bskur ba'i khrus dang 'jug pa'i khrus zhes bya ba @166b gnyis ni rgyu'i bye brag gis tha dad par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i khrus dang 'jug pa'i khrus zhes bya ba @166b gnyis ni rgyu'i bye brag gis tha dad par shes par bya ste /
translated: The two, the ablution of consecration and the ablution of entry, should be understood as separate due to a difference in cause.

original: dbang bskur ba'i khrus zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pas lus kyi steng nas dbang bskur ba'i tshul du chu blugs shing des bkru'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i khrus zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pas lus kyi steng nas dbang bskur ba'i tshul du chu blugs shing des bkru'o //
translated: The ablution of consecration is when water is poured on the body in the manner of conferring initiation with a vase and so on and one is washed by that.

original: 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang du 'jug cing lus bkru ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba ni chu'i nang du 'jug cing lus bkru ba'o //
translated: The ablution of entry is when one enters the water and washes the body.🔽If the water reaches the navel, there is a downfall.

original: chus lte bar son na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lus kyi phyed gsher na khrus rdzogs pa yin pas ltung byed du bstan te /
analyzed: chus lte bar son na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lus kyi phyed gsher na khrus rdzogs pa yin pas ltung byed du bstan te /
translated: This teaches that if half the body is wet, the ablution is complete and there is a downfall.

original: de yang dbang bskur bas spyi bo nas brtsams te chus lte bar son pa dang / 'jug pas rkang mthil nas brtsams te chus lte bar son pa rnam pa gnyis ka la kha na ma tho ba re re rdzogs par 'gyur ro //🔽dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus byas nas 'jug pa khrus kyis khrus byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te dbang bskur ba dang 'jug pa gnyis ka dus gcig tu khrus rtsom pa na /
analyzed: de yang dbang bskur bas spyi bo nas brtsams te chus lte bar son pa dang / 'jug pas rkang mthil nas brtsams te chus lte bar son pa rnam pa gnyis ka la kha na ma tho ba re re rdzogs par 'gyur ro // dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus byas nas 'jug pa khrus kyis khrus byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te dbang bskur ba dang 'jug pa gnyis ka dus gcig tu khrus rtsom pa na /
translated: Moreover, in the case of the two, the water reaching the navel beginning from the crown in the case of the initiation, and the water reaching the navel beginning from the soles of the feet in the case of the entry, each of the two is a complete offense.🔽If one performs the entry ablution after performing the ablution of the initiation, and so on, if one begins the ablution of both the initiation and the entry at the same time,

original: de gnyis lte ba'i phyogs gcig tu phrad par 'gyur ba la ni kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par gcig tu 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: de gnyis lte ba'i phyogs gcig tu phrad par 'gyur ba la ni kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par gcig tu 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: it is taught that the two meeting at one place of the navel is a complete offense.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya bar zhes bya ba ni khrus kyi don nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya bar zhes bya ba ni khrus kyi don nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not regret this, because it is not the purpose of the ablution.

original: khrus byed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: khrus byed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the sixty rules is complete.

original: // / mda' lnga 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba gang la mda' lnga 'phen par byed pa de ni mda' lnga 'phangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: // / mda' lnga 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba gang la mda' lnga 'phen par byed pa de ni mda' lnga 'phangs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The five arrows are the five arrows that are shot.

original: tshod yod pa zhig go zhes bya ba ni cung zad rung ngo zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshod yod pa zhig go zhes bya ba ni cung zad rung ngo zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The one who is careful is one who thinks, A little is appropriate.

original: ras bal gyi gzhu'u bzhin du bdungs te zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kho nas bdungs te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ras bal gyi gzhu'u bzhin du bdungs te zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kho nas bdungs te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bowstring is drawn back like cotton wool means that it is drawn back with both hands.

original: rgyud sgra bsgrengs zhes bya ba ni gzhu rgyud kyi sgra bsgrengs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud sgra bsgrengs zhes bya ba ni gzhu rgyud kyi sgra bsgrengs pa'o //
translated: The bowstring is drawn back means that the bowstring is drawn back.

original: 'dir ni gtso cher dud 'gro gsod pa nyid du dgongs pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: 'dir ni gtso cher dud 'gro gsod pa nyid du dgongs pa yin gyi ;
translated: Here, the main point is killing an animal.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i skabs ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dud 'gro gsod pa'i ltung byed logs shig tu bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i skabs ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dud 'gro gsod pa'i ltung byed logs shig tu bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: The falling away of killing an animal is established separately in order to show that it is not the occasion for using water that contains living beings.

original: dud 'gro gsod pa'i ltung byed de drug cu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dud 'gro gsod pa'i ltung byed de drug cu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the sixty-first line of the Discipline with Verses is finished.

original: // / dbang po yongs su smin par zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yongs su smin cing 'bras bu thob pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: // / dbang po yongs su smin par zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams yongs su smin cing 'bras bu thob pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The phrase whose faculties are ripe means that their faculties of faith and so on are ripe and ready to attain the result.

original: nges par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase who are ready to enter means that they are ready to enter the path of seeing.

original: zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase whose contaminants are exhausted means that they have attained the state of an arhat.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba log pa'o //🔽khyed cag lo @167a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba log pa'o // khyed cag lo @167a * //
translated: The phrase whose roots of virtue have been severed means that they have adopted false views.🔽You have not completed twenty years since your full ordination. How can you enter the certainty of perfection and exhaust the contaminants?

original: nyi shu ma lon par rdzogs par bsnyen pas khyed cag nges pa la 'jug pa dang zag pa zad par 'gyur re skan zhes bya ba ni 'char kas bsams bzhin du ci nas kyang dge slong de dag tha na yud tsam zhig kyang bde ba la mi reg
analyzed: nyi shu ma lon par rdzogs par bsnyen pas khyed cag nges pa la 'jug pa dang zag pa zad par 'gyur re skan zhes bya ba ni 'char kas bsams bzhin du ci nas kyang dge slong de dag tha na yud tsam zhig kyang bde ba la mi reg
translated: The phrase as Ārhat thought means that he thought, How can I make it so that these monks do not even for a moment experience pleasure?

original: par bya ba'o snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te de skad smras par zad kyi yang dag par na btsun pa 'char kas las dang po pa la nyes pa med pas de dag rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin pa dang / rdzogs par ma bsnyen pas kyang nges pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: par bya ba'o snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te de skad smras par zad kyi yang dag par na btsun pa 'char kas las dang po pa la nyes pa med pas de dag rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin pa dang / rdzogs par ma bsnyen pas kyang nges pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: But in reality, Venerable Udayi is not at fault as a beginner, and they are fully ordained.

original: zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur ba'i grub pa'i mtha' khong du chud pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur ba'i grub pa'i mtha' khong du chud pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that one who has not entered the ascertainment of the tenets that one will obtain the exhaustion of defilements is fully ordained.🔽Did you not hear the Bhagavan say that beginners are not at fault?🔽This is not the context for saying that the preceptor is not at fault and the Sangha assembled there is not at fault.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis las dang po pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa de ma thos sam zhes bya ba ni mkhan po la ltung ba med pa dang / der 'dus pa'i dge 'dun la nyes byas med pa 'dir skabs ma yin pas mi gzung gi 'dir ni gang zag de yang rdzogs par mi 'gyur la zhes gsungs pa'i nyes pa med do zhes gsungs pa de ma thos sam zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis las dang po pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa de ma thos sam zhes bya ba ni mkhan po la ltung ba med pa dang / der 'dus pa'i dge 'dun la nyes byas med pa 'dir skabs ma yin pas mi gzung gi 'dir ni gang zag de yang rdzogs par mi 'gyur la zhes gsungs pa'i nyes pa med do zhes gsungs pa de ma thos sam zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: But did you not hear the statement that the person is not fully ordained?

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma chags pa dang nyams pa gnyis kyi sgo nas dge slong ma yin pa'i don gyis 'gyod pa skyed pa las ltung byed du 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma chags pa dang nyams pa gnyis kyi sgo nas dge slong ma yin pa'i don gyis 'gyod pa skyed pa las ltung byed du 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: How does one commit a downfall? and so on, it shows that by means of both non-attachment and degeneration, one commits a minor offense by giving rise to regret through the meaning of not a fully ordained monk.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma la sogs pa'i don gyis 'gyod pa skyed pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma la sogs pa'i don gyis 'gyod pa skyed pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving rise to regret through the meaning of 'defeat' and so on, one commits a minor offense.

original: dus phyi ma yin pas zhes bya ba dang / mtshams ma bcad pa dang / dkyil 'khor pa blo mthun par ma byas pa yin pas zhes bya ba dang / de gnyis ni tshul khrims 'chal pa yin pas zhes bya ba'i tshar rnams kyis ni bdag nyid lo nyi shu ma lon pa dang /
analyzed: dus phyi ma yin pas zhes bya ba dang / mtshams ma bcad pa dang / dkyil 'khor pa blo mthun par ma byas pa yin pas zhes bya ba dang / de gnyis ni tshul khrims 'chal pa yin pas zhes bya ba'i tshar rnams kyis ni bdag nyid lo nyi shu ma lon pa dang /
translated: By the phrases because it is a later time, because the boundary has not been established, because the mandala has not been agreed upon, and because both of them are immoral, it shows non-attachment by means of oneself not having twenty years,

original: las kyi gnas mtshams ma bcad pa dang / las byed pa tshul khrims 'chal pa'i sgo nas ma chags pa bstan to //
analyzed: las kyi gnas mtshams ma bcad pa dang / las byed pa tshul khrims 'chal pa'i sgo nas ma chags pa bstan to //
translated: the boundary of the ritual site not being established, and the ritual performers being immoral.

original: de ni gcan sgo yin pas zhes bya ba ni rku sems kyis blangs pas zhes bya ba dang / mi'i chos bla ma smras pa zhes bya ba tshar rnams kyis ni nyams pa'i don gyis 'gyod pa skyes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ni gcan sgo yin pas zhes bya ba ni rku sems kyis blangs pas zhes bya ba dang / mi'i chos bla ma smras pa zhes bya ba tshar rnams kyis ni nyams pa'i don gyis 'gyod pa skyes pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase because it is a door for thieves refers to the taking of what has not been given by the intention to steal. The phrase because it is a door for lying refers to the taking of what has not been given by the intention to steal. The phrase because it is a door for lying refers to the taking of what has not been given by the intention to steal. The phrase because it is a door for lying refers to the taking of what has not been given by the intention to steal.
