The phrase because it is a door for lying refers to the taking of what has not been given by the intention to steal. The phrase because it is a door for lying refers to the taking of what has not been given by the intention to steal. The phrase because it is a door for lying refers to the taking of what has not been given by the intention to steal. The phrase because it is a door for lying refers to the taking of what has not been given by the intention to steal.

original: rdzogs par ma bsnyen zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos po ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par ma bsnyen zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos po ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The phrase he has not been fully ordained means that he has not generated the state of a fully ordained monk.

original: nyes par rdzogs par ma bsnyen zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i cho ga ma tshang bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par rdzogs par ma bsnyen zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i cho ga ma tshang bar byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase he has been improperly fully ordained means that he has been made to undergo the rite of full ordination with an incomplete assembly.

original: yang rdzogs par bsnyen par bya zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dod na'o //🔽dkyil 'khor bar blo mthun par ma byas pa ni las kyis @167b mthun par spong ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor ba'i mtshams bcad pa'o /
analyzed: yang rdzogs par bsnyen par bya zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dod na'o // dkyil 'khor bar blo mthun par ma byas pa ni las kyis @167b mthun par spong ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor ba'i mtshams bcad pa'o /
translated: The phrase he should be fully ordained means that if he so desires.🔽 The phrase he has not been in communion means that he has not been in communion through the rite of communion.🔽 The phrase he has not been in communion means that he has not been in communion through the rite of communion.🔽 The phrase he has not been in communion means that he has not been in communion through the rite of communion.

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni na tshod shes par bya ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba ni na tshod shes par bya ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa gzhan gyis so //
translated: The phrase he has not been in communion means that he has not been in communion through the rite of communion.🔽 The phrase he has not been in communion means that he has not been in communion through the rite of communion.🔽 The phrase he has not been in communion means that he has not been in communion through the rite of communion.🔽 The phrase he has not been in communion means that he has not been in communion through the rite of communion.

original: 'dul ba'i yo byad ces bya ba la 'dir 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba la gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i yo byad ces bya ba la 'dir 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba la gzhug pa'o //
translated: The requisites for taming means that here, taming means to engage in virtue.

original: de bsgrub pa ni yo byad de rgyu des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: de bsgrub pa ni yo byad de rgyu des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: The requisites are the means of accomplishing that, and the meaning is that they are the cause.

original: /'di gnyis la ni 'gyod pa skyes pa'i bsam pa med pas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: /'di gnyis la ni 'gyod pa skyes pa'i bsam pa med pas ltung ba med do //
translated: Since there is no intention to give rise to regret in these two cases, there is no downfall.

original: 'gyod pa skyes pa'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'gyod pa skyes pa'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the sixty-second downfall.

original: // / sor mos ga ga tshil byed ces bya ba ni sor mos reg nas mthar gyis spo bas lus la 'drud pa ste bzhad gad dang lus kyi skyi g-ya' ba skyed par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: // / sor mos ga ga tshil byed ces bya ba ni sor mos reg nas mthar gyis spo bas lus la 'drud pa ste bzhad gad dang lus kyi skyi g-ya' ba skyed par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nail is the finger, and to make it dance means to touch it and then move it around on the body, which is to say, to make it tickle and cause the body to shiver.

original: lus kyi las dang / lus kyi spyod pa dang / lus kyi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las dang / lus kyi spyod pa dang / lus kyi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The physical action, physical behavior, and physical movement should be understood as the preparation, the actual action, and the conclusion.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni reg pa re re las 'gyur ba skye ba'i phyir sor mo gcig la sogs pa sbyor ba gcig pa ji snyed kyis reg kyang ltung ba tha dad du dbye ba med pa de ltung byed gcig
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni reg pa re re las 'gyur ba skye ba'i phyir sor mo gcig la sogs pa sbyor ba gcig pa ji snyed kyis reg kyang ltung ba tha dad du dbye ba med pa de ltung byed gcig
translated: Since a downfall arises from each contact, even if one contacts as many as one finger joint at a time, there is no division of downfalls.

original: tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tu 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a single offense.

original: lus ma yin pas lus ma yin pa la reg pa dang / skra dang / sen mo dang / so dag gis reg pa ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: lus ma yin pas lus ma yin pa la reg pa dang / skra dang / sen mo dang / so dag gis reg pa ni nyes byas so //
translated: Touching a non-living being with a non-living part of one’s body, or touching one’s hair, nails, or teeth, is a minor offense.

original: ga ga tshil byed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ga ga tshil byed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the sixty-third line of the Stanza is completed.

original: // / mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni mos pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: // / mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni mos pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The concentration of aspiration is the attention of aspiration.

original: de dag thams cad bdag gi lus dang 'brel par mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bdag gi lus dang 'brel par mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of these are aspirations connected with one’s own body.

original: sems ni glog dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sems ni glog dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The mind is like a flash of lightning, because it moves.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni rdo rje dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ri bo thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni rdo rje dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ri bo thams cad 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Concentration is like a vajra, because it destroys all the mountains of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni ye shes kyis 'joms so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams gyi sngon du gti mug 'gro la gti mug gi gnyen po ni ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni ye shes kyis 'joms so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams gyi sngon du gti mug 'gro la gti mug gi gnyen po ni ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Afflictions are destroyed by wisdom, because delusion precedes all afflictions, and wisdom is the antidote to delusion.

original: rtse zhes bya ba ni bdag 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: rtse zhes bya ba ni bdag 'ba' zhig go //
translated: “Peak” means oneself alone.

original: rtsed mo zhes bya ba ni zla dang ngo //
analyzed: rtsed mo zhes bya ba ni zla dang ngo //
translated: “Play” means with a companion.

original: dga' zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus 'og tu nub pa dang steng du byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus 'og tu nub pa dang steng du byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Joy” means one’s body sinking into the ground and rising up again, and so on.

original: sim pa zhes bya ba ni bsil ba'o //
analyzed: sim pa zhes bya ba ni bsil ba'o //
translated: “Bliss” means coolness.

original: slob ma'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni lag stangs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni lag stangs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The disciple’s intention” means gestures and so on.

original: bem tol gyis brdegs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chung ba'i phyir ro //🔽bum pa la sogs @168a * //
analyzed: bem tol gyis brdegs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chung ba'i phyir ro // bum pa la sogs @168a * //
translated: If one strikes with the palm of the hand, it is a minor offense, because it is slight.

original: pa la nyes byas su 'gyur pa ni nang du ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa la nyes byas su 'gyur pa ni nang du ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one strikes a pot and so on, it is a minor offense, because it is not sentient.

original: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the sixty-fourth root downfall of a beginner bodhisattva who plays in water is complete.

original: // / phan pa mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa zlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // / phan pa mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa zlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “who acts for the benefit” means who acts to avert harm.

original: legs par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni phan pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni phan pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “who acts for the welfare” means who acts to bring about benefit.

original: ji ltar phan pa dang legs pa mdzad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar phan pa dang legs pa mdzad pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he act for the benefit and welfare?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the text says, “The Blessed One is like this . . .”

original: sdug bsngal gyi chos zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi chos zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag go //
translated: The phrase “the phenomena of suffering” refers to the sufferings of birth and so on.

original: sel bar mdzad ces bya ba ni zlog par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sel bar mdzad ces bya ba ni zlog par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “who removes” means who averts.

original: bde ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba la sogs pa dga' ba dag go //
analyzed: bde ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba la sogs pa dga' ba dag go //
translated: The phrase “the phenomena of happiness” refers to the joys of mental pleasure and so on.

original: sgrub par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni stobs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni stobs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “who brings about” means who bestows.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las dag go //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las dag go //
translated: The phrase “the phenomena of sin and nonvirtue” refers to the afflictions and actions.

original: dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “virtuous qualities” refers to right view and so on.

original: ma rgal ba zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro dag las ma thar ba'o ;
analyzed: ma rgal ba zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro dag las ma thar ba'o ;
translated: The term “those who have not crossed over” refers to those who have not been liberated from the lower realms.

original: / ma grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'ching ba dag las so //
analyzed: / ma grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'ching ba dag las so //
translated: The term “those who have not been liberated” refers to those who have not been liberated from the bonds of the desire realm.

original: dbugs ma phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags kyis te /
analyzed: dbugs ma phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags kyis te /
translated: The term “those who have not found a resting place” refers to those who have not been liberated from the fault of the attachment that is associated with the form realm.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba la sogs pa skyon las rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba la sogs pa skyon las rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they have not been liberated from the fault of the attachment that is associated with the form realm.

original: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa las rnam par ma grol ba ste yang srid pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa las rnam par ma grol ba ste yang srid pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “those who have not attained ultimate nirvana” refers to those who have not been liberated from the three realms, because they have not abandoned all the suffering of renewed existence and so on.

original: spyi brtol can zhes bya ba ni thug thub can no //
analyzed: spyi brtol can zhes bya ba ni thug thub can no //
translated: The term “those who are arrogant” refers to those who are conceited.

original: g-yo zhes bya ba ni g-yos bskyed pa'i yid kyi las so //
analyzed: g-yo zhes bya ba ni g-yos bskyed pa'i yid kyi las so //
translated: The term “deceit” refers to the mental action that is produced by deceit.

original: gya gyur zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis bskyed pa'i ngag gi las so //
analyzed: gya gyur zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis bskyed pa'i ngag gi las so //
translated: The term “dishonesty” refers to the verbal action that is produced by that same .

original: ya yo zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis bskyed pa'i lus kyi las so //
analyzed: ya yo zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis bskyed pa'i lus kyi las so //
translated: Crookedness is the bodily action produced by that.

original: yang de gsum ni g-yo chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de gsum ni g-yo chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, those three should be understood as lesser, middling, and greater crookedness.

original: ya mtshan sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni gang la rab tu byung ba thams cad mchod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ya mtshan sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni gang la rab tu byung ba thams cad mchod par byed pa'o //

analyzed: srung ba dge slong gzhag pa ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sgo gtan pas gcad pa la sogs par rgyur mi rung na gnas tha dad par blta'o //

analyzed: phyogs de re lde la sogs pas bskor bar bya ba ni der bzlog pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: skya rengs shar ba na nyes byas nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas nyid med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tha na bzhad gad bya bar bsams kyang rung ste zhes bya ba ni tha na rgod bag gi bsam pas kyang rung ba'o //

analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba nye bar sgrub par byed pa la ni dngos gzhir 'gyur /

original: yid du 'ong ba nye bar sgrub par byed pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba nye bar sgrub par byed pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur /

analyzed: skyo bar bya ba'i ched du nye bar sgrub par byed pa la ni ltung ba med par ston to //

analyzed: @169a * // 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin pa'i dpe yin gyi /

analyzed: yi dags dang lha la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dpe ni ma yin no //

analyzed: skyo bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni yid 'byung bar bya ba'o //

analyzed: sdongs par byed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sixty-sixth permutation of the downfall of causing regret is completed.

original: // / bshugs zhes bya ba ni stan las bslang ba'o //
analyzed: // / bshugs zhes bya ba ni stan las bslang ba'o //

analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni rung ba dang tshad dang ldan pa'o //

original: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni chom rkun la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni chom rkun la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: sbed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so / // / kho bo ni dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa rtsvas bcings na yang dus byed par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir kho bo rtsol bar mi byed pas de'i phyir rtsvas bcings na yang 'chi dgos pas kho bo gtams pa mi
translated: The explanation of the sixty-seventh line of the chapter on downfalls that require confession alone is finished.

original: len to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: len to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “I am one who will die even if bound with grass” means that because of having ethical discipline, I do not make an effort. Therefore, I must die even if bound with grass. I will not accept being bound. This is the meaning.

original: gdeng med par zhes bya ba ni ma bslangs shing gnang bar ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gdeng med par zhes bya ba ni ma bslangs shing gnang bar ma byas pa'o //
translated: “Without permission” means without asking and without being given permission.

original: dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gis gos spyod pa de gal te dga' ba dang / gcugs pa dang / yid du 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gis gos spyod pa de gal te dga' ba dang / gcugs pa dang / yid du 'ong ba yin no //
translated: “If the one who uses the robe” means if the one who uses the robe is dear, loved, and pleasing,

original: byin pa la nye bar 'tsho ba'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byin pa la nye bar 'tsho ba'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on downfalls that require confession alone is finished.

original: // / de'i tshe na ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe de gnyis kyis de la pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa btab pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: // / de'i tshe na ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe de gnyis kyis de la pham par 'gyur ba'i chos kyis skur pa btab pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: At that time means when those two accuse him with a defeating offense.

original: skur na ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni skur pa gdab pa'i bsam pas skur pa 'debs pa la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skur na ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni skur pa gdab pa'i bsam pas skur pa 'debs pa la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If he accuses, then there is a downfall means that this downfall occurs when one accuses with the intention to accuse.

original: nyan pa po slu ba'i bsam pas brdzun du smra ba ni ltung byed yin te /
analyzed: nyan pa po slu ba'i bsam pas brdzun du smra ba ni ltung byed yin te /
translated: If one lies with the intention to deceive a listener, then there is a downfall.

original: de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the two.

original: gzhi bcus ni ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / mi dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gsum mo //🔽thos la de yang brjed pa dang / de dogs pa de yang brjed ces bya ba ni gzhi gnyis so //
analyzed: gzhi bcus ni ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / mi dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gsum mo // thos la de yang brjed pa dang / de dogs pa de yang brjed ces bya ba ni gzhi gnyis so //
translated: One becomes guilty by ten bases means that there are three bases: not seeing, not hearing, and not suspecting.🔽There are two bases: hearing, but forgetting it, and suspecting it, but forgetting it.

original: thos pa la yid ches pa dang / thos pa la yid ma ches pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gnyis so //
analyzed: thos pa la yid ches pa dang / thos pa la yid ma ches pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gnyis so //
translated: There are two bases: trusting what one hears, and not trusting what one hears.

original: thos pa la dogs pa dang / thos pa la mi dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gnyis so //
analyzed: thos pa la dogs pa dang / thos pa la mi dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gnyis so //
translated: The two bases doubting what one has heard and not doubting what one has heard are two bases.

original: dogs pa la dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gcig pa ste /
analyzed: dogs pa la dogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi gcig pa ste /
translated: The base doubting what one doubts is one base.

original: de ltar gzhi bcus ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽gzhi lngas ltung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / mi dogs pa zhes @169b bya ba gzhi gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar gzhi bcus ltung bar 'gyur ro // gzhi lngas ltung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / mi dogs pa zhes @169b bya ba gzhi gsum mo //
translated: Thus, there are ten bases for downfalls.

original: thos la de yang brjed pa dang / de dogs la de yang brjed pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis te de ltar gzhi lngas ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos la de yang brjed pa dang / de dogs la de yang brjed pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis te de ltar gzhi lngas ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The five bases for no downfall are the three bases not seeing, not hearing, and not doubting, and the two bases hearing and forgetting and doubting and forgetting. Thus, there are five bases for no downfall.

original: gzhi bcu gcig gis ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni 'dir mthong la de yang brjed pa zhes bya ba snga ma bcu'i steng du bsnan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhi bcu gcig gis ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni 'dir mthong la de yang brjed pa zhes bya ba snga ma bcu'i steng du bsnan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The eleven bases for downfalls are the ten bases mentioned above plus seeing and forgetting.

original: gzhi drug ces bya bar yang des mthong ba de yang ma brjed pa zhes bya ba snga ma lnga'i thog tu bsnan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi drug ces bya bar yang des mthong ba de yang ma brjed pa zhes bya ba snga ma lnga'i thog tu bsnan par shes par bya'o //
translated: The six bases for no downfall are the five bases mentioned above plus seeing and not forgetting.

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed de drug cu rtsa dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the sixty-ninth rule of training is finished.

original: // / bu zhes bya ba ni khye'u dang bu mo dag go //
analyzed: // / bu zhes bya ba ni khye'u dang bu mo dag go //
translated: A child is a boy or a girl.

original: ra ro zhes bya ba ni chang gis myos pa zin pa'o //
analyzed: ra ro zhes bya ba ni chang gis myos pa zin pa'o //
translated: Intoxicated means having lost control due to alcohol.

original: bar skabs so zhes bya ba ni bar mdo'o //
analyzed: bar skabs so zhes bya ba ni bar mdo'o //
translated: In the middle means in the middle.

original: skyes pa med par bud med dang zhes bya ba ni gang la grogs skyes pa gzhan med pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes pa med par bud med dang zhes bya ba ni gang la grogs skyes pa gzhan med pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Without a man means that there is no other male companion.

original: gang bud med bsel byed du 'jud pa la sogs pa ni bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba yin pas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gang bud med bsel byed du 'jud pa la sogs pa ni bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba yin pas ltung ba med do //
translated: If a woman is sent to get a man, etc., there is no offense because she is going due to the power of an obstacle.

original: bud med dang lhan cig 'gro ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig 'gro ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The seventy-first rule of training on going with a woman is finished.

original: // / stong par 'dong zhes bya ba ni khur med pa'o //🔽khur dag gis 'dong zhes bya ba ni khur thogs te 'dong ba'o //
analyzed: // / stong par 'dong zhes bya ba ni khur med pa'o // khur dag gis 'dong zhes bya ba ni khur thogs te 'dong ba'o //
translated: Going empty means without a load.🔽Going with loads means going with a load.

original: phyi bzhin 'gro zhes bya ba ni phyi bzhin 'brang pa'o //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'gro zhes bya ba ni phyi bzhin 'brang pa'o //
translated: Following means following behind.

original: sems ni mar dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni rgyud mnyen pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni mar dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni rgyud mnyen pa'o //
translated: The mind is like butter means that the mind is flexible.

original: don mthun rkun ma zhes bya ba ni chom rkun gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: don mthun rkun ma zhes bya ba ni chom rkun gyi tshogs so //
translated: The thief is the same as the robber means a band of robbers.

original: rkun ma dang lhan cig 'gro ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rkun ma dang lhan cig 'gro ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The seventy-first downfall is finished.

original: // / dge slong gi dngos por rdzogs par bsnyen par byed ces bya ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa'i phyir nye bar khrid pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: // / dge slong gi dngos por rdzogs par bsnyen par byed ces bya ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa'i phyir nye bar khrid pa byed pa'o //
translated: To lead someone to full ordination as a monk means to lead someone to the vows of a monk.

original: gzhan las tshig gi lam ngan la smras pa dang ; ngan pa 'ongs pa dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan las tshig gi lam ngan la smras pa dang ; ngan pa 'ongs pa dag ces bya ba la /
translated: To speak to someone else about the bad path and the bad arrival means

original: tshig gi lam zhes bya ba ni thab mo'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshig gi lam zhes bya ba ni thab mo'i rgyu'o //
translated: the bad path is the cause of a quarrel.

original: ngan pa smras pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad bkag la sogs pa'i ngag gi las so //
analyzed: ngan pa smras pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad bkag la sogs pa'i ngag gi las so //
translated: The bad speech means the verbal action of slander and so forth.

original: ngan pa 'ongs zhes bya ba ni brdeg pa la sogs pa lus kyi las mi 'dod pa dag go //
analyzed: ngan pa 'ongs zhes bya ba ni brdeg pa la sogs pa lus kyi las mi 'dod pa dag go //
translated: The bad arrival means the unwanted physical actions of beating and so forth.

original: mi bzod ces bya ba ni dang du len par mi nus pa'o//
analyzed: mi bzod ces bya ba ni dang du len par mi nus pa'o//
translated: To be unable to bear means to be unable to accept.

original: zag pa dag la ji mi snyam par bya ba yang mi bzod cing zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zag pa bstsal bar bya ba yang mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dag la ji mi snyam par bya ba yang mi bzod cing zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zag pa bstsal bar bya ba yang mi nus pa'o //
translated: Also, not being able to bear the defilements means not being able to eliminate the defilements of desire, etc.

original: dang du len mi nus pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bzod par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: dang du len mi nus pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bzod par mi nus pa'o //
translated: The nature of being unable to accept means not being able to endure mentally.

original: dge slong de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni las byed pa la sogs pa'o //🔽smad par @170a * //
analyzed: dge slong de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni las byed pa la sogs pa'o // smad par @170a * //
translated: The monks means those who perform the duties, etc.

original: 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: They will be censured means they will incur an offense.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la /🔽lo nyi shu yang ma lon pa la lo nyi shu ma lon par yang 'du shes shing dris na yang bdag lo nyi shu yang ma lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag gcig go //
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la / lo nyi shu yang ma lon pa la lo nyi shu ma lon par yang 'du shes shing dris na yang bdag lo nyi shu yang ma lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag gcig go //
translated: How does one incur an offense in this case?🔽One who is less than twenty years old, perceiving oneself as less than twenty years old, and when asked, saying I am less than twenty years old, is one person.

original: lo nyi shu yang ma lon la lo nyi shu ma lon par yang 'du shes shing dris na yang shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
analyzed: lo nyi shu yang ma lon la lo nyi shu ma lon par yang 'du shes shing dris na yang shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
translated: One who is less than twenty years old, perceiving oneself as less than twenty years old, and when asked, knowing, remembering, and having no doubt,

original: bdag lo nyi shu ma lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bdag lo nyi shu ma lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second person is one who says, “I am not twenty years old.”

original: lo nyi shu ma lon pa la lo nyi shu lon par 'du shes shing dris na yang bdag po nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lo nyi shu ma lon pa la lo nyi shu lon par 'du shes shing dris na yang bdag po nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag gsum pa'o //
translated: The third person is one who, not being twenty years old, thinks he is twenty years old and, when asked, says, “I am twenty years old.”

original: lo nyi shu ma lon pa la lo nyi shu lon par 'du shes shing dris na yang shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
analyzed: lo nyi shu ma lon pa la lo nyi shu lon par 'du shes shing dris na yang shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
translated: The fourth person is one who, not being twenty years old, thinks he is twenty years old and, when asked, knows, remembers, and is certain that he is twenty years old and says,

original: bdag lo nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bdag lo nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag bzhi pa'o //
translated: “I am twenty years old.”

original: lo nyi shu ma lon pa la des mi shes mi dran yid gnyis mi za ba ni gang zag lnga pa'o //
analyzed: lo nyi shu ma lon pa la des mi shes mi dran yid gnyis mi za ba ni gang zag lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth person is one who, not being twenty years old, does not know, does not remember, and is not certain that he is not twenty years old.

original: lo nyi shu lon pa la lo nyi shu ma lon par 'du shes shing dris na yang bdag lo nyi shu ma lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag drug pa'o //
analyzed: lo nyi shu lon pa la lo nyi shu ma lon par 'du shes shing dris na yang bdag lo nyi shu ma lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth person is one who is twenty years old but thinks he is not twenty years old and, when asked, says, “I am not twenty years old.”🔽The seventh person is one who is twenty years old and thinks he is twenty years old and, when asked,

original: lo nyi shu lon la lo nyi shu ma lon par 'du shes shing dris pa na /🔽shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
analyzed: lo nyi shu lon la lo nyi shu ma lon par 'du shes shing dris pa na /🔽shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
translated: knows, remembers, and is certain that he is twenty years old and says,🔽“I am twenty years old.”

original: bdag lo nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag bdun pa'o //🔽lo nyi shu yang lon la lo nyi shu lon par 'du shes shing dris pa na bdag lo nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag lo nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag bdun pa'o // lo nyi shu yang lon la lo nyi shu lon par 'du shes shing dris pa na bdag lo nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag brgyad pa'o //
translated: The seventh person is one who says, “I am twenty years old,” but is not actually twenty years old.🔽The eighth person is one who is actually twenty years old, who thinks he is twenty years old, and who says, “I am twenty years old,” when asked.

original: lo nyi shu lon la lo nyi shu lon par yang 'du shes shing dris pa na /
analyzed: lo nyi shu lon la lo nyi shu lon par yang 'du shes shing dris pa na /
translated: The ninth person is one who is twenty years old, who thinks he is twenty years old, and who,

original: shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
analyzed: shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
translated: when asked, knows, remembers, and is certain,

original: bdag lo nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bdag lo nyi shu lon no zhes zer ba ni gang zag dgu pa'o //
translated: and says, “I am twenty years old.”

original: lo nyi shu lon la des mi shes mi dran la yid gnyis za ba ni gang zag bcu pa'o //
analyzed: lo nyi shu lon la des mi shes mi dran la yid gnyis za ba ni gang zag bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth person is one who is twenty years old, but who does not know it, does not remember it, and is uncertain about it.

original: de la dang po nyid nas rdzogs par bsnyen cing zhes bya ba ni dus las gyur pa'i las su rung ba nyid kyang med pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes las skyes pa spro ba las gyur pa'i lus rung ba nyid kyang med pa'i phyir rdzogs par bsnyen pa nyid ma chags te /
analyzed: de la dang po nyid nas rdzogs par bsnyen cing zhes bya ba ni dus las gyur pa'i las su rung ba nyid kyang med pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes las skyes pa spro ba las gyur pa'i lus rung ba nyid kyang med pa'i phyir rdzogs par bsnyen pa nyid ma chags te /
translated: The first person is not fully admitted because he is not physically fit, because he is not fit to be a monk, and because he is not fit to be a monk for life.

original: za ma la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: za ma la sogs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is like food and so on.

original: 'grogs pa dang longs spyod pa la yang ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'grogs pa dang longs spyod pa la yang ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
translated: One also falls by associating and by using.

original: 'grogs pa la ltung bar 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni gsol pa la sogs pa'i las nyams su myong ba ni de dang gzhan dag la yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'grogs pa la ltung bar 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni gsol pa la sogs pa'i las nyams su myong ba ni de dang gzhan dag la yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One falls by associating means that one does not fall by experiencing the actions of requesting and so on, and also not by others.

original: longs spyod pa la ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong dang dgag dbye nyams su @170b myong ba na de dang gzhan dag la yang ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: longs spyod pa la ltung bar 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong dang dgag dbye nyams su @170b myong ba na de dang gzhan dag la yang ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One falls by using means that one falls by experiencing poṣadha and the lifting of restrictions, and also by others.

original: des dge 'dun la yang 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi 'os pa rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa'i phyir dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des dge 'dun la yang 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi 'os pa rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa'i phyir dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One also commits an offense entailing suspension in the Saṅgha means that the entire Saṅgha falls because the ordination is not suitable.

original: shes zhes bya ba ni lo grangs shes pa'o ;
analyzed: shes zhes bya ba ni lo grangs shes pa'o ;
translated: “He knows” means he knows the number of years.

original: / dran zhes bya ba ni lo tshigs dran pa'o //
analyzed: / dran zhes bya ba ni lo tshigs dran pa'o //
translated: “He remembers” means he remembers the years.

original: yid gnyis mi za zhes bya ba ni 'di la thams cad du nges pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yid gnyis mi za zhes bya ba ni 'di la thams cad du nges pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: “He is not uncertain” means he is certain in all respects.

original: lo nyi shu lon nam ma lon snyam du yid gnyis mi za ba'o //
analyzed: lo nyi shu lon nam ma lon snyam du yid gnyis mi za ba'o //
translated: He is not uncertain, thinking, “I have or have not completed twenty years.”

original: de'i mod la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po 'chags shing zhes bya ba ni las byed pa de'i mod la re zhig skyes pa'i rtsal dang sems las gyur pa'i zhing yod pa'i phyir dge slong gi dngos po chags shing phyis
analyzed: de'i mod la rab tu byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa dge slong gi dngos po 'chags shing zhes bya ba ni las byed pa de'i mod la re zhig skyes pa'i rtsal dang sems las gyur pa'i zhing yod pa'i phyir dge slong gi dngos po chags shing phyis
translated: “At that very moment, he becomes a monk and the state of a bhikṣu is created for him” means that at that very moment when the rite is performed, the state of a bhikṣu is created for him, because the field of merit that is a bhikṣu exists as long as the power of his birth and his mind exist.

original: ni gal te 'du shes chad na dge slong gi dngos po sngar chags pa yang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽mi shes zhes bya ba ni lo grangs mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ni gal te 'du shes chad na dge slong gi dngos po sngar chags pa yang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mi shes zhes bya ba ni lo grangs mi shes pa'o //
translated: Later, if his perception is severed, the state of a bhikṣu that was created earlier is destroyed. This is the meaning.🔽“He does not know” means he does not know the number of years.

original: mi dran zhes bya ba ni lo tshigs mi dran pa'o //
analyzed: mi dran zhes bya ba ni lo tshigs mi dran pa'o //
translated: “He does not remember” means he does not remember the years.

original: yang na mi shes zhes bya ba ni bdag gis lo du lon pa btsal kyang mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mi shes zhes bya ba ni bdag gis lo du lon pa btsal kyang mi shes pa'o //
translated: Or, “I do not know” means that even though I have sought for many years, I do not know.

original: mi dran zhes bya ba ni sngon zhes pa yang de'i tshe na brjed pa'o //
analyzed: mi dran zhes bya ba ni sngon zhes pa yang de'i tshe na brjed pa'o //
translated: “I do not remember” means that I have forgotten even that long ago.

original: yid gnyis za zhes bya ba ni blo la the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: yid gnyis za zhes bya ba ni blo la the tshom za ba'o //
translated: “I am unsure” means that I have doubts in my mind.

original: gang zag bcu gnyis po de dag gi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir de la gang zag dang po gnyis po gang dag yin pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis po de dag gi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir de la gang zag dang po gnyis po gang dag yin pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach the distinctions of those twelve persons, he says, “Among them, those two persons who are the first…”

original: de la gang zag dang po gnyis so zhes bya ba ni lo nyi shu yang ma lon la lo nyi shu ma lon par yang 'du shes shing dris na yang bdag lo nyi shu ma lon no zhes zer ba gang yin pa de dang / lo nyi shu yang ma lon la lo nyi shu ma lon par yang 'du shes shing dris na yang shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
analyzed: de la gang zag dang po gnyis so zhes bya ba ni lo nyi shu yang ma lon la lo nyi shu ma lon par yang 'du shes shing dris na yang bdag lo nyi shu ma lon no zhes zer ba gang yin pa de dang / lo nyi shu yang ma lon la lo nyi shu ma lon par yang 'du shes shing dris na yang shes shing dran la yid gnyis mi za ste /
translated: “Among them, those two persons who are the first” are the one who has not completed twenty years and who thinks he has not completed twenty years and who, when asked, says, “I have not completed twenty years,” and the one who has not completed twenty years and who thinks he has not completed twenty years and who, when asked, knows, remembers, and is sure.

original: bdag lo nyi shu ma lon no zhes zer ba gang yin pa de gnyis yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag lo nyi shu ma lon no zhes zer ba gang yin pa de gnyis yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: These are the two who say, “I have not completed twenty years.”

original: rku thabs su gnas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rku thabs su chos kyi longs spyod nyams su myong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rku thabs su gnas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rku thabs su chos kyi longs spyod nyams su myong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: They are called “living by theft” because they experience the enjoyment of the Dharma by theft.

original: lan gnyis su rku thabs su las nyams su myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan gnyis su rku thabs su las nyams su myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they experience the enjoyment of the Dharma by theft twice.

original: bsnyil bar 'os pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i sdom pa 'chags pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su spang bar 'os pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bsnyil bar 'os pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i sdom pa 'chags pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su spang bar 'os pa dag yin no //
translated: They are called “worthy of being expelled” because they are worthy of being expelled since they are not a basis for confessing the vow of going forth.

original: mngal na gnas pa'i zla ba zhes bya ba ni thog ma mngal du chags nas mngal gyi sgor ma btsas gyi bar @171a * //🔽gyi zla ba du yod pa dag go //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i zla ba zhes bya ba ni thog ma mngal du chags nas mngal gyi sgor ma btsas gyi bar @171a * // gyi zla ba du yod pa dag go //
translated: The months of the embryo are the months from the initial entry into the womb until birth from the womb.

original: shol gyi zla ba dag ces bya ba ni zla ba lhag ma dag go //
analyzed: shol gyi zla ba dag ces bya ba ni zla ba lhag ma dag go //
translated: The extra months are the remaining months.

original: brtsi bar bya ba ste zhes bya ba'i tshig ni 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyis mngal na gnas pa'i tshe zla ba dang zla ba lhag pa dag logs shig tu mi brtsi mod kyi 'on kyang yang dag pa'i sems la brtsi bar bya ste /
analyzed: brtsi bar bya ba ste zhes bya ba'i tshig ni 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyis mngal na gnas pa'i tshe zla ba dang zla ba lhag pa dag logs shig tu mi brtsi mod kyi 'on kyang yang dag pa'i sems la brtsi bar bya ste /
translated: The phrase “should be counted” means that although the months and half months in the womb are not counted separately by worldly convention, they should be counted in terms of the correct mind.

original: mngal na gnas pa'i tshe yang lus skyes pa yin la shol gyi zla ba dag 'das pa na yang dus las gyur pa'i lus rung ba nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i tshe yang lus skyes pa yin la shol gyi zla ba dag 'das pa na yang dus las gyur pa'i lus rung ba nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because even while in the womb, the body is born and when the half months have passed, the body becomes suitable for the time of birth.

original: sa spo bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni dge tshul nyid du bkri bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sa spo bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni dge tshul nyid du bkri bar bya ba'o //
translated: “Should be transferred” means that one should be led to the state of a novice monk.

original: yang rdzogs par bsnyen par bya zhes bya ba ni lus gyur pa'i zhing nyid ni sems kyi bye brag ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyams pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yang nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rdzogs par bsnyen par bya zhes bya ba ni lus gyur pa'i zhing nyid ni sems kyi bye brag ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyams pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yang nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Should be fully ordained” means that because the field of the body has changed and the mind’s specific coemergent cause has declined, full ordination also declines.

original: chos mngon pa las 'di sdom pa gtong ba'i rgyu nyid du ma bgrangs pa ni ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las 'di sdom pa gtong ba'i rgyu nyid du ma bgrangs pa ni ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not counted as a cause for relinquishing vows in the Abhidharma because it is uncertain.

original: gal te tshang na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni dpyad khongs su gzhug pa ste /
analyzed: gal te tshang na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni dpyad khongs su gzhug pa ste /
translated: If you are complete, then it is good means that this is a matter to be analyzed.

original: mngal na gnas pa'i zla ba dag kyang las kyi dbang gis mang nyung ma nges pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar gang zag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po 'thob pa ni dkon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i zla ba dag kyang las kyi dbang gis mang nyung ma nges pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar gang zag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po 'thob pa ni dkon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, the months spent in the womb are uncertain in number due to the power of karma.🔽It is rare to obtain the state of a fully ordained monk who has gone forth and been fully ordained in the well-spoken doctrine and discipline.

original: 'di ltar dge slong gi dngos po thob pa la dogs pa la sogs pa gcad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong gi dngos po thob pa la dogs pa la sogs pa gcad pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because one must eliminate doubt and so on in order to obtain the state of a fully ordained monk.

original: 'di ltar 'dul ba la sogs pas yongs su btang ba byas nas gal te yang blangs pa bcos par byed na de'i tshe na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / grogs med pa dang / yul 'khrugs pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis phyir thob par shin tu dka' bas de'i phyir dge slong gi dngos po ji ltar thob pa'i lo tshad dran ba rnyed na legs par rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dul ba la sogs pas yongs su btang ba byas nas gal te yang blangs pa bcos par byed na de'i tshe na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / grogs med pa dang / yul 'khrugs pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis phyir thob par shin tu dka' bas de'i phyir dge slong gi dngos po ji ltar thob pa'i lo tshad dran ba rnyed na legs par rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
translated: Thus, if one who has relinquished the state of a fully ordained monk through the Vinaya and so on, again takes up the state of a fully ordained monk, then it is very difficult to obtain it again through the power of illness, death, separation from friends, war, and so on. Therefore, if a fully ordained monk remembers the age at which he obtained the state of a fully ordained monk, he is well ordained.

original: yang rdzogs par bsnyen par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang rdzogs par bsnyen par bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he does not need to be ordained again.

original: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni 'du shes thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes par bya zhes bya ba ni 'du shes thob par bya ba'o //
translated: One should know means one should obtain the recognition.

original: dran par bya zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi byung ba'i mtha' nye bar bsgrub pa la sogs pas lo'i dran pa 'thob par bya'o //
analyzed: dran par bya zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi byung ba'i mtha' nye bar bsgrub pa la sogs pas lo'i dran pa 'thob par bya'o //
translated: One should remember means one should obtain the memory of the year through establishing the limit of a past occurrence and so on.

original: yid gnyis spang bar bya zhes bya ba ni lo la nges pa bskyed pas the tshom spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid gnyis spang bar bya zhes bya ba ni lo la nges pa bskyed pas the tshom spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should abandon doubt means one should abandon doubt by generating certainty about the year.

original: de dag ni 'gyod pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bsgo bar bya ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gyod pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bsgo bar bya ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as the instructions for the purpose of dispelling regret and so forth.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / @171b tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni mkhan po la ltung byed med pa dang / dge 'dun la nyes pa med pa dang /
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / @171b tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni mkhan po la ltung byed med pa dang / dge 'dun la nyes pa med pa dang /
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one whose mind is disturbed, and for one who is overwhelmed by pain. This means that there is no offense for the preceptor, no fault for the Saṅgha,

original: gang zag de rdzogs par bsnyen par mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gang zag de rdzogs par bsnyen par mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: and it is not the case that the person is not fully admitted.

original: ma len par rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa'i ltung byed de bdun cu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /🔽// / bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: ma len par rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa'i ltung byed de bdun cu gnyis pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so / // / bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: The explanation of the seventy-second rule is finished.

original: rnang sgal zhes bya ba ni rnang gi mtshams so //
analyzed: rnang sgal zhes bya ba ni rnang gi mtshams so //
translated: The “edge of a ravine” is the edge of a precipice.

original: spyur bar byed ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis phung por byed pa'o //
analyzed: spyur bar byed ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis phung por byed pa'o //
translated: “To banish” means to expel oneself.

original: spyur du 'jud par byed ces bya ba ni gzhan spung du 'jud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: spyur du 'jud par byed ces bya ba ni gzhan spung du 'jud par byed pa'o //
translated: “To cause to be banished” means to cause another to be expelled.

original: yur ba zhes bya ba ni chu srol lo //
analyzed: yur ba zhes bya ba ni chu srol lo //
translated: A canal is a watercourse.

original: rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'thas pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'thas pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: Firm is very hard.

original: rang bzhin can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'thas pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa gzhan no //
analyzed: rang bzhin can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu 'thas pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa gzhan no //
translated: Not firm is not very hard.

original: char chu zhod ces bya ba ni char che zhing lan gsum mam bzhi la sogs pa char 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: char chu zhod ces bya ba ni char che zhing lan gsum mam bzhi la sogs pa char 'bab pa'o //
translated: Heavy rain is rain that falls three or four times.

original: char chu ma zhod ces bya ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //🔽sa zhag ces bya ba ni sa 'gog pa'o //🔽grugs pa zhes bya ba ni gyong grugs su gyur pa ste nyams pa'i shas che bas de la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: char chu ma zhod ces bya ba ni de las bzlog pa'o // sa zhag ces bya ba ni sa 'gog pa'o // grugs pa zhes bya ba ni gyong grugs su gyur pa ste nyams pa'i shas che bas de la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Light rain is the opposite of that.🔽Mud is the obstruction of the ground.🔽A rut is a depression in the ground.

original: phur pa 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni 'chos pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir nyes byas byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phur pa 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni 'chos pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir nyes byas byed pa yin no //
translated: Pulling out a peg is a fault because it is similar to a modification.

original: shod dgod pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge la sogs pa bri ba'i bsam pa ste gzhig pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir 'di la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: shod dgod pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge la sogs pa bri ba'i bsam pa ste gzhig pa'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir 'di la ltung ba med do //
translated: The thought of digging is the thought of writing letters, etc. There is no offense in this case, because there is no thought of destruction.

original: ngogs zhes bya ba ni chu klung zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngogs zhes bya ba ni chu klung zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: A bank is the opposite side of a river.

original: 'dam skyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dam rdzab 'khrug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dam skyod pa zhes bya ba ni 'dam rdzab 'khrug par byed pa ste /
translated: A swamp is a place where mud is churned up.

original: 'jig par byed pa dang 'dra pa'i phyir de la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa dang 'dra pa'i phyir de la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is like a place of destruction, there is an offense for disturbing it.

original: tshva sgo zhes bya ba ni char pa la sogs pa las gyur pa'i sa 'bus pa stengs ma yin pa'i phyir de la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshva sgo zhes bya ba ni char pa la sogs pa las gyur pa'i sa 'bus pa stengs ma yin pa'i phyir de la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: A salt-marsh is a place where the earth is salty from rain, etc. Because it is not solid, there is an offense for disturbing it.

original: rdo ba can zhes bya ba ni rdo ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo ba can zhes bya ba ni rdo ba yod pa'o //
translated: A pebble-strewn place is a place where there are pebbles.

original: gal te sa ches mang la zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams rang bzhin can zhes mang ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: gal te sa ches mang la zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams rang bzhin can zhes mang ba nyid du ston to //
translated: If there is a great deal of earth, etc. shows that the earth element is predominant.

original: bye ma can zhes bya ba ni bye ma yod pa'o //
analyzed: bye ma can zhes bya ba ni bye ma yod pa'o //
translated: A sand-bank is a place where there is sand.

original: rgyu skar gyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu skar dang 'brel pas phongs pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyis smad par 'gyur bas 'di la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rgyu skar gyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu skar dang 'brel pas phongs pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyis smad par 'gyur bas 'di la ltung ba med do //
translated: The expression the conjunction of the stars refers to the time of the conjunction of the stars with the lunar mansions. Since this is a time of misfortune, there is no offense if the monk does this because he is despised by the world.

original: rung bar byed pa med na zhes bya ba ni de yang rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa gzhan med na gnang gi yod na mi gnang ngo //🔽sa rko ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad @172a * //
analyzed: rung bar byed pa med na zhes bya ba ni de yang rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa gzhan med na gnang gi yod na mi gnang ngo // sa rko ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa gsum pa'i tshig rnam par bshad @172a * //
translated: If there is no attendant means that if there is no other novice monk, then it is permitted, but if there is, then it is not permitted.

original: pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the words of the seventy-third downfall is finished.

original: // / bde ba'i sman zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / bde ba'i sman zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The expression medicinal substances that are pleasant

original: zhun mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa bde ba rnams kyis sbyang du rung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhun mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa bde ba rnams kyis sbyang du rung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: refers to those that are suitable for purification with pleasant substances such as ghee and sesame oil.

original: dus su rung ba zhes bya ba ni snga dro'i dus su bzar rung ba phye dang snum khur la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus su rung ba zhes bya ba ni snga dro'i dus su bzar rung ba phye dang snum khur la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The expression suitable for the proper time refers to those that are suitable to be eaten in the morning, such as flour and oil cakes.

original: thun tshod du rung ba zhes bya ba ni thun tshod kyi mtha'i dus tshun chad du btung du rung la legs par sbyar ba'i btung ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba zhes bya ba ni thun tshod kyi mtha'i dus tshun chad du btung du rung la legs par sbyar ba'i btung ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is suitable for a period is any drink, such as a decoction, that is suitable to be drunk within the period of time that is the limit of a period.

original: zhag bdun pa zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs te bza' ba bu ram la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs te bza' ba bu ram la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is for seven days is any food, such as molasses, that is consecrated to be eaten for seven days.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du byin gyis brlabs te bza' ba lan tshva la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du byin gyis brlabs te bza' ba lan tshva la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is to be kept as long as one lives is any food, such as salt, that is consecrated to be eaten at all times.

original: gshegs ston zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i ston mo'o //
analyzed: gshegs ston zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i ston mo'o //
translated: A festival is a complete feast.

original: ha cang slong ba zhes bya ba ni sgrub dka' pa'i zas ha cang slong ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang slong ba zhes bya ba ni sgrub dka' pa'i zas ha cang slong ba'o //
translated: Excessive begging is begging excessively for difficult to obtain food.

original: dpung rgyan dang rna cha gdub 'khor dang phreng ba sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa dang / byug pas brgyan par gyur te zhes bya ba ni brgyan par gyur te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dpung rgyan dang rna cha gdub 'khor dang phreng ba sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa dang / byug pas brgyan par gyur te zhes bya ba ni brgyan par gyur te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: Adorned with armlets, earrings, bracelets, and various garlands means adorned with each of those.

original: nye 'khor zhes bya ba ni gam yo'o //
analyzed: nye 'khor zhes bya ba ni gam yo'o //
translated: The word vicinity means near.

original: tshigs bcad dag smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshigs bcad dag smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the verse that begins You revile me, and so on,

original: zhe sdang gnas su gyur ces bya ba ni zhe sdang bar bya ba'i gnas te mi sdug pa'o //🔽ha cang slong bas bdag la bsdigs byed pa//
analyzed: zhe sdang gnas su gyur ces bya ba ni zhe sdang bar bya ba'i gnas te mi sdug pa'o // ha cang slong bas bdag la bsdigs byed pa//
translated: The abode of hatred is the object of hatred, which is ugliness.

original: ral gyi rdo dang 'bru mar bdar ba bzhin //
analyzed: ral gyi rdo dang 'bru mar bdar ba bzhin //
translated: You revile me, as if with a sword, a stone, or burning oil,🔽because of excessive demands.🔽Just as one is reviled with a sharp sword, a stone, or burning oil, and harm arises, in the same way, you revile me with excessive demands, like a sword.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ral gyi rdo phye dang 'bru mar gyis bdar ba rnon pos bsdigs par byed na gnod pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin khyod ha cang slong ba ral gyi ngang 'dra bas bdag la bsdigs par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ral gyi rdo phye dang 'bru mar gyis bdar ba rnon pos bsdigs par byed na gnod pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin khyod ha cang slong ba ral gyi ngang 'dra bas bdag la bsdigs par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: go // gal te khyod gnas phyin chad bdag 'ong na //
analyzed: go // gal te khyod gnas phyin chad bdag 'ong na //
translated: If you go to your home and I return,🔽then strike my head with a stone.

original: bdag gi klad par rdo bas bsnun gyis shig / ces bya ba ni de'i phyir gal te khyod kyi gnas su phyin chad bdag 'ong bar gyur na bdag gi klad par rdo bas bsnun cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi klad par rdo bas bsnun gyis shig / ces bya ba ni de'i phyir gal te khyod kyi gnas su phyin chad bdag 'ong bar gyur na bdag gi klad par rdo bas bsnun cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means: if you go to your home and I return, then strike my head with a stone.

original: tsher ma ni dgra yin pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa ni dgra yin pa'o //
analyzed: tsher ma ni dgra yin pas zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa ni dgra yin pa'o //
translated: Thorns are enemies.

original: phru gu zhes bya ba ni bu'o //
analyzed: phru gu zhes bya ba ni bu'o //
translated: A child is a son.

original: zla ba bzhir mgron du bos pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi dus zla ba gcig dang / dbyar thung ngu'i dus nyin zhag gcig dang / dbyar ring po'i dus zla ba gnyis dang / zhag nyi shu rtsa dgu po dag tu ste /
analyzed: zla ba bzhir mgron du bos pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi dus zla ba gcig dang / dbyar thung ngu'i dus nyin zhag gcig dang / dbyar ring po'i dus zla ba gnyis dang / zhag nyi shu rtsa dgu po dag tu ste /
translated: Invited for four months means for one month of the rainy season, one day of the short rainy season, two months of the long rainy season, and twenty-nine days.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po nya nas ston zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba bzhir ro //
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po nya nas ston zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba bzhir ro //
translated: From the full moon of the middle month of summer until the full moon of the last month of autumn, for four months.

original: so sor @172b mgron du bos pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni so sor mgron du bos pa ni gus pa'i phyir dge 'dun spyan drangs pa'i dus las lhag pa la yin pas ltung ba med do //🔽yang yang mgron du bos pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du mgron du bos pa na 'bad pa'i phyir dge 'dun spyan drangs pa'i dus las lhag pa brten pa yin pas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: so sor @172b mgron du bos pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni so sor mgron du bos pa ni gus pa'i phyir dge 'dun spyan drangs pa'i dus las lhag pa la yin pas ltung ba med do // yang yang mgron du bos pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du mgron du bos pa na 'bad pa'i phyir dge 'dun spyan drangs pa'i dus las lhag pa brten pa yin pas ltung ba med do //
translated: Except when invited individually means that when invited individually, it is out of respect that the Saṅgha is invited for more than the proper time, so there is no offense.🔽Except when invited again and again means that when invited again and again, it is out of effort that the Saṅgha is invited for more than the proper time, so there is no offense.🔽Except when invited for a period of time means that when invited for a period of time, it is out of attachment that the Saṅgha is invited for more than the proper time, so there is no offense.

original: dus kyis mgron du bos pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dus kyis mgron du bos pa ni mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa'i dus las lhag pa la brten pa yin pas ltung ba med do //🔽rtag tu mgron du bos pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gzhan la brten pa yin pas ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dus kyis mgron du bos pa ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni dus kyis mgron du bos pa ni mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis dge 'dun spyan drangs pa'i dus las lhag pa la brten pa yin pas ltung ba med do //🔽rtag tu mgron du bos pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gzhan la brten pa yin pas ltung ba med do //
translated: Except when invited permanently means that when invited permanently, it is out of dependence on another that the Saṅgha is invited for more than the proper time, so there is no offense.

original: dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad zla ba bzhir mgron du bos pa las lhag par bdag gir byed na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla ba bzhir mgron du bos pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu so sor mgron du
analyzed: dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad zla ba bzhir mgron du bos pa las lhag par bdag gir byed na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dbyar zla ba bzhir mgron du bos pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu so sor mgron du
translated: If a fully ordained monk accepts anything at all beyond the four months of the invitation ceremony, then in all cases it is a downfall.

original: bos pa la sogs pa dus med pa bca' ba dang bza' ba ngan pa yang rung bsod pa yang rung la bslangs te zan slong ba'i tshe na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: bos pa la sogs pa dus med pa bca' ba dang bza' ba ngan pa yang rung bsod pa yang rung la bslangs te zan slong ba'i tshe na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: This means that after the four months of the invitation ceremony are completed, if he accepts a separate invitation and so on, without regard to the time, and begs for food, whether it is bad food or good food, then it is a misdeed.🔽If he eats it, it is a downfall.

original: zos na ltung byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zos na ltung byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: dge slong gis ngan pa la mgron du bos pa na bsod pa slong na de slong ba na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong gis ngan pa la mgron du bos pa na bsod pa slong na de slong ba na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If a fully ordained monk is invited to a bad meal and he begs for a good meal, then when he begs for it, it is a misdeed.

original: za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngar mgron du bos pa'i gnas kyi yul la kha na mtho ba 'di rnam par gzhag gi sngar mgron du ma bos pa'i gnas kyi yul la bsod pa slong ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur te
analyzed: za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sngar mgron du bos pa'i gnas kyi yul la kha na mtho ba 'di rnam par gzhag gi sngar mgron du ma bos pa'i gnas kyi yul la bsod pa slong ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur te
translated: The phrase one commits a downfall by eating means that this downfall is posited in terms of the place where one was invited to eat previously. It is not a downfall to request good food in a place where one was not previously invited to eat.

original: / de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
analyzed: / de gnyis kyi bye brag ni de yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the two.

original: dge slong gi bsod pa la mgron du ma bos pa na ngan pa slong na de slong ba la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong gi bsod pa la mgron du ma bos pa na ngan pa slong na de slong ba la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If a monk who has not been invited to eat requests bad food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct in requesting.

original: za ba la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang sngar mgron du bos pa'i gnas kyi yul la ni mgron du bos pa las ring du 'dug pa'i gnas skabs kyi kha na ma tho ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: za ba la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang sngar mgron du bos pa'i gnas kyi yul la ni mgron du bos pa las ring du 'dug pa'i gnas skabs kyi kha na ma tho ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The phrase one commits an offense of wrong conduct by eating means that this downfall is posited in terms of the place where one was invited to eat previously.

original: sngar mgron du ma bos pa'i yul la ni bsod pa slong ba'i skabs kyi kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngar mgron du ma bos pa'i yul la ni bsod pa slong ba'i skabs kyi kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: It is a downfall to request good food in a place where one was not previously invited to eat.

original: de gnyis kyi bye brag kyang de yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bye brag kyang de yin no //
translated: This is the difference between the two.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na bud med kyi yul zas khyer te 'ongs na dge slong gis slong mo cho ga mi 'dod do zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na bud med kyi yul zas khyer te 'ongs na dge slong gis slong mo cho ga mi 'dod do zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: When a monk who has entered for alms is approached by a woman carrying food, he should say, “I do not wish to receive alms in this way.”

original: gal te bud med kyi yul na re 'phags pa ci zhig bzhed ces zer na @173a * //
analyzed: gal te bud med kyi yul na re 'phags pa ci zhig bzhed ces zer na @173a * //
translated: If the woman asks, “Noble one, what do you wish?”

original: bstabs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bstabs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: he should say, “I wish to be offered food.”

original: gang 'dod pa de bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar zla ba bzhir mgron du bos pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu khyim de nyid nas sbyin bdag de skad zer na bstabs pa yin pas mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'i ltung byed du🔽mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa de bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sngar zla ba bzhir mgron du bos pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu khyim de nyid nas sbyin bdag de skad zer na bstabs pa yin pas mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'i ltung byed du mi 'gyur la /
translated: “Whatever is desired should be requested” means that after the four months of prior invitation have been completed, if the same benefactor in that house says this, it is an offering. Therefore, it is not a downfall of staying too long on an invitation.

original: sngar mgron du ma bos pa'i khyim nas sbyin bdag de skad zer na yang bstabs pa yin pas bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngar mgron du ma bos pa'i khyim nas sbyin bdag de skad zer na yang bstabs pa yin pas bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the benefactor in a house where one has not previously been invited says this, it is also an offering. Therefore, it is not a downfall of receiving alms.

original: de gnyis kyi bye brag kyang de yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bye brag kyang de yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: This is how the difference between the two should be understood.

original: mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa bzhi pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The seventy-fourth downfall is finished.

original: // / thun mong zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams kyi thun mong ngo //
analyzed: // / thun mong zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams kyi thun mong ngo //
translated: The term “in common” means that [the training] is common to both monks and nuns.

original: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma gnyi ga'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma gnyi ga'i dge 'dun no //
translated: The term “both orders” means both the monks’ and nuns’ orders.

original: khur bslang zhes bya ba ni byis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bo nyid kyi ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dag gis phung por bstsags pa'o /
analyzed: khur bslang zhes bya ba ni byis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bo nyid kyi ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dag gis phung por bstsags pa'o /
translated: The term “to take up the burden” means to accumulate the burden of the verbal misdeeds of body and speech, such as the words “child” and so forth.

original: mgo zhes bya ba ni lus so //
analyzed: mgo zhes bya ba ni lus so //
translated: The term “head” means the body.

original: nod do zhes bya ba ni len to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nod do zhes bya ba ni len to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “to take” means to accept.

original: phyugs chung zhes bya ba ni long tsho la bab pa gzhon nu ma'o //
analyzed: phyugs chung zhes bya ba ni long tsho la bab pa gzhon nu ma'o //
translated: The term “young girl” means a young woman of marriageable age.

original: mdo sde mtha' dag 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i gzhung 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde mtha' dag 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i gzhung 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The term “to uphold the entire sūtra collection” means to uphold the sūtra collection’s scriptures.

original: 'dul ba mtha' dag 'dzin pa dang / ma mo mtha' dag 'dzin pa zhes bya ba yang 'dul ba'i gzhung dang ma mo'i gzhung 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba mtha' dag 'dzin pa dang / ma mo mtha' dag 'dzin pa zhes bya ba yang 'dul ba'i gzhung dang ma mo'i gzhung 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Also, “those who uphold the entire Vinaya” and “those who uphold the entire mātṛkā” means they uphold the texts of the Vinaya and the texts of the mātṛkā.

original: blo gros rmongs pa kha cig ma mo'i zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba ma mo yin par gsungs kyi //
analyzed: blo gros rmongs pa kha cig ma mo'i zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba ma mo yin par gsungs kyi //
translated: Some confused people say, “The mātṛkā is the Vinaya taught by the Bhagavān.🔽The Abhidharma is not the word of the Bhagavān, so it is not the mātṛkā.”

original: chos mngon pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin pas ma mo ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi gzhung ni 'dir 'dul ba mtha' dag 'dzin pa zhes gsungs pas 'dul ba'i ma mo ni yang 'dul ba mtha' dag ces bya ba'i khongs su
analyzed: chos mngon pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ma yin pas ma mo ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi gzhung ni 'dir 'dul ba mtha' dag 'dzin pa zhes gsungs pas 'dul ba'i ma mo ni yang 'dul ba mtha' dag ces bya ba'i khongs su
translated: Here, since it says “those who uphold the entire Vinaya,” the mātṛkā of the Vinaya is included in the category of “the entire Vinaya.”

original: gtogs pas 'dul ba'i sde snod nyid du gsungs so /
analyzed: gtogs pas 'dul ba'i sde snod nyid du gsungs so /
translated: Therefore, it is taught to be the Vinaya Piṭaka.

original: ma mo mtha' dag 'dzin pa zhes bya ba logs shig tu gsungs pas chos mngon pa nyid ma yin par bstan pas bsal bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma mo mtha' dag 'dzin pa zhes bya ba logs shig tu gsungs pas chos mngon pa nyid ma yin par bstan pas bsal bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Since it is taught separately as “those who uphold the entire mātṛkā,” it is understood to be excluded by the statement that the Abhidharma is not the mātṛkā.

original: nyes par bsam pa sems pa zhes bya ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa yid gnyis par spyod pa gsum sems pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par bsam pa sems pa zhes bya ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa yid gnyis par spyod pa gsum sems pa'o //
translated: The phrase he thinks evil thoughts refers to the three types of mental action: covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: nyes par smra bar brjod pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa ngag gi nyes par brjod pa bzhi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par smra bar brjod pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa ngag gi nyes par brjod pa bzhi brjod pa'o //
translated: The phrase he speaks evil words refers to the four types of verbal action: lying, slander, harsh speech, and frivolous speech.

original: nyes par bya ba'i las byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus @173b kyi nyes par spyod pa gsum byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyes par bya ba'i las byed pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus @173b kyi nyes par spyod pa gsum byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase he does evil actions refers to the three types of bodily action: killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct.

original: de dag gis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang bral ba bstan te //🔽mdo sde 'dzin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i tshig 'dzin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang bral ba bstan te // mdo sde 'dzin pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i tshig 'dzin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: These passages show that he is devoid of the wisdom that arises from birth.🔽The phrase he does not hold the sutras means that he does not hold the words of the sutras.

original: 'dul ba 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba yang 'dul ba'i tshig 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang / ma mo'i tshig 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba yang 'dul ba'i tshig 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang / ma mo'i tshig 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: The phrase he does not hold the Vinaya means that he does not hold the words of the Vinaya. The phrase he does not hold the mātṛkā means that he does not hold the words of the mātṛkā.

original: de dag gis ni lung las skyes pa'i shes rab dang bral ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni lung las skyes pa'i shes rab dang bral ba bstan to //
translated: These indicate a lack of the wisdom born from the scriptures.

original: mdo sde la mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i go mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde la mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i go mi shes pa'o //
translated: As for unclear about the sutras, one does not understand the sutras.

original: 'dul ba la mi gsal ba dang / ma mo la mi gsal ba zhes bya ba yang 'dul ba'i don mi shes pa dang / ma mo'i don mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba la mi gsal ba dang / ma mo la mi gsal ba zhes bya ba yang 'dul ba'i don mi shes pa dang / ma mo'i don mi shes pa ste /
translated: As for unclear about the Vinaya and unclear about the mātṛkā, one does not understand the meaning of the Vinaya and does not understand the meaning of the mātṛkā.

original: de dag gis ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang bral ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang bral ba bstan to //
translated: These indicate a lack of the wisdom born from reflection.

original: mdo sde la mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i don shes pa la shin tu ma goms pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde la mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i don shes pa la shin tu ma goms pa'o //
translated: As for unskilled in the sutras, one is not very familiar with understanding the meaning of the sutras.

original: 'dul ba la mi mkhas pa dang / ma mo la mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba yang 'dul ba'i don shes pa la shin tu ma goms pa dang / ma mo'i don shes pa la shin tu ma goms pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba la mi mkhas pa dang / ma mo la mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba yang 'dul ba'i don shes pa la shin tu ma goms pa dang / ma mo'i don shes pa la shin tu ma goms pa ste /
translated: As for unskilled in the Vinaya and unskilled in the mātṛkā, one is not very familiar with understanding the meaning of the Vinaya and is not very familiar with understanding the meaning of the mātṛkā.

original: de dag gis ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab la goms pa dang bral ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab la goms pa dang bral ba bstan to //
translated: These indicate a lack of familiarity with the wisdom born from reflection.

original: yang dag pa kho nar byis pa dang / glen pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa yin na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i blo med pas 'di la bslab pa nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung ba ni med kyi mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i ltung ba med pa ma yin
analyzed: yang dag pa kho nar byis pa dang / glen pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / mi mkhas pa yin na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i blo med pas 'di la bslab pa nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung ba ni med kyi mi'i skyon nas smra ba'i ltung ba med pa ma yin
