translated: This means that there is no offense for not placing the training in your mindstream, but there is not no offense for speaking of the faults of others.

original: no // bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: no // bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa lnga pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the seventy-fifth root downfall is finished.

original: // / gros byed ces bya ba ni blo mthun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: // / gros byed ces bya ba ni blo mthun par byed pa'o //
translated: “To discuss” means to agree.

original: 'jab ces bya ba ni sgo dang skar khung la sogs pa nas bdag nyid sbas te 'jab pa'o //🔽span spun zhes bya ba ni rtsva la sogs pa thibs po dag go //
analyzed: 'jab ces bya ba ni sgo dang skar khung la sogs pa nas bdag nyid sbas te 'jab pa'o // span spun zhes bya ba ni rtsva la sogs pa thibs po dag go //
translated: “To hide” means to hide oneself behind doors, windows, and so forth.🔽“Thickets” means thickets of grass and so forth.

original: tshad tshing zhes bya ba ni lcug ma dang gel ba dag la sogs pa thibs po dag go //
analyzed: tshad tshing zhes bya ba ni lcug ma dang gel ba dag la sogs pa thibs po dag go //
translated: “Thickets of trees” means thickets of branches and vines and so forth.

original: nyan rna zhes bya ba ni 'jab cing drung du 'dug ste nyan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan rna zhes bya ba ni 'jab cing drung du 'dug ste nyan pa'o //
translated: Listening means to listen while hiding nearby.

original: de lta bu'i bsam pas gnyen po zhes bya ba ni gros byed pa de dag gi mi mthun phyogs su gyur pa'i dge slong rnams kyi blo'i mi mthun phyogs kyis mi mthun pa bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pas gnyen po zhes bya ba ni gros byed pa de dag gi mi mthun phyogs su gyur pa'i dge slong rnams kyi blo'i mi mthun phyogs kyis mi mthun pa bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'o //
translated: The thought I will accomplish the goal of those who are not in accord with the minds of the monks who are adverse to the remedy means that one should accomplish the goal of those who are not in accord with the minds of the monks who are adverse to the remedy.

original: sgra thos zhes bya ba ni sgra nyi tshe thos pa'o //🔽sgra'i don go ba zhes bya ba ni tshig gi @174a * //
analyzed: sgra thos zhes bya ba ni sgra nyi tshe thos pa'o // sgra'i don go ba zhes bya ba ni tshig gi @174a * //
translated: Hearing the sound means hearing only the sound.

original: don go ba'o //
analyzed: don go ba'o //
translated: Understanding the meaning of the sound means understanding the meaning of the words.

original: nad dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: nad dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
translated: Not having a disease means not having an adverse condition.

original: gya tshom du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ci byed snyam du ma brtags par 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gya tshom du 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ci byed snyam du ma brtags par 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Engaging without hesitation means engaging without considering what to do.

original: mnyan nas nye bar zhi bar bya'o snyam pa zhes bya ba'i thab mo nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir nyan pa ste /
analyzed: mnyan nas nye bar zhi bar bya'o snyam pa zhes bya ba'i thab mo nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir nyan pa ste /
translated: Having listened, one should think I will pacify. Listening is for the purpose of pacifying disputes.

original: de la ni nyan rna ba las gyur pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ni nyan rna ba las gyur pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no offense if he is listening to the Dharma.

original: nyan rna ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: nyan rna ba las gyur pa'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa drug pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The seventy-sixth case is concluded.

original: // / bslang zhes bya ba ni bsgrengs pa'o //
analyzed: // / bslang zhes bya ba ni bsgrengs pa'o //
translated: “To be lifted up” means to be raised up.

original: 'dod pa smos shig ces bya ba ni gang ci 'dod pa smros shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa smos shig ces bya ba ni gang ci 'dod pa smros shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “To speak of one’s desires” means to speak of whatever one desires.

original: gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba ni gtam rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: gtam rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba ni gtam rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: “To settle a discussion” means to analyze a discussion.

original: mi smra bar 'gro ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mi smra bar 'gro ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa bdun pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The seventy-seventh case is concluded.

original: // / glang chen lhas kyi bdag po zhes bya ba ni dge slong nag pa'i pha'i ming ngo //
analyzed: // / glang chen lhas kyi bdag po zhes bya ba ni dge slong nag pa'i pha'i ming ngo //
translated: “The owner of the elephant pond” is the name of the father of the monk Kāla.

original: nag pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong de nyid kyi ming ngo //🔽'di ni chos so zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i don gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: nag pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong de nyid kyi ming ngo // 'di ni chos so zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i don gzhag pa ste /
translated: “Kāla” is the name of the monk himself.

original: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “This is the Dharma” means to establish the meaning of the thing.🔽This is the definition of Abhidharma.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam par gzhag pa ste 'dul ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam par gzhag pa ste 'dul ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the Vinaya, the discipline, the rules of conduct.

original: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi nye bar ston pa rnam par gzhag pa ste mtshan nyid do //🔽gcig pus dge 'dun zlog par byed ces bya ba ni blo 'byed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi nye bar ston pa rnam par gzhag pa ste mtshan nyid do // gcig pus dge 'dun zlog par byed ces bya ba ni blo 'byed par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the Master, the teaching of the Four Noble Truths.🔽He creates a schism in the Saṃgha by himself alone.

original: gcig pus dge 'dun mi mthun par byed ces bya ba ni bya ba dang byed pa la mi mthun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pus dge 'dun mi mthun par byed ces bya ba ni bya ba dang byed pa la mi mthun par byed pa'o //
translated: He creates a schism in the Saṃgha by himself alone.

original: rtsod pa bzung ste rtsod cing 'dug ces bya ba ni dge 'dun dang lhan cig 'gal bar byed cing 'dug pa'o //🔽gtam gyi 'jug sdod par mi byed ces bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gtam gyi bar du gcod cing mi sdod par glo bur du gtam zer ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa bzung ste rtsod cing 'dug ces bya ba ni dge 'dun dang lhan cig 'gal bar byed cing 'dug pa'o // gtam gyi 'jug sdod par mi byed ces bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi gtam gyi bar du gcod cing mi sdod par glo bur du gtam zer ba'o //
translated: He remains in a dispute with the Saṃgha.🔽He does not wait for the end of the discussion.

original: gus par mi byed ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyis mi 'jigs pa ngo tsha ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gus par mi byed ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyis mi 'jigs pa ngo tsha ba med pa'o //
translated: He does not respect the Saṃgha.

original: rjes mi byed ces bya ba ni 'jig rten 'dis mi 'jigs pa'i ngo tsha med pa'o //
analyzed: rjes mi byed ces bya ba ni 'jig rten 'dis mi 'jigs pa'i ngo tsha med pa'o //
translated: The phrase not to be done again means to be without shame in the sense of not fearing the next world.

original: phyir smra bar bya'o snyam du sems zhes bya ba ni bzlog par bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: phyir smra bar bya'o snyam du sems zhes bya ba ni bzlog par bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The phrase to think, 'I will speak back to him' means to think, I will refute him.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi yul la'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi yul la'o //
translated: The phrase the Saṅgha means the Saṅgha's domain.

original: gang zag la zhes bya ba yang gang zag gi yul lo //
analyzed: gang zag la zhes bya ba yang gang zag gi yul lo //
translated: The phrase an individual means an individual's domain.

original: dge 'dun gyi tha snyad ces bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis gang zag gi las bcu gnyis la sogs par bskos pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi tha snyad ces bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis gang zag gi las bcu gnyis la sogs par bskos pa'o //
translated: The phrase the Saṅgha's convention means the Saṅgha's appointment of an individual to the twelve duties and so on.

original: shad @174b kyis sbyang ba zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: shad @174b kyis sbyang ba zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The phrase to be purified by investigation means to be purified by a response.

original: ma gus pa'i tshul gyi ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ma gus pa'i tshul gyi ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa brgyad pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the seventy-eighth downfall is finished.

original: // / zong zong ma yin par gyur ces bya ba ni chud zos par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: // / zong zong ma yin par gyur ces bya ba ni chud zos par gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase to be lost means to be wasted.

original: khye'u yi grva zhes bya ba ni mkhan po'i khyim mo //
analyzed: khye'u yi grva zhes bya ba ni mkhan po'i khyim mo //
translated: The phrase in the house of the novice means in the house of the preceptor.

original: phru tog btsugs zhes bya ba ni thab tu'o //
analyzed: phru tog btsugs zhes bya ba ni thab tu'o //
translated: The phrase to plant a sprout means in the hearth.

original: phyi bzhin 'brang zhes bya ba ni dgongs mal shin tu spags pa'o //
analyzed: phyi bzhin 'brang zhes bya ba ni dgongs mal shin tu spags pa'o //
translated: The phrase will follow you means that the bed will be very high.

original: srid pa tha ma pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba tha ma pa las gzhan du skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba tha ma pa las gzhan du skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase in your final existence means that you will not be reborn in any other existence after your last birth.

original: glo bas zhes bya ba ni khrel ba'o //
analyzed: glo bas zhes bya ba ni khrel ba'o //
translated: The word shame means embarrassment.

original: chang sar pa zhes bya ba ni bu ram chang gi bye brag ste shin tu myos par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chang sar pa zhes bya ba ni bu ram chang gi bye brag ste shin tu myos par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The word new refers to a particular type of palm wine that is very intoxicating.

original: legs 'ongs sgra ni bskyud gyur na zhes bya ba la bskyud gyur ces bya ba ni tha snyad brjed pa'o //
analyzed: legs 'ongs sgra ni bskyud gyur na zhes bya ba la bskyud gyur ces bya ba ni tha snyad brjed pa'o //
translated: The phrase you will forget the word 'welcome' means that you will forget the conventional term.

original: nges par zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ro //
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ro //
translated: The word certainly means clearly.

original: ma legs zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: ma legs zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The word unfortunate means suffering.

original: legs pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: legs pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o //
translated: The word fortunate means happiness.

original: mgon zhes bya ba ni yongs su skyong ba'o //
analyzed: mgon zhes bya ba ni yongs su skyong ba'o //
translated: The word protector means guardian.

original: gang dag khyod kyis gsung dga' dang zhes bya ba ni slob pa dag dang so so'i skye bo dge ba dag go //
analyzed: gang dag khyod kyis gsung dga' dang zhes bya ba ni slob pa dag dang so so'i skye bo dge ba dag go //
translated: The phrase those who delight in your speech refers to learners and ordinary beings who are virtuous.

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: The word noble refers to those who have exhausted the defilements.

original: de dag legs 'ongs lags zhes bya ba ni de dag gi mi'i nang du 'ongs pa dang song ba ni legs pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag legs 'ongs lags zhes bya ba ni de dag gi mi'i nang du 'ongs pa dang song ba ni legs pa yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase they are welcome means that they are welcome to come and go among human beings.

original: bdag ni skal ba dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag ni skal ba dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase I am unfortunate means

original: bsod nams nyams pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams nyams pa'o //
translated: that he has lost his merit.

original: brtse gnas zhes bya ba ni snying brtse bar bya ba'o ;
analyzed: brtse gnas zhes bya ba ni snying brtse bar bya ba'o ;
translated: The phrase a place of compassion means a place of pity.

original: / drag po'i gnas thob pa zhes bya ba ni nyam nga ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: / drag po'i gnas thob pa zhes bya ba ni nyam nga ba'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase a place of violence means a place of danger.

original: mya ngan zug rngus gzir ba lags zhes bya ba ni mya ngan gyi phur pas zug pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan zug rngus gzir ba lags zhes bya ba ni mya ngan gyi phur pas zug pa'o //
translated: The phrase tormented by the pain of grief means pierced by the stake of grief.

original: zad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase will not be exhausted means will not be completely exhausted.

original: kun dga'i ra ba rgyal bu dum bu zhes bya ba ni ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi nu bo rgyal bu nag po zhes bya ba ste de rgyal po'i btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du song ba dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyis de la me tog gis gtor ba rgyal pos thos nas /
analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba rgyal bu dum bu zhes bya ba ni ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi nu bo rgyal bu nag po zhes bya ba ste de rgyal po'i btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du song ba dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyis de la me tog gis gtor ba rgyal pos thos nas /
translated: The son of the king of Kosala named Sumukha was the brother of King Prasenajit. He was called Kalma˝hapada. He went to the inner palace of the king. The women of the inner palace threw flowers at him. The king heard about this and

original: rgyal pos de'i lag pa dum bu dum bur gtubs te bzhag pa dang / des bden pa'i tshig brjod nas /
analyzed: rgyal pos de'i lag pa dum bu dum bur gtubs te bzhag pa dang / des bden pa'i tshig brjod nas /
translated: had his hands cut off. He was left with stumps. He then spoke words of truth:🔽“May my hands become as they were before!”

original: dum bu de dag phyir 'byor bar 'gyur ba na 'jig rten gyis de'i ming dum bu zhes bya bar btags so //
analyzed: dum bu de dag phyir 'byor bar 'gyur ba na 'jig rten gyis de'i ming dum bu zhes bya bar btags so //
translated: The world called him Sumukha, “Good Face.”

original: de sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir kun dga'i rab brtsigs te me tog dag tu 'bul bas kun dga'i ra ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir kun dga'i rab brtsigs te me tog dag tu 'bul bas kun dga'i ra ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Because he was a devotee of the Buddha, he built a pleasure grove for the Blessed One and offered it to him. Because he offered flowers, it was called the pleasure grove.

original: lha mi rnams kyi @175a * //
analyzed: lha mi rnams kyi @175a * //
translated: The gods and humans

original: mchod gnas zhes bya ba ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mchod gnas zhes bya ba ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: are Indra, Brahma, and so forth.

original: de dag gi mchod pa'i gnas ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mchod pa'i gnas ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The objects of their worship are the noble Shariputra and so on.

original: de dag gis kyang ches mchod pa ni thub pa zhi ba bdag nyid ces bya ba ste //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang ches mchod pa ni thub pa zhi ba bdag nyid ces bya ba ste //
translated: And they are worshipped even more than they by the Sage, the one of peaceful nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Blessed One is what is meant.

original: tshur gshegs sbyon zhes bya ba ni tshur gshegs tshur gshegs zhes bya ba'i don te gus par sgrim pa'i phyir lan gnyis bzlas so //
analyzed: tshur gshegs sbyon zhes bya ba ni tshur gshegs tshur gshegs zhes bya ba'i don te gus par sgrim pa'i phyir lan gnyis bzlas so //
translated: Come, come, means come, come. The meaning is that he is respectfully urged twice.

original: mig la phan zhes bya ba ni mig dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mig la phan zhes bya ba ni mig dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Beneficial to the eyes means agreeable to the eyes.

original: zad par sngon po'i skye mched ces bya ba ni zad par gyi skye mched bcu'i skabs so //
analyzed: zad par sngon po'i skye mched ces bya ba ni zad par gyi skye mched bcu'i skabs so //
translated: The sphere of totality of blue means the occasion of the ten spheres of totality.

original: thabs kyi zhags pa zhes bya ba ni las sbyang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi zhags pa zhes bya ba ni las sbyang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The means of bondage means the purification of karma and so on.

original: bdag ni sngon chad legs 'ongs gyur ces bya ba ni pha gson pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sngon chad legs 'ongs gyur ces bya ba ni pha gson pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: I was Sujata in the past means when his father was alive.

original: kun mkhyen zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: kun mkhyen zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: Omniscient means the Tibetan word.

original: lcags 'dra ba dag gis ni zhe bya ba ni bdag so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na nyes pa du mas gang ba'i phyir dang / las su mi rung ba'i phyir lus lcags dang 'dra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lcags 'dra ba dag gis ni zhe bya ba ni bdag so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na nyes pa du mas gang ba'i phyir dang / las su mi rung ba'i phyir lus lcags dang 'dra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The line and my body was like iron means that in the state of being an ordinary being, my body was filled with many faults and was unworkable, so it was like iron.

original: khyod kyi gsung bden pa bzhi bstan pa'i mchog thos par gyur nas /🔽da ni gser dang 'dra ba yi //
analyzed: khyod kyi gsung bden pa bzhi bstan pa'i mchog thos par gyur nas / da ni gser dang 'dra ba yi //
translated: Having heard your supreme teaching of the four noble truths,

original: zag pa med pa'i lus kyang thob //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lus kyang thob //
translated: now I have attained a body that is like gold.

original: ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that I have attained a body free of afflictions.🔽Those who seek to attain jewels and so forth,

original: rin chen la sogs pa 'thob pa dang // mtho ris thar pa 'tshal ba yis //🔽rtag tu phan pa bzhed pa yi //
analyzed: rin chen la sogs pa 'thob pa dang // mtho ris thar pa 'tshal ba yis // rtag tu phan pa bzhed pa yi //
translated: and those who seek high rebirth and liberation,🔽should always rely on a spiritual friend

original: dge bshes bsten par bgyi ba bzang //
analyzed: dge bshes bsten par bgyi ba bzang //
translated: who is always benevolent.

original: zhes bya ba ni rin po che dang rgyal srid la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i tshe 'di'i don 'thob par 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i tshe phyi ma'i don mtho ris 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don thar pa 'dod pas rtag tu phan pa bzhed pa thugs rje dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams brten par bya ste 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rin po che dang rgyal srid la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i tshe 'di'i don 'thob par 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i tshe phyi ma'i don mtho ris 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don thar pa 'dod pas rtag tu phan pa bzhed pa thugs rje dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams brten par bya ste 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang /
translated: This is the meaning: those who always desire the benefit of the world, who desire the benefit of the next world, and who desire the benefit of the transcendence of the world, should rely on the Tathagatas, who are compassionate and always intent on benefit.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis zin pa'i sems can rnams bzang zhing bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis zin pa'i sems can rnams bzang zhing bde bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because those who are taken hold of by spiritual friends are good and happy.

original: kun du mdzes zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen pa thams cad kyis mdzes pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun du mdzes zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen pa thams cad kyis mdzes pa yin pa'o //
translated: Beautiful means beautiful in every way, as a monk and as a fully ordained monk.

original: gang du rdib pa zhes bya ba ni bkur sti ma yin pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang du rdib pa zhes bya ba ni bkur sti ma yin pa thob pa'o //
translated: Where it sinks means where it is not honored.

original: klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa zhes bya ba ni rdzing gi chu gang shing aa mras mtshon @175b pa de ni aa mra'i chu yin la /
analyzed: klu aa mra'i chu ngogs pa zhes bya ba ni rdzing gi chu gang shing aa mras mtshon @175b pa de ni aa mra'i chu yin la /
translated: The nāga on the bank of the mango river is the nāga who lives on the bank of the river that is the mango river.🔽The mango river is the river that is marked by the mango tree.

original: chu'i ngogs na gnas pa'i klu gang yin pa de ni klu aa mra'i chu'i ngogs pa zhes bya'o //🔽khon ma mchis pa rnams la khon du 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yid sdang ba med pa rnams la yid sdang bar 'dzin pa'o //🔽mi 'gran pa rnams la 'gran tshol zhes bya ba ni gnod pa mi byed pa rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i ngogs na gnas pa'i klu gang yin pa de ni klu aa mra'i chu'i ngogs pa zhes bya'o // khon ma mchis pa rnams la khon du 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yid sdang ba med pa rnams la yid sdang bar 'dzin pa'o // mi 'gran pa rnams la 'gran tshol zhes bya ba ni gnod pa mi byed pa rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: The nāga who lives on the bank of the river is called the nāga on the bank of the mango river.🔽Those who are not angry he holds as angry is the one who holds as angry those who are without mental anger.🔽Those who are not rivals he seeks as rivals is the one who seeks as rivals those who do not harm.

original: mi 'khu ba rnams la 'khu zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba rnams la slu ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'khu ba rnams la 'khu zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba rnams la slu ba'o //
translated: Those who are not deceitful he holds as deceitful is the one who holds as deceitful those who are not deceptive.

original: gang klu aa smra'i chu ngogs pa 'dul bar spro ba des tshul shing long shig ces bya ba ni 'phags pa legs 'ongs kyi che ba nyid bsgrag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang klu aa smra'i chu ngogs pa 'dul bar spro ba des tshul shing long shig ces bya ba ni 'phags pa legs 'ongs kyi che ba nyid bsgrag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The one who is willing to tame the nāga on the bank of the mango river should take a voting stick is for the purpose of proclaiming the greatness of the noble Su­bhūti.

original: 'di ltar gang la bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag kyang mi 'jug pa de 'dis byas so zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag kyang mi 'jug pa de 'dis byas so zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One and the most venerable of elders do not enter a place where this has been done.

original: khyod kyis lus kyi dbang po bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa dang bag yod pa'i phyir dang / dge 'dun gyi nang na 'phags pa legs 'ongs seng ge'i sgra sgrog tu gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis lus kyi dbang po bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa dang bag yod pa'i phyir dang / dge 'dun gyi nang na 'phags pa legs 'ongs seng ge'i sgra sgrog tu gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You should protect the faculty of bodily action means that because of being an arhat and being heedful, Subhadra should be allowed to roar the lion's roar among the Saṅgha.

original: bka' nyan zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bka' nyan zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: To obey means not to transgress.

original: g-yo bar mi nus zhes bya ba ni 'gul bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo bar mi nus zhes bya ba ni 'gul bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: To be unable to move means unable to shake.

original: shi bar gtam thos sam zhes bya ba ni shi bar grags pa thos sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shi bar gtam thos sam zhes bya ba ni shi bar grags pa thos sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To hear the news of death means to hear the report of death.

original: dul ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'o //
analyzed: dul ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'o //
translated: A tamed place means a tamed place.

original: nye bar ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni skyon can no //
analyzed: nye bar ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni skyon can no //
translated: Not peaceful means faulty.

original: ji bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni ji zhig bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni ji zhig bya ba'o //
translated: What should be done means what should be done.

original: bya mo lab ces bya ba ni dga' ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bya mo lab ces bya ba ni dga' ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: A hen-like one means one who gives pleasure.

original: krog krog dkrugs te zhes bya ba ni bsdoms pa'i sgra krog krog dkrugs te'o //
analyzed: krog krog dkrugs te zhes bya ba ni bsdoms pa'i sgra krog krog dkrugs te'o //
translated: The phrase stirring up a commotion means a commotion of a collection.

original: lo ma ma yin pa'i spyil bu zhes bya ba ni rdo la sogs pa las byas pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma ma yin pa'i spyil bu zhes bya ba ni rdo la sogs pa las byas pa'o //
translated: A hut of non-leaves is one made of stone, etc.

original: sbrul phru gu zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyi phru gu'o //
analyzed: sbrul phru gu zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyi phru gu'o //
translated: A snake's young is a baby snake.

original: ma bsams so zhes bya ba ni so sor ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsams so zhes bya ba ni so sor ma brtags pa'o //
translated: The phrase without reflection means without analysis.

original: 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba 'thung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang myos par 'gyur ba 'thung zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase drinking alcohol that causes intoxication, whether of grain or of herbs means the following.

original: 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang gi mtshan nyid ni myos par 'gyur bar bya ba ste ra ro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bru'i chang dang bcos pa'i chang gi mtshan nyid ni myos par 'gyur bar bya ba ste ra ro bar byed pa'o //
translated: The definition of alcohol of grain and alcohol of herbs is that which causes intoxication, that is, which makes one drunk.

original: de 'thung ba ni mgul du mid pa'o //
analyzed: de 'thung ba ni mgul du mid pa'o //
translated: Drinking it means swallowing it.

original: myang ba zhes bya ba ni myang bar bya ba ma yin pas myang ba ste /
analyzed: myang ba zhes bya ba ni myang bar bya ba ma yin pas myang ba ste /
translated: The phrase drinking what should not be drunk means that which should not be drunk.

original: reg bya min par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: reg bya min par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as a tactile object.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni de la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni de la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase alone means free from that and so on.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni myos par 'gyur ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni myos par 'gyur ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase unmixed means free from intoxication.

original: de ji ltar srid ce na /🔽de'i phyir de yang @176a * //
analyzed: de ji ltar srid ce na / de'i phyir de yang @176a * //
translated: How is that possible?🔽Therefore it is said:🔽That also is intoxicating.

original: tsha nyid du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te yang myos pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tsha nyid du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te yang myos pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is not intoxicating.

original: nu rdzi zhes bya ba ni snyigs ma'o //🔽sbang ma zhes bya ba ni chang gi sbang ma'o //
analyzed: nu rdzi zhes bya ba ni snyigs ma'o // sbang ma zhes bya ba ni chang gi sbang ma'o //
translated: The dregs are called “nudi.”🔽The dregs of beer are called “svaṅgama.”

original: tshigs ma zhes bya ba ni myos par 'gyur ba'i tshigs ma'o //
analyzed: tshigs ma zhes bya ba ni myos par 'gyur ba'i tshigs ma'o //
translated: The dregs of alcohol are called “tiṣa.”

original: phabs zhes bya ba ni 'bru'i chang dang mnan pa'i rdzas te 'di la ni mgul par btung ba med pas nyes byas su gsungs so //
analyzed: phabs zhes bya ba ni 'bru'i chang dang mnan pa'i rdzas te 'di la ni mgul par btung ba med pas nyes byas su gsungs so //
translated: The yeast of beer and alcohol is called “pūtanā.” Since there is no drinking from the neck in this case, it is said to be a minor offense.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu mos par 'gyur ba dag za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yang mgul du mid pa'i btung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu mos par 'gyur ba dag za na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yang mgul du mid pa'i btung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one eats flowers and fruits that are intoxicating, there is a minor offense. Since there is no drinking from the neck,

original: bskol ba 'thungs pa la ni myos pa med pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bskol ba 'thungs pa la ni myos pa med pa'i phyir ltung ba med do //
translated: there is no offense if one drinks a boiled infusion, since it is not intoxicating.

original: khur bar bsrel ba dag lus dag skud pa ni na ba'i phyir nyes byas kyang med do //
analyzed: khur bar bsrel ba dag lus dag skud pa ni na ba'i phyir nyes byas kyang med do //
translated: There is no minor offense if one anoints one’s body with the dregs, since one is sick.

original: myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba'i ltung byed de bdun cu rtsa dgu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The seventy-ninth downfall in the category of “downfalls that require confession without any reference point” is now complete.

original: // / mchog thob pa zhes bya ba ni bag mar 'gror nye ba'o //🔽legs par sbas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis zil gyis mi non pa'o //
analyzed: // / mchog thob pa zhes bya ba ni bag mar 'gror nye ba'o // legs par sbas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis zil gyis mi non pa'o //
translated: “To be taken as a bride” means to be married.🔽“Well hidden” means not to be overcome by others.

original: legs par bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gzhan dag dang mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid gzhan dag dang mi spyod pa'o //
translated: “Well protected” means not to be involved with others.

original: grong bar zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
analyzed: grong bar zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
translated: “In the middle of a town” means in a region.

original: phas drangs tshus drangs zhes bya ba ni phan tshun nas drangs pa'o //
analyzed: phas drangs tshus drangs zhes bya ba ni phan tshun nas drangs pa'o //
translated: “To be drawn by the father and drawn by the mother” means to be drawn by both.

original: spobs pa can zhes bya ba ni sel gyi zhag par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa can zhes bya ba ni sel gyi zhag par rtogs pa'o //
translated: “To be eloquent” means to be able to speak.

original: grog ma phra mo zhes bya ba ni thur mas mtshon dgos pa chung ngu'o //🔽lus brtan pa zhes bya ba ni stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: grog ma phra mo zhes bya ba ni thur mas mtshon dgos pa chung ngu'o // lus brtan pa zhes bya ba ni stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “To be like an ant” means to be so small that one can only be seen with a probe.🔽“To have a firm body” means to be strong.

original: mkhrang ba zhes bya ba ni lus rgyas shing ha cang gzhon sha can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mkhrang ba zhes bya ba ni lus rgyas shing ha cang gzhon sha can ma yin pa'o //
translated: “To be solid” means to have a full body and not to be too thin.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni lus tshigs shin tu 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni lus tshigs shin tu 'byor pa'o //
translated: The word excellent means having very well-developed limbs.

original: mgo drung ba can gcad ces bya ba ni gnya' ba gcad pa'o //
analyzed: mgo drung ba can gcad ces bya ba ni gnya' ba gcad pa'o //
translated: The word cut off means to be beheaded.

original: gser gyi 'od lta bu zhes bya ba ni gser gyi 'od 'bar ba lta bur ser lam mer 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gser gyi 'od lta bu zhes bya ba ni gser gyi 'od 'bar ba lta bur ser lam mer 'dug pa'o //
translated: The word golden radiance means to be radiant like the shining light of gold.

original: nad ngan zhes bya ba ni gzhang 'brum mo //
analyzed: nad ngan zhes bya ba ni gzhang 'brum mo //
translated: The word bad disease means hemorrhoids.

original: dge slong 'dug pa la smra bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang 'dug pa la kho bo grong du 'gro ba'o zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'dug pa la smra bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang 'dug pa la kho bo grong du 'gro ba'o zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: The word to the monk who is sitting means to the monk who is sitting there, one should say, I am going to the village.

original: bka' mchid kyang su med ces bya ba ni su zhig sems zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bka' mchid kyang su med ces bya ba ni su zhig sems zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word no conversation means no one is thinking.

original: sdang ba ma mchis zhes bya ba ni 'di sdang ba'i sems med pa'o //
analyzed: sdang ba ma mchis zhes bya ba ni 'di sdang ba'i sems med pa'o //
translated: The word no hatred means no hateful mind.

original: gnod pa ma bgyis zhes bya ba ni gnod par 'gyur ba ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa ma bgyis zhes bya ba ni gnod par 'gyur ba ma byas pa'o //
translated: The word no harm means no harm will be done.

original: ba lang gi mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni ba lang mang po gsod pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni ba lang mang po gsod pa'o //
translated: The word cow sacrifice means killing many cows.

original: ba lang gi 'bu sgra zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi 'bu sgra zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi sgra'o //
translated: The word cow-cry means the sound of cows.

original: rnga bran zhes bya ba ni ba lang gzhon nu'o //
analyzed: rnga bran zhes bya ba ni ba lang gzhon nu'o //
translated: The term “young bull” means a young ox.

original: sems pa g-yos zhes bya ba @176b ni las 'du byed sems pa skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems pa g-yos zhes bya ba @176b ni las 'du byed sems pa skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the mind was disturbed” means that the volition that is the formative force of the action arose.

original: lus kyi mchod rten zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung gi mchod rten no //
analyzed: lus kyi mchod rten zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung gi mchod rten no //
translated: The phrase “a stūpa of the body” means a stūpa containing the relics of a Pratyekabuddha.

original: dus ma yin par 'gro ba'i ltung byed de brgyad cu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'gro ba'i ltung byed de brgyad cu pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The eighty-fourth chapter of the Verses of the Vinaya is completed.

original: // / rgyus mi shes zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi rnam par gzhag pa mngon par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: // / rgyus mi shes zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi rnam par gzhag pa mngon par mi shes pa'o //
translated: The term “unacquainted” means that he did not know the rules of the monks.

original: ci bde gyis shig ces bya ba ni gdan dag stobs shig ces bya ba'o //🔽gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal te //
analyzed: ci bde gyis shig ces bya ba ni gdan dag stobs shig ces bya ba'o // gzhan dbang thams cad sdug bsngal te //
translated: The phrase “do as you please” means “set out the seats.”

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag las pa ni dga' ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽bdag dbang thams cad bde ba yin //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag las pa ni dga' ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag dbang thams cad bde ba yin //
translated: The verse “All that is dependent is suffering” means that what is dependent on another is not pleasant.

original: zhes bya ba ni ci dgar nye bar spyad du yod pas dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ci dgar nye bar spyad du yod pas dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The verse “All that is independent is happiness” means that what is not dependent on another is pleasant because it can be used as one wishes.

original: de'i phyir / thun mong dag gis gnod byed de //
analyzed: de'i phyir / thun mong dag gis gnod byed de //
translated: Therefore, the common refutation is this.🔽

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽“They are harmed by the common ones.”

original: gzhan la rag las pa'i don dag gis ni gnod pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa'i don dag gis ni gnod pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The meaning of “dependent on another” is that they are harmed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'brel ba shin tu 'da' bar dka' //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'brel ba shin tu 'da' bar dka' //
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “The connection is very difficult to overcome.”

original: gang gi phyir thun mong ba'i rdzas dang 'brel pa rkyan dang tshogs pa'i dbang gzhan la rag las pas gnod pa byed pa yin pa de'i phyir thun mong gi rdzas dag gis gnod pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thun mong ba'i rdzas dang 'brel pa rkyan dang tshogs pa'i dbang gzhan la rag las pas gnod pa byed pa yin pa de'i phyir thun mong gi rdzas dag gis gnod pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they are harmed by the power of the condition of the connection with the common substance, which is dependent on another, therefore, it is said that they are harmed by the common substances.

original: zas thob nas zhes bya ba ni zas chung zad brims nas so //
analyzed: zas thob nas zhes bya ba ni zas chung zad brims nas so //
translated: “Having obtained food” means having received a little food.

original: zas ma thob pa kho nar zhes bya ba ni zas ye ma brims pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: zas ma thob pa kho nar zhes bya ba ni zas ye ma brims pa kho nar ro //
translated: “Having not obtained food” means having not received any food at all.

original: zang zing gi ched la zhes bya ba ni zang zing gi rgyu la'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi ched la zhes bya ba ni zang zing gi rgyu la'o //
translated: “For the sake of material things” means for the cause of material things.

original: chos kyi ched la zhes bya ba yang chos kyi rgyu la'o //
analyzed: chos kyi ched la zhes bya ba yang chos kyi rgyu la'o //
translated: “For the sake of the Dharma” also means for the cause of the Dharma.

original: rgyu bar phyed ces bya ba ni 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu bar phyed ces bya ba ni 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Moving around” means going.

original: khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni kho bo la ma sdod par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: khyim pa 'dug pa la bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni kho bo la ma sdod par brims shig ces bsgo bar bya ste /
translated: “One should tell the layperson” means one should tell the layperson, “Don’t stay with me, send me away.”

original: sbyin bdag la de skad chems gzhag par bya'o//
analyzed: sbyin bdag la de skad chems gzhag par bya'o//
translated: One should make this request to the patron.

original: snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni cig car gsungs pas snga dro dang gnyi ga khyim pa la ma bsgo bar khyim rgyur song na dngos gzhi gcig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: snga dro dang phyi dro khyim dag tu rgyu zhing zhes bya ba ni cig car gsungs pas snga dro dang gnyi ga khyim pa la ma bsgo bar khyim rgyur song na dngos gzhi gcig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Moving around in the houses in the morning and evening” means that since this is stated all at once, if one goes to move around in the houses of both the morning and the evening without telling the layperson, there is one root downfall.

original: snga dro'am phyi dro khyim du song ba la ni nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga dro'am phyi dro khyim du song ba la ni nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: But if one goes to the houses in the morning or the evening, one should understand that there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed de brgyad cu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: grong rgyu ba'i ltung byed de brgyad cu gcig pa'i tshig rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the words of the eighty-first downfall is finished.

original: // / ri rab kyi bang rim zhes bya ba ni ri rab las rim pa phyir 'thon pa bzhi yod pa ni ri rab kyi bang rim zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: // / ri rab kyi bang rim zhes bya ba ni ri rab las rim pa phyir 'thon pa bzhi yod pa ni ri rab kyi bang rim zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The terraces of Mount Meru” are the four terraces that extend out from Mount Meru, which are called “the terraces of Mount Meru.”

original: gser gyi ri bdun zhes bya ba ni gnya' shing 'dzin dang / gshol mda' 'dzin dang / seng ldeng can dang / blta na sdug dang / rta rna dang / rnam par 'dud dang / @177a * //🔽mu khyud 'dzin zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: gser gyi ri bdun zhes bya ba ni gnya' shing 'dzin dang / gshol mda' 'dzin dang / seng ldeng can dang / blta na sdug dang / rta rna dang / rnam par 'dud dang / @177a * // mu khyud 'dzin zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The so-called seven golden mountains are Yugandhara, Īṣādhara, Khadiraka, Sudarśana, Aśvakarṇa, Vinataka, and Nimindhara.

original: mtsho chen po ma dros pa dang / rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab pa na zhes bya ba ni de dag gi drung na gnas yod pa'o //
analyzed: mtsho chen po ma dros pa dang / rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab pa na zhes bya ba ni de dag gi drung na gnas yod pa'o //
translated: The so-called great lake Anavatapta and the pond called Manasa are located near them.

original: rin po che sna bzhi zhes bya ba ni gser dang / dngul dang / beed'urya dang / shel lo //
analyzed: rin po che sna bzhi zhes bya ba ni gser dang / dngul dang / beed'urya dang / shel lo //
translated: The so-called four kinds of jewels are gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: bskal par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bskal pa bar ma bzhi bcu la bskal par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bskal par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bskal pa bar ma bzhi bcu la bskal par shes par bya'o //
translated: The so-called eon means forty intermediate eons.

original: sa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sa yongs su skyong ba'o //
analyzed: sa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sa yongs su skyong ba'o //
translated: The so-called earth-holding mountains are the mountains that protect the earth.

original: 'dab chags kyi rgyal po 'dab bzangs zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lding ngo //
analyzed: 'dab chags kyi rgyal po 'dab bzangs zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' lding ngo //
translated: The so-called king of birds, Garuḍa, is a garuḍa.

original: de dbyung bar mi nus zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mi gnon pa'o //
analyzed: de dbyung bar mi nus zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mi gnon pa'o //
translated: The so-called cannot be expelled means cannot be surpassed.

original: khyad par can ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'o//
analyzed: khyad par can ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'o//
translated: “Not distinguished” means not a holy person.

original: khyad par can zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa'o //
translated: “Distinguished” means a holy person.

original: rtsi ba rar dngar zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i sta gon byas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsi ba rar dngar zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i sta gon byas pa'o //
translated: “To be killed” means to be prepared for death.

original: lnga nyid du bsgrubs zhes bya ba ni gsad pa ste 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / nam mkha'i khams dang lnga'i bag la zhes byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga nyid du bsgrubs zhes bya ba ni gsad pa ste 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / nam mkha'i khams dang lnga'i bag la zhes byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “To be established as five” means to be killed, because of the five elements: the four great elements and the space element.

original: sbyin bdag sbyin zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag sbyin zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The donor gives” means for the sake of benefiting others.

original: bsod nams dag ces bya ba ni mchod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dag ces bya ba ni mchod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Merit” means for the sake of worship.

original: longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa can zhes bya ba ni 'dra bar smin pas rnam par smin pa ste //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa can zhes bya ba ni 'dra bar smin pas rnam par smin pa ste //
translated: “The maturation of enjoyment” means the maturation of a similar result,

original: longs spyod kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: because it is the result of enjoyment.

original: gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba bdag la gnod pa med pa ste gtan yongs su btang zhing phyis ltos pa med pa dang / bdag la gnod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba bdag la gnod pa med pa ste gtan yongs su btang zhing phyis ltos pa med pa dang / bdag la gnod pa med pa ste /
translated: Not harmful means not harmful to oneself, that is, not harmful to others.

original: gzhan las phrogs pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las phrogs pa la sogs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not stolen means not taken from another.

original: 'dod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khong du chud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khong du chud par bya ba'o //
translated: To be desired means to be understood.

original: shing s'a la chen po lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'byor pa rgya chen po'o //🔽aar mo nig ces bya ba ni thags ma khra bo'o //
analyzed: shing s'a la chen po lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'byor pa rgya chen po'o // aar mo nig ces bya ba ni thags ma khra bo'o //
translated: Like a great sāla tree means to be prosperous.🔽 Like a piece of kācilindi cloth means to be variegated.

original: rnam par rgyal byed yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyal byed yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan mdzes pa'o //
translated: Like a banner of victory means to be beautiful.

original: shur bus lhas pa zhes bya ba ni thags su btags pa'o //
analyzed: shur bus lhas pa zhes bya ba ni thags su btags pa'o //
translated: Like a well-fitting turban means to be well-arranged.

original: stan sbyar ma dang / nang tshangs can dang / khra bo dang / chen po dang / bzang po dang zhes bya ba ni 'og rims su gding ba'i stan no //
analyzed: stan sbyar ma dang / nang tshangs can dang / khra bo dang / chen po dang / bzang po dang zhes bya ba ni 'og rims su gding ba'i stan no //
translated: A mat, a woolen blanket, a multicolored woolen cloth, a large woolen cloth, and an excellent woolen cloth means a mat to sit on.

original: sum tshan gyi gos kyi steng g-yogs zhes bya ba ni steng rim du gding ba'i stan te yul sum tshan zhes bya ba nas byung ba'i ras so //
analyzed: sum tshan gyi gos kyi steng g-yogs zhes bya ba ni steng rim du gding ba'i stan te yul sum tshan zhes bya ba nas byung ba'i ras so //
translated: The upper covering of the three-part cloth is a mat spread on top, made of cloth from the three-part region.

original: steng nas bgo ba'i gos dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi steng nas bgo ba'i gos dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: steng nas bgo ba'i gos dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyi steng nas bgo ba'i gos dang bcas pa'o //
translated: With the upper garment means with the upper garment on the body.

original: gnyis su rgyab dmar po bzhag pa zhes bya ba ni sngas dang rten ma'i phyogs su sngas nang tshangs can @177b dmar po re re bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su rgyab dmar po bzhag pa zhes bya ba ni sngas dang rten ma'i phyogs su sngas nang tshangs can @177b dmar po re re bzhag pa'o //
translated: With two red pillows means with a red inner pillow on each side, for the head and back.

original: ras zung zhes bya ba ni ras yug gnyis so //🔽khar ba'i zo ba can zhes bya ba ni 'o ma bzho ba'i snod khar ba las byas pa'i zo ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ras zung zhes bya ba ni ras yug gnyis so // khar ba'i zo ba can zhes bya ba ni 'o ma bzho ba'i snod khar ba las byas pa'i zo ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: A pair of cloth means two lengths of cloth.🔽With a milking pail means with a milking pail made of wood.

original: ras bcos bu phrugs kyis g-yogs pa zhes bya ba ni ras zung gcig gis g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: ras bcos bu phrugs kyis g-yogs pa zhes bya ba ni ras zung gcig gis g-yogs pa'o //
translated: Covered with a pair of fine cloth means covered with a single pair of cloth.

original: mgul rgyan dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gser gyi mgul rgyan can no //
analyzed: mgul rgyan dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gser gyi mgul rgyan can no //
translated: With a golden necklace means with a golden necklace.

original: lhag pa can zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa can zhes bya ba ni sbrang rtsi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The special is honey, etc.

original: gzhibs pa zhes bya ba ni aa mra'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhibs pa zhes bya ba ni aa mra'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The crushed is the mango fruit, etc.

original: phyi rol pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The non-Buddhist is the non-arising of the noble path.

original: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa'o //
translated: The free from passion for sense objects is the abandonment of passion for sense objects.

original: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni nges pa la ma zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni nges pa la ma zhugs pa ste /
translated: The ordinary person is the one who has not entered certainty.

original: 'dir so so'i skye bo zhes smos pa ni kha cig na re 'dod chags dang bral ba dag pas kyang khyad par du 'phags pa ngo mtshar che bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir so so'i skye bo zhes smos pa ni kha cig na re 'dod chags dang bral ba dag pas kyang khyad par du 'phags pa ngo mtshar che bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the mention of ordinary person is for the purpose of teaching the wonder of the superiority of the bodhisattva, because some say that even those free from passion are superior.

original: kha cig na re rigs pa thob nas brtsams te 'phags pa'i lam thob pa dag byang chub sems dpa' yin par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rigs pa thob nas brtsams te 'phags pa'i lam thob pa dag byang chub sems dpa' yin par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say it is for the purpose of eliminating the understanding that those who have attained the noble path, beginning with the attainment of the lineage, are bodhisattvas.

original: 'dzam bu'i tshal du 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tha ma pa 'dzam bu gling du skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i tshal du 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tha ma pa 'dzam bu gling du skyes pa'o //
translated: The phrase having come to the Rose Apple Land means that the bodhisattva who is in his final existence is born in the Rose Apple Land.

original: 'di drang srong gi 'og tu smos la phyi ma dag tu ma smos pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid yang drang srong 'dod chags dang bral ba dag dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di drang srong gi 'og tu smos la phyi ma dag tu ma smos pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid yang drang srong 'dod chags dang bral ba dag dang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is mentioned after the sages and not after the others because his state as an ordinary person is similar to that of the sages who are free from attachment.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gcig la zan byin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gcig la zan byin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase having given a meal to one who is intent on manifesting the fruit of stream-entry means that he gave a meal to a person who was intent on manifesting the fruit of stream-entry.

original: 'dir zan byin pa zhes bya ba ni btang ba las byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir zan byin pa zhes bya ba ni btang ba las byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the phrase having given a meal means that it was not given by one who is detached,

original: mngon par rtogs pa la zhugs pa nyid la de med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa la zhugs pa nyid la de med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because that person does not exist in the state of manifest realization.

original: / gtan gyi rkyen ris zhes bya ba ni kun dga'i ra ba dang / zhing dang / zong la sogs pa sbyin bdag gis yang dang yang du bsam mi dgos par gtan gyi 'tsho ba 'byor bar 'gyur ba'i yo byad dag go //
analyzed: / gtan gyi rkyen ris zhes bya ba ni kun dga'i ra ba dang / zhing dang / zong la sogs pa sbyin bdag gis yang dang yang du bsam mi dgos par gtan gyi 'tsho ba 'byor bar 'gyur ba'i yo byad dag go //
translated: The condition of a permanent endowment is the property that is given by the donor of a monastery, a field, merchandise, etc. , which is a means of livelihood that is permanent and inexhaustible.

original: mthun pa'i mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres pa'o ;
analyzed: mthun pa'i mchod sbyin zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa dang ma 'dres pa'o ;
translated: The sacrifice of the good is the sacrifice that is not mixed with evil, such as killing.

original: / mi rtag par rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ni gang dngos po rnams la lan 'ga' 'byung bar lta ba'o //
analyzed: / mi rtag par rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ni gang dngos po rnams la lan 'ga' 'byung bar lta ba'o //
translated: The view of impermanence is the view that things arise and perish.

original: zad par rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang dngos po 'byung ba rnams la zad par lta ba'o //
analyzed: zad par rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang dngos po 'byung ba rnams la zad par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of destruction is the view that things that have arisen will perish.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod chags spong bar lta ba'o //🔽'gog par @178a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod chags spong bar lta ba'o // 'gog par @178a * //
translated: The view of separation from attachment is the view that one should abandon attachment.

original: rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang dngos po zag pa dang bcas pa rnams spong bar lta ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang dngos po zag pa dang bcas pa rnams spong bar lta ba'o //
translated: The view of cessation is the view that one should abandon all things that are subject to impurity.

original: spong bar rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang dngos po zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa thams cad phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par lta ba'o //
analyzed: spong bar rjes su lta zhes bya ba ni gang dngos po zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa thams cad phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par lta ba'o //
translated: The phrase he views abandonment refers to the view that all contaminated and uncontaminated entities are abandoned in nirvana without remainder.

original: mdo 'di ni khyim bdag ngan pa bzang byin gzugs dang gzugs med pa khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni khyim bdag ngan pa bzang byin gzugs dang gzugs med pa khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: This sutra was taught in order to induce the householder Bhadra, who was attached to the form and formless realms, to take up the practice of the path.

original: me'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni sreg pa la sogs pa'i me'i las so //
analyzed: me'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni sreg pa la sogs pa'i me'i las so //
translated: The phrase the function of fire refers to the activity of fire, such as the burning of fuel.

original: rim pa gsum pa zhes bya ba ni cha gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa gsum pa zhes bya ba ni cha gsum pa'o //
translated: The phrase three stages means three parts.

original: ches 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni 'phang mtho ba'o ;
analyzed: ches 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni 'phang mtho ba'o ;
translated: The phrase the most exalted means the highest.

original: / ches gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni ches gsal ba'o //
analyzed: / ches gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni ches gsal ba'o //
translated: The phrase the most excellent means the most clear.

original: gtams pa bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni gtams pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gtams pa bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni gtams pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase the protection of the womb means the holding of the womb.

original: brgal zhing brtag pa zhes bya ba ni rigs par bda' ba'o //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa zhes bya ba ni rigs par bda' ba'o //
translated: The phrase the investigation of arguments means the investigation of reasonings.

original: rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pas so //
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pas so //
translated: The phrase not generated by reason means not generated by sexual intercourse.

original: nor mang ba zhes bya ba ni yul gyi longs spyod nye bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nor mang ba zhes bya ba ni yul gyi longs spyod nye bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Abundant wealth means the enjoyment of objects that are close at hand.

original: chos mngon pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid de chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos so //
analyzed: chos mngon pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid de chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos so //
translated: Abhidharma means the characteristics of things, the treatise on Abhidharma.

original: 'dul ba la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi'i mtshan nyid de 'dul ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi'i mtshan nyid de 'dul ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: Attachment to the Vinaya means the characteristics of the bases of training, the rituals of the Vinaya.

original: yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dul ba ste 'phags pa'i lam mo //🔽dus shes pa zhes bya ba ni dus dang dus ma yin pa'i bye brag la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dul ba ste 'phags pa'i lam mo // dus shes pa zhes bya ba ni dus dang dus ma yin pa'i bye brag la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the noble path that tames attachment and so on.🔽Knowledge of time means being skilled in the distinctions of timely and untimely.

original: dus rig pa zhes bya ba ni dus dang dus ma yin par rjes su bsgrub pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dus rig pa zhes bya ba ni dus dang dus ma yin par rjes su bsgrub pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the occasion means being skilled in accomplishing what is timely and untimely.

original: wa lam can zhes bya ba ni dur khrod do //
analyzed: wa lam can zhes bya ba ni dur khrod do //
translated: The charnel ground means a cemetery.

original: btsun mo'i 'khor la 'os pa'i gos so zhes bya ba ni srab mo lus snang ba chags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor la 'os pa'i gos so zhes bya ba ni srab mo lus snang ba chags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Clothing suitable for a harem means thin clothing that arouses attachment.

original: nam ma nangs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: nam ma nangs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mo ma zad pa'o //
translated: Before dawn means before night has ended.

original: nam ma nangs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir skya rengs ma shar zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nam ma nangs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir skya rengs ma shar zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to show that it was still night, he says, “before dawn.”

original: skya rengs dang po ma shar ba'o //
analyzed: skya rengs dang po ma shar ba'o //
translated: The first flush of dawn has not yet appeared.

original: rin po che dag ces bya ba ni sgron ma la sogs pa'i chos kyi nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: rin po che dag ces bya ba ni sgron ma la sogs pa'i chos kyi nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa dag go //
translated: “Jewels” are the jewels of Dharma such as lamps, and pearls, etc.

original: rin po cher smos pa dag go zhes bya ba ni ral gyi dang dung la sogs pa bsrung ba dag rtsed mo'i ched dag go //
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa dag go zhes bya ba ni ral gyi dang dung la sogs pa bsrung ba dag rtsed mo'i ched dag go //
translated: “The jewels mentioned” are swords, conches, etc., which are for protection and play.

original: ma bsdus par zhes bya ba ni ma brtul ba'o //
analyzed: ma bsdus par zhes bya ba ni ma brtul ba'o //
translated: “Without being gathered in” means without being put away.

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni dngos brtson pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni dngos brtson pa'o //
translated: “The king” is the one who is actually engaged.

original: sgo gtan zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i btsun mo'i 'khor gyi @178b sgo gcad pa'i shing ngo //
analyzed: sgo gtan zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i btsun mo'i 'khor gyi @178b sgo gcad pa'i shing ngo //
translated: “The bolt” is the wood that closes the door of the king’s harem.

original: sgo gtan gyi nye 'khor zhes bya ba ni gang na sgo gtan te med pa de na 'os pa'i nye 'khor gyi gnas so //
analyzed: sgo gtan gyi nye 'khor zhes bya ba ni gang na sgo gtan te med pa de na 'os pa'i nye 'khor gyi gnas so //
translated: “The vicinity of the bolt” is the place that is appropriate for the bolt, where there is no door.

original: 'da' bar byed ces bya ba ni lus kyis 'da' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'da' bar byed ces bya ba ni lus kyis 'da' bar byed pa'o //
translated: “To pass” means to pass by with the body.

original: btsun mo'i gan du song ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyad pa'o //
analyzed: btsun mo'i gan du song ba zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyad pa'o //
translated: Approaching the queen means to have sexual intercourse.

original: gsang tshig ces bya ba ni tshig gsang ba dag go//
analyzed: gsang tshig ces bya ba ni tshig gsang ba dag go//
translated: Secret words means secret expressions.

original: gsad par sems pa zhes bya ba ni gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsad par sems pa zhes bya ba ni gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: Thinking of killing means to kill.

original: mthon po zhes bya ba ni chen po'o //
analyzed: mthon po zhes bya ba ni chen po'o //
translated: High means great.

original: gnas dma' ba zhes bya ba ni go 'phang dma' ba'o //
analyzed: gnas dma' ba zhes bya ba ni go 'phang dma' ba'o //
translated: Low position means a low rank.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed pa'i phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: Going means going to battle.

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni g-yul las phyir ldog pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni g-yul las phyir ldog pa'o //
translated: Turning back means turning away from battle.

original: thob rgyal du bsgrags nas zhes bya ba ni gang gis gang blangs pa de mnangs su khyer cig ces bsgrags nas so //
analyzed: thob rgyal du bsgrags nas zhes bya ba ni gang gis gang blangs pa de mnangs su khyer cig ces bsgrags nas so //
translated: Having proclaimed victory means having proclaimed, Whoever takes what is taken should carry it away!

original: de'i 'og tu chad pa chen po rjes su ston par byed ces bya ba ni rdzas 'dor du 'jud pa'i phyir gsang ba la bsngags pa'i bsdigs mo byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chad pa chen po rjes su ston par byed ces bya ba ni rdzas 'dor du 'jud pa'i phyir gsang ba la bsngags pa'i bsdigs mo byed pa'o //
translated: Subsequently, he is sentenced to a great punishment means that he is threatened with a secret punishment in order to make him give up his property.

original: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas nyes dmigs lhag pa dag bstan pa'i phyir dge slong dag de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas nyes dmigs lhag pa dag bstan pa'i phyir dge slong dag de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the remaining faults by way of conclusion, he says, “Monks, thus…”

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: “Thus” should be understood as the summarized meaning.

original: glang po che'i gnod pa zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i phan phun te des gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glang po che'i gnod pa zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i phan phun te des gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Harm from elephants” is the benefit of elephants, because one is harmed by them.

original: rung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Inappropriate” is because it is the cause of attachment, anger, etc.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i lam nyid kyis mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i lam nyid kyis mi mthun pa'o //
translated: “Unseemly” is because it is incompatible with the path of a householder.

original: dge slong gi tshul dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi tshul dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi tshul dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi tshul dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: “Inconsistent with the way of a monk” is because it is contrary to the way of a monk.

original: da ni gdul ba'i dbang gis rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug pa la ji ltar tshul dang mthun par mi 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir yang dag par sdud par byed pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi de
analyzed: da ni gdul ba'i dbang gis rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug pa la ji ltar tshul dang mthun par mi 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir yang dag par sdud par byed pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi de
translated: Now, in order to show how it is fitting for the Buddha to enter the king’s palace in accordance with the needs of those to be trained, the text says:

original: ltar bca' ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: ltar bca' ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: “The Blessed One, the one who gathers things together, established the bases of training for the disciples in the Vinaya in this way.”

original: ma mthong ba'i grogs zhes bya ba ni ma mthong bar snying du sdug pa'o ;
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i grogs zhes bya ba ni ma mthong bar snying du sdug pa'o ;
translated: “A friend who is not seen” is one who is dear even though not seen.

original: / chu zheng zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / chu zheng zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Width and height”

original: chu zhes bya ba ni srid do //
analyzed: chu zhes bya ba ni srid do //
translated: “Width” is the length.

original: zheng zhes bya ba ni rgya'o //
analyzed: zheng zhes bya ba ni rgya'o //
translated: “Height” is the breadth.

original: rang gis mtshon 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid g-yul 'gyed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis mtshon 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid g-yul 'gyed pa'o //
translated: “One who strikes with his own hand” is one who fights himself.

original: nor bu'i khrab ces bya ba ni rin po che'i ya lad do //🔽dus tshigs su reg na bde ba zhes bya ba ni tsha ba'i dus su reg pa bsil la grang ba'i dus su @179a * //
analyzed: nor bu'i khrab ces bya ba ni rin po che'i ya lad do // dus tshigs su reg na bde ba zhes bya ba ni tsha ba'i dus su reg pa bsil la grang ba'i dus su @179a * //
translated: “A jeweled armor” is a precious coat of mail.

original: ni reg pa dro ba'o //
analyzed: ni reg pa dro ba'o //
translated: “Pleasant to the touch in all seasons” means that when touched in hot weather it is cool, and in cold weather it is warm.

original: gcad dka' ba zhes bya ba ni ral gri la sogs pas gcad dka' ba'o //
analyzed: gcad dka' ba zhes bya ba ni ral gri la sogs pas gcad dka' ba'o //
translated: Hard to cut means hard to cut with a sword and so on.

original: dbug dka' ba zhes bya ba ni mda' la sogs pas dbug dka' ba'o //
analyzed: dbug dka' ba zhes bya ba ni mda' la sogs pas dbug dka' ba'o //
translated: Hard to pierce means hard to pierce with an arrow and so on.

original: dug 'jil ba zhes bya ba ni dug gsod pa'o //
analyzed: dug 'jil ba zhes bya ba ni dug gsod pa'o //
translated: Dispelling poison means killing poison.

original: snang ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Having the nature of light means being luminous.

original: rin thang med pa zhes bya ba ni rin thang grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: rin thang med pa zhes bya ba ni rin thang grangs med pa'o //
translated: Having no price means having a price beyond number.

original: lta bas chog mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi blo dag gi lta bas ngoms mi shes pa ste yul des skyo nas gzhan la rtog par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lta bas chog mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi blo dag gi lta bas ngoms mi shes pa ste yul des skyo nas gzhan la rtog par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Insatiable to behold means the eye consciousness is never satisfied with seeing it, and the meaning is that it does not seek other objects because it is tired of that object.

original: byas zin nas zhes bya ba la /🔽byas zhes bya ba ni yan lag dang nying lag gtong ba'o //
analyzed: byas zin nas zhes bya ba la / byas zhes bya ba ni yan lag dang nying lag gtong ba'o //
translated: Having done means🔽having given up limbs and minor appendages.

original: zin nas zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang / spu ris dang / bcad pa la sogs pa byi dor zin pa'o //
analyzed: zin nas zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang / spu ris dang / bcad pa la sogs pa byi dor zin pa'o //
translated: Having finished means having finished the work of polishing, coloring, cutting and so on.

original: khas len pa zhes bya ba ni skyabs su khas len pa'o //
analyzed: khas len pa zhes bya ba ni skyabs su khas len pa'o //
translated: Accepting means accepting refuge.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: The basis of training is the basis of practice.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun par rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun par rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas skye ba'o //
translated: Arising is the arising of dependent origination in accordance with the world.

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi ldog pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas 'khor ba las thar pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi ldog pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas 'khor ba las thar pa'o //
translated: Cessation is liberation from cyclic existence through the cessation of dependent origination in accordance with the world.

original: mngon par spro bar bya zhes bya ba ni bskul bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par spro bar bya zhes bya ba ni bskul bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should be diligent means one should be encouraged.

original: gtsug lag khang lnga brgya zhes bya ba ni gnas khang lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang lnga brgya zhes bya ba ni gnas khang lnga brgya'o //
translated: Five hundred monasteries means five hundred dwelling places.

original: chud za ba'i mtshan zhes bya ba ni 'chi ltas so //
analyzed: chud za ba'i mtshan zhes bya ba ni 'chi ltas so //
translated: The sign of wasting away means the sign of death.

original: bsnyen bkur ni bgyis lags na zhes bya ba ni mgu ba byas zin pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur ni bgyis lags na zhes bya ba ni mgu ba byas zin pa'o //
translated: Having served means having pleased.

original: brtul ces bya ba ni phan tshun byas pa'o //
analyzed: brtul ces bya ba ni phan tshun byas pa'o //
translated: Having practiced means having mutually practiced.

original: khyim gyi nang na gnas zhes bya ba ni btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: khyim gyi nang na gnas zhes bya ba ni btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na gnas pa'o //
translated: Dwelling in the inner quarters means dwelling in the retinue of queens.

original: dge slong au dra ya na la tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dge slong au dra ya na la tshigs su bcad pa 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: To the bhiksu Udayana, he spoke this verse, and so on.

original: mi dbang zhes bya ba ni kye rgyal po zhes bod pa'i tshig go ;
analyzed: mi dbang zhes bya ba ni kye rgyal po zhes bod pa'i tshig go ;
translated: The phrase O lord of men is a vocative term meaning O king.

original: / bor ba'i bsod snyoms tshol ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su btang ba'i zas tshol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: / bor ba'i bsod snyoms tshol ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su btang ba'i zas tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase seeking alms that are discarded means seeking food that is given away.

original: ji ltar yongs su mi gdung ba zhes bya ba ni ji mya ngan mi byed dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mi gdung ba zhes bya ba ni ji mya ngan mi byed dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase how can one be without distress? means how can one not grieve?

original: srang tshad brgya pa zhes bya ba ni srang tshad brgya'i tshad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: srang tshad brgya pa zhes bya ba ni srang tshad brgya'i tshad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase weighing a hundred ounces means having the measure of a hundred ounces.

original: shas brlan pa zhes bya ba ni sha khus spangs pa'o//
analyzed: shas brlan pa zhes bya ba ni sha khus spangs pa'o//
translated: The phrase moistened with fat means anointed with meat broth.

original: rlung med ces bya ba ni bde zhing dro ba'o //
analyzed: rlung med ces bya ba ni bde zhing dro ba'o //
translated: The phrase without wind means comfortable and warm.

original: sgo gtan bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni sgo bcad pa'o //
analyzed: sgo gtan bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni sgo bcad pa'o //
translated: The phrase with the door bolted means with the door closed.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mnyam pa'o //
translated: The phrase equal means of the same caste.

original: yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni snying du sdug pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni snying du sdug pa'o //
translated: The phrase pleasing means dear to the heart.

original: gus par nyan zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba bzhin byed pa'o //
analyzed: gus par nyan zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba bzhin byed pa'o //
translated: Listening respectfully means doing what is commanded.

original: snyan smra ba zhes bya ba ni snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: snyan smra ba zhes bya ba ni snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: Pleasant speech means speaking pleasantly.

original: nor mang ldan pa'i @179b mdzod ces bya ba ni nor mang pos gang ba'i mdzod do //
analyzed: nor mang ldan pa'i @179b mdzod ces bya ba ni nor mang pos gang ba'i mdzod do //
translated: A treasury filled with much wealth means a treasury filled with much wealth.

original: ci yang med pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas ci yang med pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas ci yang med pa'o //
translated: Nothing at all means no substance at all.

original: au dra ya nas smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyal po zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: au dra ya nas smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyal po zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: Udraka said, King, and so on. The word 'king' is a Tibetan word.

original: gal te gdul dka' ba gzhan gyi zas kyis 'tsho byed na /
analyzed: gal te gdul dka' ba gzhan gyi zas kyis 'tsho byed na /
translated: If the untamed one lives on the food of others,

original: ma grub bas ni de 'dul te //
analyzed: ma grub bas ni de 'dul te //
translated: the unaccomplished one tames him,

original: gnya' shing ba lang 'dul ba bzhin //
analyzed: gnya' shing ba lang 'dul ba bzhin //
translated: like a yoke-bearing ox tamer.

original: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gdul ba dka' ba'i sems legs par ma dul ba chog mi shes par gyur na de'i phyir de rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skyes bu gdul ba dka' ba'i sems legs par ma dul ba chog mi shes par gyur na de'i phyir de rab tu byung ste /
translated: This means that when the mind of a difficult to tame person is not well tamed and becomes insatiable, then for that reason he goes forth

original: gzhan gyis byin pa'i zas kyis 'tsho bar byed na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byin pa'i zas kyis 'tsho bar byed na /
translated: and lives on food given by others.

original: gang gi tshe gzhan gyi zas de ma grub cing ma thob pas de'i sems gdul dka' ba chog shes pa la 'jog cing 'dul bar byed de /🔽dper na ba lang gdul dka' ba gnya' shing gis mnan pas legs par 'dul ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan gyi zas de ma grub cing ma thob pas de'i sems gdul dka' ba chog shes pa la 'jog cing 'dul bar byed de / dper na ba lang gdul dka' ba gnya' shing gis mnan pas legs par 'dul ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When he has not obtained the food of others, he is difficult to tame, but he is placed in and tamed by contentment.🔽For example, it is like a difficult-to-tame ox who is well tamed by being suppressed with a yoke. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: dman pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dbul po bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dman pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dbul po bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Like a poor person means like a pauper.
