original: yid kyis gang dang gang 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis ci dang ci 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis gang dang gang 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis ci dang ci 'dod pa'o //
translated: Whatever is desired by the mind means whatever is desired by the mind.

original: au dra ya nas smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: au dra ya nas smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Udraka said, etc.

original: rgyal po gang zhig 'jig rten na //
analyzed: rgyal po gang zhig 'jig rten na //
translated: A king who in the world

original: lus kyis chos reg bkren pa min //
analyzed: lus kyis chos reg bkren pa min //
translated: touches the Dharma with his body is not a pauper.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gang zhig lus kyis tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos la reg 'dzin pa de ni bkren pa dbul ba ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gang zhig lus kyis tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos la reg 'dzin pa de ni bkren pa dbul ba ma yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that a king who touches and grasps the Dharma of morality, etc. with his body should be known as not a pauper, not a poor person. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / de ni nges par lha nyid dang // yang na mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar / de ni nges par lha nyid dang // yang na mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: or he attains nirvana.

original: gang gi phyir de ni nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang bcas pa nyid du rnam par bzhag na yang lha nyid du mtho ris su gnas par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa lhag ma med par rnam par bzhag na ni mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang bcas pa nyid du rnam par bzhag na yang lha nyid du mtho ris su gnas par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa lhag ma med par rnam par bzhag na ni mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even though he is posited as having remaining afflictions, he still becomes a god and dwells in the heavens, and when he is posited as having no remaining afflictions, he attains nirvana.

original: mi dbang gang zhig chos spong zhing //
analyzed: mi dbang gang zhig chos spong zhing //
translated: The king who abandons the Dharma

original: 'di la chos min dga' ba byed pa //
analyzed: 'di la chos min dga' ba byed pa //
translated: and delights in non-Dharma here

original: rgyal po bkren shes par bya //
analyzed: rgyal po bkren shes par bya //
translated: should be known as a poor king,

original: mun nas mun par 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mun nas mun par 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: going from darkness to darkness.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi'i dbang po rgyal po gang zhig tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos spong zhing dran nas tshe 'di la chos ma yin pa sdig pa la dga' bar byed pa'i rgyal po de ni dbang phyug yod kyang bkren par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi'i dbang po rgyal po gang zhig tshul khrims la sogs pa'i chos spong zhing dran nas tshe 'di la chos ma yin pa sdig pa la dga' bar byed pa'i rgyal po de ni dbang phyug yod kyang bkren par shes par bya ste /
translated: The king who is a lord of men, who abandons the Dharma of morality and so on, and who delights in non-Dharma, in sin, in this life, should be known as a poor king, even though he has power.

original: 'di ltar mun pa nas mun par 'gro bar 'gyur te sdug bsngal nas sdug bsngal chen po 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @180a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar mun pa nas mun par 'gro bar 'gyur te sdug bsngal nas sdug bsngal chen po 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @180a * //
translated: Thus, they will go from darkness into darkness, from suffering into greater suffering.

original: go ; / gang 'dod par zhes bya ba ni gang dag 'bar ro //
analyzed: go ; / gang 'dod par zhes bya ba ni gang dag 'bar ro //
translated: Those who are burning with desire🔽are the ten in the tenth.

original: bcu pa'i bcu po 'di zhes bya ba ni lo bcu pa'i tshad kyi gnas skabs bcu po 'di lta ste byis pa'i gnas skabs dang / gzhon nu'i gnas skabs dang lang tsho'i gnas skabs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa'i bcu po 'di zhes bya ba ni lo bcu pa'i tshad kyi gnas skabs bcu po 'di lta ste byis pa'i gnas skabs dang / gzhon nu'i gnas skabs dang lang tsho'i gnas skabs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who are burning with desire are the ten in the tenth. The ten in the tenth are the ten stages of life, beginning with the stage of childhood and ending with old age.

original: rtsed mo zhes bya ba ni dga' dgur spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsed mo zhes bya ba ni dga' dgur spyod pa'o //
translated: Play is the enjoyment of pleasure.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'o //🔽bu yis dga' bston byed de //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'o // bu yis dga' bston byed de //
translated: Joy is mental satisfaction.

original: zhes bya ba ni bu ni pha dga' ba'i rgyu yin pa'o //🔽chung mas khengs pa rjod par byed //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bu ni pha dga' ba'i rgyu yin pa'o // chung mas khengs pa rjod par byed //
translated: The son is the cause of the father's joy.

original: ces bya ba ni yang chung ma ni khyo nga rgyal skyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yang chung ma ni khyo nga rgyal skyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'o //
translated: The wife is the cause of the husband's pride.

original: mthar byed pa las zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba las so //
analyzed: mthar byed pa las zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba las so //
translated: From the end of life, that is, from death,

original: rig sngags kun zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags rnams so //
analyzed: rig sngags kun zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags rnams so //
translated: All mantras means the secret mantras.

original: dpung dag ces bya ba ni dmag dag go //
analyzed: dpung dag ces bya ba ni dmag dag go //
translated: Armies means the troops.

original: dpa' brtul zhes bya ba ni rang gis pha rol gnon pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' brtul zhes bya ba ni rang gis pha rol gnon pa'o //
translated: Heroic means one who is self-confident.

original: skyob nus min zhes bya ba ni srung bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: skyob nus min zhes bya ba ni srung bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: Unable to protect means unable to guard.

original: khyab 'jug gi bu dang / mun byad kyi bu dang / sgra ngan gyi bu dang / skya bseng gi bu dang zhes bya ba dag gi ni mi rigs kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: khyab 'jug gi bu dang / mun byad kyi bu dang / sgra ngan gyi bu dang / skya bseng gi bu dang zhes bya ba dag gi ni mi rigs kyi bye brag go //
translated: The sons of Vishnu, the sons of Rahu, the sons of Ravana, and the sons of Paka are the different human races.

original: des kyang 'chi ba bzlog ma nus //
analyzed: des kyang 'chi ba bzlog ma nus //
translated: Even they were unable to avert death.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po de dag gis kyang 'chi ba mi 'ong bar bzlog par ma nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po de dag gis kyang 'chi ba mi 'ong bar bzlog par ma nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that even those kings were unable to avert the coming of death.

original: sdom brtson zhes bya ba ni sems kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: sdom brtson zhes bya ba ni sems kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Diligence is the determination of the mind.

original: dka' thub ces bya ba ni lus kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: dka' thub ces bya ba ni lus kyi nges pa'o //
translated: Austerity is the determination of the body.

original: las zhes bya ba ni skye bo mgu bar bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni skye bo mgu bar bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Action means pleasing people and so on.

original: brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni spro ba'o //
translated: Exertion means enthusiasm.

original: brtul ba zhes bya ba ni 'gyed ba'o //
analyzed: brtul ba zhes bya ba ni 'gyed ba'o //
translated: “To be scattered” means to be dispersed.

original: 'khor tshogs zhes bya ba ni g-yog 'khor gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: 'khor tshogs zhes bya ba ni g-yog 'khor gyi tshogs so //
translated: “A multitude of followers” means a multitude of attendants.

original: rgya chen nor dag gis zhes bya ba ni nor rgya chen po dag gis so //
analyzed: rgya chen nor dag gis zhes bya ba ni nor rgya chen po dag gis so //
translated: “With great wealth” means with great riches.

original: mi tshugs zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mi non pa'o //
analyzed: mi tshugs zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mi non pa'o //
translated: “Unassailable” means unvanquishable.

original: thi ba'i mdog 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni bsregs pa'o //
analyzed: thi ba'i mdog 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni bsregs pa'o //
translated: “The color of a pigeon” means burned.

original: bor zhing zhes bya ba ni spangs shing ngo //
analyzed: bor zhing zhes bya ba ni spangs shing ngo //
translated: “Cast off” means abandoned.

original: phyogs phyogs rnam 'thor ba zhes bya ba ni lhu tshigs dag bral zhing yul tha dad par rnam par 'thor ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs phyogs rnam 'thor ba zhes bya ba ni lhu tshigs dag bral zhing yul tha dad par rnam par 'thor ba'o //
translated: “Scattered in all directions” means separated at the joints and scattered in different places.

original: dung gi mdog 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: dung gi mdog 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dkar po'o //
translated: “The color of a conch” means white.

original: bor zhing zhes bya ba ni btang zhing ngo //
analyzed: bor zhing zhes bya ba ni btang zhing ngo //
translated: “Cast off” means given up.

original: ku ba ltung ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni ku ba ltung ba lta bur sal 'dug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ku ba ltung ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni ku ba ltung ba lta bur sal 'dug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Like a fallen gourd” means like a fallen gourd, that is, lying there.

original: tshan sgrib par byed cing zhes bya ba ni nyi ma byung na gdugs la sogs pas sgrib par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshan sgrib par byed cing zhes bya ba ni nyi ma byung na gdugs la sogs pas sgrib par byed pa'o //
translated: “It conceals” means that it conceals like an umbrella when the sun comes out.

original: grang na g-yogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lhags pa byung na gos kyis dro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: grang na g-yogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lhags pa byung na gos kyis dro bar byed pa'o //
translated: “It covers” means that it covers like a garment when the wind blows.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lus so //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lus so //
translated: “One’s own” refers to the body.

original: mi 'os ji tsam zas @180b zos shing //
analyzed: mi 'os ji tsam zas @180b zos shing //
translated: “Whatever food and drink one consumes,

original: gyon nam yang na byin pa de //
analyzed: gyon nam yang na byin pa de //
translated: or clothing one wears or gives to others,

original: de yi rang gir shes bya ste //
analyzed: de yi rang gir shes bya ste //
translated: one should know that it is one’s own.

original: gzhan ni bor te 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni bor te 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: Abandoning the rest, one goes forth.”

original: zhes bya ba ni mi gos dang zas dang gos kyi bdag pos bdag nyid kyis zas ji tsam zos shing gos ji tsam gyon pa dang / gzhan la byin pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rang gir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi gos dang zas dang gos kyi bdag pos bdag nyid kyis zas ji tsam zos shing gos ji tsam gyon pa dang / gzhan la byin pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rang gir shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that whatever food one consumes, whatever clothing one wears, and whatever one gives to others, that is one’s own.

original: lhag pa gzhan gyi 'dir por te bdag nyid 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhag pa gzhan gyi 'dir por te bdag nyid 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Abandoning the rest, one goes forth to the other world. This is the meaning.

original: da ni blang bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: da ni blang bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Now, in order to teach what should be adopted, he says:

original: mi 'os rkun pos mi 'phrogs dang // gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: mi 'os rkun pos mi 'phrogs dang // gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i //
translated: The treasure of merit cannot be stolen by thieves, nor is it shared with others.

original: gter ni sbyin pa'am yang na ni //
analyzed: gter ni sbyin pa'am yang na ni //
translated: It is to be hidden by giving,

original: legs byas gzhan gyis sba bar bya //
analyzed: legs byas gzhan gyis sba bar bya //
translated: or else by the good deeds of others.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: mi 'os pa bsod nams kyi gter chom rkun pas mi 'drogs pa dang / bu lon pa gzhan dang thun mong ma yin par sbyin pas sba bar bya ba'am yang na tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i legs par byas pa gzhan gyis sba bar bya ste /
analyzed: mi 'os pa bsod nams kyi gter chom rkun pas mi 'drogs pa dang / bu lon pa gzhan dang thun mong ma yin par sbyin pas sba bar bya ba'am yang na tshul khrims dang bsgom pa'i legs par byas pa gzhan gyis sba bar bya ste /
translated: The treasure of merit cannot be stolen by thieves, who are unworthy of it, and it is not shared with others, who are debtors. It is to be hidden by giving, or else by the good deeds of others, such as morality and meditation.

original: bdag nyid kyi rgyud la yod par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rgyud la yod par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is to be made one’s own possession.

original: stag gis ri dags bsad 'dren ltar //
analyzed: stag gis ri dags bsad 'dren ltar //
translated: Like a tiger dragging its kill,

original: na rga 'chi bas khyod myur 'dren //
analyzed: na rga 'chi bas khyod myur 'dren //
translated: old age, sickness, and death drag you along.

original: mdza' bshes blon tshogs kun 'dus pas //
analyzed: mdza' bshes blon tshogs kun 'dus pas //
translated: Even if all your friends and ministers gather together,

original: khyod kyi nad ni sel mi nus //
analyzed: khyod kyi nad ni sel mi nus //
translated: they cannot cure your illness.

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na stag gis ri dags pas de rang gi gnas su 'dren par byed pa ltar khyod kyang na ba dang / rgas pa dang / 'chi bas myur du bar chad med par 'jig rten pha rol du 'dren par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na stag gis ri dags pas de rang gi gnas su 'dren par byed pa ltar khyod kyang na ba dang / rgas pa dang / 'chi bas myur du bar chad med par 'jig rten pha rol du 'dren par byed de /
translated: Just as a tiger quickly and without obstruction leads a deer to its own abode, so too you are quickly and without obstruction led to the next world by sickness, aging, and death.

original: de la khyod kyi nad ni mdza' bshes dang blon po'i tshogs kun 'dus pas kyang sel bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la khyod kyi nad ni mdza' bshes dang blon po'i tshogs kun 'dus pas kyang sel bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, your sickness cannot be removed even by the combined efforts of your friends, relatives, and retinue.

original: bu la sogs pa nor lhur len bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bu la sogs pa nor lhur len bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that sons and so forth are the main wealth,🔽he says:🔽Whatever wealth, grain, gold, and silver there is,🔽and sons, wives, and retinue,

original: de la bcad lhag nor 'bru dang / gser dngul gang dag yod pa dang / bu dang chung ma 'khor bcas dag / bgo skal nyid du sems par byed //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la bcad lhag nor 'bru dang / gser dngul gang dag yod pa dang / bu dang chung ma 'khor bcas dag / bgo skal nyid du sems par byed //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: think of them as your own share.

original: shi ba de la spyad pa'i lhag ma nor dang / 'bru dang / gser dngul la sogs pa gang dag phyin yod pa la bu dang / chung ma grogs kyi 'khor dang bcas pa dag rigs rgyud kyis 'thob pa'i nor gyi bgo skal nyid yin pas sems par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shi ba de la spyad pa'i lhag ma nor dang / 'bru dang / gser dngul la sogs pa gang dag phyin yod pa la bu dang / chung ma grogs kyi 'khor dang bcas pa dag rigs rgyud kyis 'thob pa'i nor gyi bgo skal nyid yin pas sems par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he thinks, “Whatever wealth remains to the deceased, such as money, grain, gold, silver, and so on, is the inheritance of the children, wife, and circle of friends by right of their family line.”

original: gal te pha shi bu lon chags //
analyzed: gal te pha shi bu lon chags //
translated: If the father dies and there is a debt,

original: bu sdug de la me mi khyer //
analyzed: bu sdug de la me mi khyer //
translated: the beloved son does not carry the fire.

original: shi na'ang mi 'chi mi du zhing //
analyzed: shi na'ang mi 'chi mi du zhing //
translated: Even if he dies, he does not die; he does not cry,

original: bdag gi pha'am rjer mi smra //
analyzed: bdag gi pha'am rjer mi smra //
translated: “My father is dead!” or “My lord is dead!”

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha shi ba ni de la gzhan gyi bu lon chags pa yod @181a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha shi ba ni de la gzhan gyi bu lon chags pa yod @181a * //
translated: If the father dies and there is a debt to others,

original: na bu sdug pa yang bdag la gzhan gyi pha'i bu lon chags pa bdas kyi dogs pas /
analyzed: na bu sdug pa yang bdag la gzhan gyi pha'i bu lon chags pa bdas kyi dogs pas /
translated: the beloved son, fearing that he himself will be seized for the debt of his father,

original: pha shi ba de la ro bsreg pa'i me mdun du khyer la /
analyzed: pha shi ba de la ro bsreg pa'i me mdun du khyer la /
translated: does not carry the fire of the funeral pyre in front of the dead father.

original: pha shi na yang mchi ma'i bzhin gyis mi ngu zhing /
analyzed: pha shi na yang mchi ma'i bzhin gyis mi ngu zhing /
translated: Even if the father dies, he does not cry with a tearful face,🔽“My father is dead!” or “My lord is dead!”

original: shi ba 'di bdag gi pha'am rje bo yin no zhes kyang mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shi ba 'di bdag gi pha'am rje bo yin no zhes kyang mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not say that the dead person is his father or his master.

original: phyug shes bdag gi pha zer zhing //
analyzed: phyug shes bdag gi pha zer zhing //
translated: He says, “My father is rich,”

original: skra bshig mchi ma'i bzhin gyis du //
analyzed: skra bshig mchi ma'i bzhin gyis du //
translated: and with a tearful face, he weeps.

original: me yang mdun du khyer byed cing //
analyzed: me yang mdun du khyer byed cing //
translated: He carries the fire in front of him

original: kye ma 'di ni lhar 'gyur zer //
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni lhar 'gyur zer //
translated: and says, “Alas, he will become a god!”

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha shi ba de phyug po yin par shes zhes bya ba ni bu nor 'dod pas bdag gi pha yin no zhes zer zhing shi na skra bshig cing mchi ma'i bzhin gyis du la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te pha shi ba de phyug po yin par shes zhes bya ba ni bu nor 'dod pas bdag gi pha yin no zhes zer zhing shi na skra bshig cing mchi ma'i bzhin gyis du la /
translated: If the dead father is known to be rich, the son, desiring wealth, says, “He is my father.” When he dies, he weeps with a tearful face, his hair disheveled.

original: ro bsreg pa'i phyir me yang mdun du khyer bar byed cing kye ma pha 'di lhar skye bar gyur cig ces zer ba'o //
analyzed: ro bsreg pa'i phyir me yang mdun du khyer bar byed cing kye ma pha 'di lhar skye bar gyur cig ces zer ba'o //
translated: For the sake of the funeral pyre, he carries the fire in front of him and says, “Alas, may this father be reborn as a god!”

original: me btang zhes bya ba ni me spar nas so //
analyzed: me btang zhes bya ba ni me spar nas so //
translated: “Having set the fire” means having lit the fire.

original: de gcig skye zhing skye tshe gcig / de bzhin gcig 'chi 'chi tshe gcig / ces bya ba ni sems can de ni gcig tu skye zhing skye ba'i tshe na yang gcig pu yin /
analyzed: de gcig skye zhing skye tshe gcig / de bzhin gcig 'chi 'chi tshe gcig / ces bya ba ni sems can de ni gcig tu skye zhing skye ba'i tshe na yang gcig pu yin /
translated: This means that when a sentient being is born, it is born alone,

original: gcig pu 'chi zhing 'chi ba'i tshe na yang gcig pu yin te grogs gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig pu 'chi zhing 'chi ba'i tshe na yang gcig pu yin te grogs gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and when it dies, it dies alone, without any companion.

original: 'dir skye 'dir zhes bya ba ni skye ba pos 'khor ba 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'dir skye 'dir zhes bya ba ni skye ba pos 'khor ba 'dir ro //
translated: Here, “in this birth” means in this cyclic existence.

original: de mthong zhes bya ba ni na ba dang / rgas pa dang / 'chi ba dang bral ba la sogs pa mthong nas so //
analyzed: de mthong zhes bya ba ni na ba dang / rgas pa dang / 'chi ba dang bral ba la sogs pa mthong nas so //
translated: “One sees” means one sees the absence of sickness, old age, death, etc.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la'o //
translated: “In this world” means in this life.

original: dam pa rnams la rab 'byung zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa rnams rab tu 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa rnams la rab 'byung zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa rnams rab tu 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “The highest ones go forth” means the highest persons go forth.

original: khyim na 'dug mi byed ces bya ba ni khyim na gnas par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyim na 'dug mi byed ces bya ba ni khyim na gnas par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “One does not stay at home” means one does not remain in the home.

original: rab tu 'byung ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the result of going forth, it is said:

original: de dag chags pa kun bral nas //
analyzed: de dag chags pa kun bral nas //
translated: Having become completely free from attachment,

original: phyin chad mngal gnas 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: phyin chad mngal gnas 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: they will not enter a womb again.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: skyes bu dam pa de dag sred pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral zhing spangs nas phyin chad mngal gyi gnas su mi skye zhing 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa de dag sred pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral zhing spangs nas phyin chad mngal gyi gnas su mi skye zhing 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those holy beings, having become free from and abandoned all faults such as craving, will not enter a womb again. This is the meaning.

original: bar chad ma mchis pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pas so //
analyzed: bar chad ma mchis pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad pas so //
translated: By the application of uninterruptedness means by the uninterruptedness.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpyid la sogs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpyid la sogs pa'i dus so //
translated: In accordance with the time means in the time of spring, etc.

original: sred pa phyogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'phel ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa phyogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'phel ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Having the tendency of craving means having the nature of increase.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i shes rab kyi stobs so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i shes rab kyi stobs so //
translated: The power of discernment means the power of wholesome wisdom.

original: rdo gcig gis zhes bya ba ni gcig gi khar ro //
analyzed: rdo gcig gis zhes bya ba ni gcig gi khar ro //
translated: With one stone means on one stone.

original: 'gyes rnga zhes bya ba ni 'gyes pa'i rnga bo che'o //
analyzed: 'gyes rnga zhes bya ba ni 'gyes pa'i rnga bo che'o //
translated: A drum means a large drum.

original: phan tshun @181b zhes bya ba ni 'khrug long ngo //
analyzed: phan tshun @181b zhes bya ba ni 'khrug long ngo //
translated: “Mutual” means quarreling.

original: khyim dad par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyim dag 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: khyim dad par byed pa zhes bya ba ni khyim dag 'dul ba'o //
translated: “To make the household faithful” means to discipline the household.

original: rab tu byung ba ni gzhan la phan pas rjes su 'dzin pa zhugs pa yin pas zhes bya ba rab tu byung ba ni gzhan dag la phan pas yun ring por bde bas rjes su 'dzin cing phan 'dogs par byed pa de zhugs pa yin na zhes bya
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni gzhan la phan pas rjes su 'dzin pa zhugs pa yin pas zhes bya ba rab tu byung ba ni gzhan dag la phan pas yun ring por bde bas rjes su 'dzin cing phan 'dogs par byed pa de zhugs pa yin na zhes bya
translated: “The one who has entered to care for others through benefiting them” means that the one who has gone forth has entered to care for and benefit others for a long time through benefiting them.

original: ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that this is what it means.

original: gnyis ka nas btul zhing zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i sgo dang bud med kyi sgo gnyi ga nas bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka nas btul zhing zhes bya ba ni skyes pa'i sgo dang bud med kyi sgo gnyi ga nas bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: “Having disciplined both” means having accomplished both the male and female doors.

original: bzhag go zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la nges par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bzhag go zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag la nges par byas pa'o //
translated: “To be placed” means to be made certain about the four noble truths.

original: khyim mi dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi mi dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: khyim mi dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi mi dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “Together with the household” means together with the members of the household.

analyzed: bzhin gyur cing zhes bya ba ni bzhin gyi dbyibs gyur cing ngo //

original: ces bya ba la /

analyzed: mi mchog ces bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //

analyzed: khyod kyi yul dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi bya ba'i las kyi cha yin pas las so //

analyzed: 'phags dngos mngon rtags gang lags shes // zhes bya ba ni ste /

analyzed: skyes bu dam pa nyid yin par nye bar mtshon bar byed pa'i las gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: de khyod kyis mdzad ces bya ba ni chos kyi rgyal srid byed du bcug pa dang / chos kyi don du rab tu byung ba la sogs pa byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase you have done that means that you have established the rule of Dharma and engaged in activities such as going forth for the sake of the Dharma.

original: zhi ba de yi tshul mthun gang lags pa //
analyzed: zhi ba de yi tshul mthun gang lags pa //
translated: What is in accordance with that peaceful way,

analyzed: de ni de ring nye bar gzigs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: that will be seen today.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: The term peaceful is a Tibetan word.

translated: What is proper for him? means: What is the sign of his being a non-noble person, such as making him rule the kingdom by unrighteous means, and killing his father?

original: de ni de ring khyod kyis gzigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni de ring khyod kyis gzigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means: Today you will see that.

analyzed: sras ni khyed gson par mi dga' ste zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi sras gtsug phud can ni khyod gson bar mi dga'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Your son does not like you to live means: Your son Śikhī does not like you to live.

original: bdag cag byur ran ces bya ba ni bsod nams chung ba ste ;
analyzed: bdag cag byur ran ces bya ba ni bsod nams chung ba ste ;
translated: We are unlucky means: We are of little merit.

analyzed: mi dga' bzhin du dbang med par khyod gsod pa'i gshed mar bskos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means: We are appointed as your executioners, powerless and unwilling.

original: rgyal pos bskos rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gtsug phud can gyis mngags pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rgyal pos bskos rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gtsug phud can gyis mngags pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By those appointed by the king means: by those sent by King Śikhī.

original: mang du thos pa mdo sde dang mngon pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mang du thos pa mdo sde dang mngon pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Learned means skilled in the treatises of the sutras, the Abhidharma, and so forth.

original: mdud pa zhes bya ba ni brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang // 'di bden snyam du zhen mchog tu 'dzin pa dbus kyi mdud pa dag go //
analyzed: mdud pa zhes bya ba ni brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang // 'di bden snyam du zhen mchog tu 'dzin pa dbus kyi mdud pa dag go //
translated: The knots are the four knots: covetousness, malice, holding a discipline and ritual as paramount, and holding one's own view as paramount.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba dag go //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba dag go //
translated: The fetters are the four fetters: desire, existence, views, and ignorance.

original: @183a * // zug rngu zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan dang / 'dod pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dag go //
analyzed: @183a * // zug rngu zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan dang / 'dod pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dag go //
translated: The thorns are the afflictions: the five sense objects, attachment to desire, etc.

original: sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa dag go //
analyzed: sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa dag go //
translated: The coverings are the seven coverings: desire, malice, sleep, excitation, doubt, jealousy, and miserliness.

original: rgyal po'i chos zhes bya ba ni gya gyu can las tsher ma lta bur dbyung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i chos zhes bya ba ni gya gyu can las tsher ma lta bur dbyung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The so-called “dharma of the king” is taught to be like a thorn that should be extracted from the crooked.

original: mtshams med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshams med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regarding “immediate” (ānantarya),

original: mtshams zhes bya ba ni bar du chod pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams zhes bya ba ni bar du chod pa'o //
translated: “immediate” (antara) means interrupted.

original: de med par 'gro ba dang / mtshams med pa la sogs pa gang gis bar chad med pa kho nar sems can dmyal bar nges par 'gro ba'i las de ni mtshams med pa zhe bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med par 'gro ba dang / mtshams med pa la sogs pa gang gis bar chad med pa kho nar sems can dmyal bar nges par 'gro ba'i las de ni mtshams med pa zhe bya ba'o //
translated: That which goes without interruption, and by which one definitely goes to hell without interruption, that action is called “immediate” (ānantarya).

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni srog chags gcig bsad pa la las kyis dngos gzhi gnyis mi srid pas 'dir mtshams med pa gcig la ming gnyis su btags pa ste 'gyod pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /

translated: “Two” means that since it is impossible to have two actual bases of action for killing a single living being, here two names are given for one immediate [action], in order to generate regret.

original: ming gnyis su brjod do //
analyzed: ming gnyis su brjod do //
translated: The two names are stated.

original: sdig pa sdig pa las shogs shig ces bya ba ni nyes pa nyes pa nyid du smad pa'i phyir bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa sdig pa las shogs shig ces bya ba ni nyes pa nyes pa nyid du smad pa'i phyir bshags par bya'o //
translated: “Confess the evil, evil!” means that one should confess by reproaching the fault as a fault.

original: bslab pa nyid ces bya ba ni de'i grogs kyi las sbyor ba'i dus na skye ba nges par myong bar 'gyur ba rnams rnam par ma nan pa'o //🔽yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i tshe na skye ba rnams rnam par mnan pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa nyid ces bya ba ni de'i grogs kyi las sbyor ba'i dus na skye ba nges par myong bar 'gyur ba rnams rnam par ma nan pa'o // yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i tshe na skye ba rnams rnam par mnan pa'o //
translated: The “training” is the action that is the companion of that, which is the definite experience of birth at the time of preparation.🔽“Complete exhaustion” is the experience of birth at the time of the actual basis.

original: yongs su mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni mjug gi tshe na skye ba rnams rnam par mnan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni mjug gi tshe na skye ba rnams rnam par mnan pa'o //
translated: “Complete conclusion” is the experience of birth at the time of the conclusion.

original: shes pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mdzangs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni mdzangs pa'o //
translated: “Skill in knowledge” is wisdom.

original: skye bo'i bka' mchid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: skye bo'i bka' mchid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i gtam mo //
translated: “Conversation of people” is worldly talk.

original: re zhig nyi ma dang po la rlung mo che byung nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grong khyer byi dor bya ba ni me tog dang gos la sogs pa'i char 'bab pa ni skye bo'i tshogs de'i longs spyod myong bar 'gyur ba'i las nges pa rnams
analyzed: re zhig nyi ma dang po la rlung mo che byung nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grong khyer byi dor bya ba ni me tog dang gos la sogs pa'i char 'bab pa ni skye bo'i tshogs de'i longs spyod myong bar 'gyur ba'i las nges pa rnams
translated: “On the first day, a great wind arose” and so on means that the purification of the city is the rain of flowers, clothes, and so on, which should be understood as the definite karma of the assembly of people to be experienced as their enjoyment.

original: mthar thug par bya ba'i phyir 'bab par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar thug par bya ba'i phyir 'bab par shes par bya'o //
translated: It falls in order to bring it to completion.

original: khar phor zhes bya ba ni khar ba'i snod do //
analyzed: khar phor zhes bya ba ni khar ba'i snod do //
translated: A drinking vessel is a vessel for drinking.

original: byur bur gang zhes bya ba ni rtses btags te gang ba'o//
analyzed: byur bur gang zhes bya ba ni rtses btags te gang ba'o//
translated: It is filled to the brim means it is filled to the top.

original: grong mi rnams la zhes bya ba ni grong khyer na gnas pa'i mi rnams la'o //
analyzed: grong mi rnams la zhes bya ba ni grong khyer na gnas pa'i mi rnams la'o //
translated: To the people of the town means to the people of the city.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa ste zhes bya ba ni go bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa ste zhes bya ba ni go bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To request means to make a request.

original: gnas gzhi zhes bya ba ni lha khang gi gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas gzhi zhes bya ba ni lha khang gi gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A temple is a place for a temple.

original: 'dod pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @183b go ;
analyzed: 'dod pas 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig @183b go ;
translated: To go by desire means to go by desire.

original: /'dod pa'i dri nga zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi dri nga'o //
analyzed: /'dod pa'i dri nga zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi dri nga'o //
translated: The foul smell of desire is the foul smell of desire.

original: gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni sdong po'i dri ma 'dud pa'o //🔽'bab pa zhes bya ba ni bar gyi yal ga'i grib ma ches 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni sdong po'i dri ma 'dud pa'o // 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni bar gyi yal ga'i grib ma ches 'bab pa'o //
translated: To incline means to incline the smell of the trunk.🔽To descend means the shade of the middle branches descends.

original: bab pa zhes bya ba ni steng gi yal ga'i grib ma shin tu 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: bab pa zhes bya ba ni steng gi yal ga'i grib ma shin tu 'bab pa'o //
translated: To fall means the shade of the upper branches falls.

original: bu mo bzang mo zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa sta ya rabs ma yin pa dang / ma reg ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bu mo bzang mo zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa sta ya rabs ma yin pa dang / ma reg ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “good girl” means a faultless, respectable woman, and the term “not touched” means not touched by a man.

original: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur ma yin pa byas pa de bde ba'i rgyu nyid du lta ba ste /
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur ma yin pa byas pa de bde ba'i rgyu nyid du lta ba ste /
translated: The term “evil view” means the view that the service of a pratyekabuddha is a cause of happiness.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “the view that regards morality and asceticism as paramount” means the view that regards morality and asceticism as the cause of purification.

original: de ltar au dra ya na'i rtogs pa brjod pa 'dis sngo bsangs can koo sh'amb'ir zhugs pa'i don dang ldan pa rgya cher bstan to /
analyzed: de ltar au dra ya na'i rtogs pa brjod pa 'dis sngo bsangs can koo sh'amb'ir zhugs pa'i don dang ldan pa rgya cher bstan to /
translated: Thus, this avadāna of Udayana illustrates the story of Śyāmāvatī’s entry into Kauśāmbī.

original: // / da ni ji ltar sngo bsangs can bstan pa de dang 'dra ba byung ba'i mtha' btsun mo dpal ldan byung ba la brten nas /
analyzed: // / da ni ji ltar sngo bsangs can bstan pa de dang 'dra ba byung ba'i mtha' btsun mo dpal ldan byung ba la brten nas /
translated: Now, just as Śyāmāvatī was allowed to enter the king’s palace, in the same way, based on the queen Śrīmatī who appeared at the end of the eon,

original: rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug pa gnang ba de rgya cher bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang du 'jug pa gnang ba de rgya cher bstan par bya'o //
translated: it will be explained in detail how she was allowed to enter the king’s palace.

original: koo sh'amb'i na khyim bdag nor bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: koo sh'amb'i na khyim bdag nor bzangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In Kauśāmbī, there was a householder named Sudhana, and so on.

original: gser gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mi spyad par sba ba'o //
analyzed: gser gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni mi spyad par sba ba'o //
translated: Placing gold means storing it without using it.

original: khyim khol zhes bya ba ni bza' mi tsam gyi rje dpon de zhing las kyis 'tsho ba'i mi dag go //
analyzed: khyim khol zhes bya ba ni bza' mi tsam gyi rje dpon de zhing las kyis 'tsho ba'i mi dag go //
translated: House servants are those who live by farming and are the masters of just a husband and wife.

original: chos dang rig pas zhes bya ba la 'dir chos zhes bya ba ni chags pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang rig pas zhes bya ba la 'dir chos zhes bya ba ni chags pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By Dharma and knowledge, here Dharma refers to the absence of attachment and so on.

original: rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi gdags pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi gdags pa'o //
translated: Knowledge refers to worldly designations.

original: rgyu ba dang gnas pa las zhes bya ba la rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang gnas pa las zhes bya ba la rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: From wandering and staying, wandering means going.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'o //
translated: Staying means sitting.

original: sngon ma byung ba'i rtags dang cha lugs can zhes bya ba ni ma grags pa'i rab tu byung ba'i cha lugs 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba'i rtags dang cha lugs can zhes bya ba ni ma grags pa'i rab tu byung ba'i cha lugs 'chang ba'o //
translated: Having an unprecedented sign and attire means wearing an unknown renunciant's attire.

original: 'byor ba thob pa dang rnyed pa thob cing zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: 'byor ba thob pa dang rnyed pa thob cing zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Having attained wealth and having attained gain means having attained wealth and having attained gain.

original: 'byor la thob pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i don grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor la thob pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i don grub pa'o //
translated: The phrase having attained the opportunity means that the purpose of practice has been accomplished.

original: rnyed pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i khe spogs byin pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i khe spogs byin pa'o //
translated: The phrase having attained the reward means that the reward for accomplishment has been given.

original: shin tu lham me zhes bya ba ni lus dang 'brel ba'i gzi brjid kyis gsal ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu lham me zhes bya ba ni lus dang 'brel ba'i gzi brjid kyis gsal ba'o //
translated: The phrase having become radiant means that the body is radiant with its own splendor.

original: lhan ne zhes bya ba ni lus las phyir byung ba'i gzi brjid kyis phyis gsal ba'o //
analyzed: lhan ne zhes bya ba ni lus las phyir byung ba'i gzi brjid kyis phyis gsal ba'o //
translated: The phrase having become resplendent means that the body is radiant with splendor that radiates outward.

original: lhang nge zhes bya ba ni dbyibs dang rgyan gyis mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: lhang nge zhes bya ba ni dbyibs dang rgyan gyis mdzes pa'o //
translated: The phrase having become brilliant means that the body is beautiful with its shape and ornaments.

original: mgron zhes bya ba ni phan gdags pa'o //
analyzed: mgron zhes bya ba ni phan gdags pa'o //
translated: The phrase having become a guest means that the body is a guest to be honored.

original: dbyar 'das nas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi dus 'das nas so //
analyzed: dbyar 'das nas zhes bya ba ni dbyar gyi dus 'das nas so //
translated: The phrase after the rains retreat means after the rainy season.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas zhes bya ba ni de dag sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas zhes bya ba ni de dag sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro//
translated: The phrase having manifested the fruit of non-returning means that they had previously been freed from passion by the mundane path.

original: @184a * // dpes mtshon pa gang dag 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spong ba med par gnod pa kho nar ni 'gyur te sa bon ma btsal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer bdag gi lugs ni gzhung 'di dang 'gal bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: @184a * // dpes mtshon pa gang dag 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spong ba med par gnod pa kho nar ni 'gyur te sa bon ma btsal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer bdag gi lugs ni gzhung 'di dang 'gal bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The example is not appropriate, because the afflictions are not abandoned without the mundane path, and it would be a fault, because the seed would not be sought.

original: bgrod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i gnas nas dngos su'o //
analyzed: bgrod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i gnas nas dngos su'o //
translated: “Having gone” means having gone from the place of the basis.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni lam yongs su zhar la'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni lam yongs su zhar la'o //
translated: “Having traversed” means having traversed the path.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “Having stayed” means having stayed in the manner of not moving.

original: de thams cad byas shing bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni gtso cher bya ba ni byas pa mthar thug par bya ba ni bsgrubs nas so //
analyzed: de thams cad byas shing bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni gtso cher bya ba ni byas pa mthar thug par bya ba ni bsgrubs nas so //
translated: “Having done and accomplished all of that” means having done the principal action and having accomplished the culmination of the action.

original: tshal zhes bya ba ni me tog dang 'bras bu med pa'i tshal lo //
analyzed: tshal zhes bya ba ni me tog dang 'bras bu med pa'i tshal lo //
translated: “Forest” means a forest without flowers and fruit.

original: rgyun lugs nyung zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i 'drul zags nyung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun lugs nyung zhes bya ba ni skye bo'i 'drul zags nyung ba'o //
translated: “Few people” means few people come and go.

original: glag cor nyung zhes bya ba ni sgra chung ba'o //
analyzed: glag cor nyung zhes bya ba ni sgra chung ba'o //
translated: “Little noise” means little sound.

original: mtshan mo sgra chung ba zhes bya ba ni me la tshe byed pa'i skye bo dang btsun mo'i 'khor gyi skye bo dang / bram ze dang la sogs pa'i skye bos mtshan mo shin tu gtso dang glu dbyangs dang / glog gi sgra la sogs pas 'khrug pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: mtshan mo sgra chung ba zhes bya ba ni me la tshe byed pa'i skye bo dang btsun mo'i 'khor gyi skye bo dang / bram ze dang la sogs pa'i skye bos mtshan mo shin tu gtso dang glu dbyangs dang / glog gi sgra la sogs pas 'khrug pa med pa'o ;
translated: The night is called “soundless” because it is not disturbed by the sounds of people and women tending the fires, by the sounds of Brahmins and others chanting, by the sounds of lightning, and so on.

original: /'ur sgra zhes bya ba ni rdza rnga ba ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra chung ba'o //
analyzed: /'ur sgra zhes bya ba ni rdza rnga ba ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra chung ba'o //
translated: “Soundless” means that the sounds of clay drums, conches, and so on are not heard.

original: gnas brtan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i dus ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa dag gis so //🔽rtag tu rgyun mi chad par zhes bya ba la /🔽rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus tshigs thams cad du'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa'i dus ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa dag gis so // rtag tu rgyun mi chad par zhes bya ba la / rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus tshigs thams cad du'o //
translated: “The elders” means the compilers of the canon when the Bhagavān was present.🔽“Always” means at all times.🔽“Without interruption” means by the continuity of moments.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis de skad cig re re la zhes bya ba ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis de skad cig re re la zhes bya ba ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “In every moment” means in every instant.

original: bsod nams 'ba' zhig mngon par 'phel bar zhes bya ba ni skye ba skye ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams 'ba' zhig mngon par 'phel bar zhes bya ba ni skye ba skye ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Merit alone increases” means that the stream of birth is uninterrupted.

original: bsod nams 'ba' zhig nye bar skye ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams 'ba' zhig nye bar skye ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Merit alone is generated” means that it is generated from other causes.

original: rdzas las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Derived from substance” means

original: phyi rol gyi rdzas kyi rgyu las byung ba ste sa gzhi la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rdzas kyi rgyu las byung ba ste sa gzhi la sogs pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that it arises from external material causes, because it depends on the earth, etc.

original: bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dge ba'o //
translated: “Basis of meritorious action” means that merit is virtue.

original: bya ba ni zhes bya ba ni las te /
analyzed: bya ba ni zhes bya ba ni las te /
translated: “Action” means karma.

original: lus kyi las la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the karma of body, etc.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni gnas te sems pa'i yul yin pas bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni gnas te sems pa'i yul yin pas bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi'o //
translated: “Basis” means the place, the object of intention, the basis of meritorious action.

original: de la rig byed las byung ba rnam pa bdun sbyin pa ni bsod nams kyang yin te /
analyzed: de la rig byed las byung ba rnam pa bdun sbyin pa ni bsod nams kyang yin te /
translated: Among these, the seven types of action that arise from expression are merit,

original: dge ba'i sems kyis bslang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyis bslang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are motivated by a virtuous mind.

original: bya ba yang yin te /
analyzed: bya ba yang yin te /
translated: They are also action.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are by nature bodily and vocal action.

original: gzhi yang yin te lus dang ngag gi las sems pas @184b yul du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi yang yin te lus dang ngag gi las sems pas @184b yul du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also the basis, because bodily and vocal action are the domain of intention.

original: rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa la bya ba ni dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po nges par 'byung ba ldan pa dang / de lta'o snyam pa dang / de la bsnyen bkur bya'o snyam pa dang / des bstan pa rjes su bsgrub bo snyam pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa la bya ba ni dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po nges par 'byung ba ldan pa dang / de lta'o snyam pa dang / de la bsnyen bkur bya'o snyam pa dang / des bstan pa rjes su bsgrub bo snyam pa'o //
translated: The action of that which is not derived from the elements is the great joy and delight of renunciation, the thought “it is so,” the thought “I will serve him,” and the thought “I will practice what he teaches.”

original: de lta bu'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las rnam par rig byed dang / rig byed ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bsod nams kyang yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus kyi las dang ngag gi las rnam par rig byed dang / rig byed ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bsod nams kyang yin te /
translated: Such bodily and vocal action, which is by nature informative and noninformative, is merit.

original: dge ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is motivated by a virtuous mind.

original: bya ba yang yin te /
analyzed: bya ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also action.

original: lus dang ngag gi las kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is by nature bodily and vocal action.

original: gzhi yang yin te des kun nas bslang ba ni sems pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzhi yang yin te des kun nas bslang ba ni sems pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is also the basis, because the domain of intention is that which motivates it.

original: / yang bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dge ba dag rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: / yang bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dge ba dag rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Moreover, merit is the practice of virtue.

original: de'i rgyu ni bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi ste /
translated: The basis of merit is the cause of that.

original: dngos gzhi sbyin pa dang nges par bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyu dag gis bsod nams bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi sbyin pa dang nges par bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyu dag gis bsod nams bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one accomplishes merit through the causes of the actual basis, such as generosity and moral discipline.

original: yang na bsod nams zhes bya ba ni sel bar byed pas bsod nams te /
analyzed: yang na bsod nams zhes bya ba ni sel bar byed pas bsod nams te /
translated: Alternatively, merit is that which purifies, because it removes.

original: 'phags pa'i lam mo //🔽de bsgrub par bya ba ni bsod nams bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam mo // de bsgrub par bya ba ni bsod nams bya ba'o //
translated: The noble path is that which purifies.

original: de'i rtsa ba bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi ste sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi lam legs par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi ste sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyi lam legs par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of merit is the cause of that, because it is the foundation of the path of generosity and moral discipline.

original: yang na bsod nams zhes bya ba ni sems can sel zhing sbyong bar byed cing bsod nams te /
analyzed: yang na bsod nams zhes bya ba ni sems can sel zhing sbyong bar byed cing bsod nams te /
translated: Moreover, merit is that which purifies and purifies sentient beings.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvāṇa is that which purifies.

original: de'i don byed pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni bsod nams bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i don byed pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni bsod nams bya ba'o //
translated: The noble eightfold path, which is the means to that, is the basis of merit.

original: de'i gzhi ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni rgyu'o //
translated: The basis of that is the cause.

original: yang de nyid gzhi ste de la yul dang gnas yod pas bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: yang de nyid gzhi ste de la yul dang gnas yod pas bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi ste /
translated: Again, it is a basis because it is the basis for the accumulation of merit.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims gnyis kyis brgyud pa'i 'bras bu lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims gnyis kyis brgyud pa'i 'bras bu lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is the result of the two, giving and morality, because it is the result of the cause that is their continuum.

original: 'bras bu che ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'bras bu rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'bras bu rgya che ba'o //
translated: Great result means the result in a future world is extensive.

original: phan yon che ba zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di'i 'bras bu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: phan yon che ba zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di'i 'bras bu gsal ba'o //
translated: Great benefit means the result in this world is clear.

original: snang ba che ba ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu gsal ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba che ba ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu gsal ba'o //
translated: Great illumination means the result of conscious effort is clear.

original: rgyas pa che ba zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i 'bras bu rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa che ba zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i 'bras bu rgya che ba'o //
translated: Great development means the dominant result is extensive.

original: yang na 'bras bu che ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus so //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu che ba'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus so //
translated: Alternatively, great result means the result of evolutionary development.

original: phan yon che ba zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bus so //
analyzed: phan yon che ba zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bus so //
translated: Great benefit means the result of freedom.

original: snang ba che ba zhes bya ba ni dpa' brtul la sogs pa gang yin pa'i 'bras bus so //
analyzed: snang ba che ba zhes bya ba ni dpa' brtul la sogs pa gang yin pa'i 'bras bus so //
translated: Great illumination means the result of courage, etc.

original: rgyas pa che ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor rgya che ba'i 'bras bus so //
analyzed: rgyas pa che ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor rgya che ba'i 'bras bus so //
translated: The “great increase” is the result of a vast retinue.

original: gdags su rung ba zhes bya ba ni bstan par nus sam zhes @185a * //
analyzed: gdags su rung ba zhes bya ba ni bstan par nus sam zhes @185a * //
translated: “Can be designated” means “can be taught.”

original: bya ba'o // bsod nams sam zhes bya ba ni brgya 'gyur ram stong 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: bya ba'o // bsod nams sam zhes bya ba ni brgya 'gyur ram stong 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: “Merit” means “a hundredfold, a thousandfold, etc.”

original: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'am zhes bya ba ni rgyal srid dam lha nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'am zhes bya ba ni rgyal srid dam lha nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: “The result of merit” means “a kingdom, godhood, etc.”

original: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu tshe rabs bcu'am /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu tshe rabs bcu'am /
translated: “The maturation of the result of merit” means “the maturation result in ten lives,

original: tshe rabs brgya'am /
analyzed: tshe rabs brgya'am /
translated: a hundred lives,

original: tshe rabs stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: a thousand lives, etc.”

original: bsod nams kyi tshad gzung par mi nus te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas mtha' rtogs par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshad gzung par mi nus te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pas mtha' rtogs par mi nus pa ste /
translated: “The measure of merit cannot be grasped” means that the world cannot fathom it,

original: grangs las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it transcends number.

original: bsod nams kyis phung po zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bsod nams kyis phung po zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “The mass of merit”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: is the limit of nirvana.

original: phung po zhes bya ba ni grangs dang tha snyad du 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba ni grangs dang tha snyad du 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “aggregate” means that they are counted and conventionally designated.

original: tha mi dad par zhes bya ba ni 'dres par ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par zhes bya ba ni 'dres par ro //
translated: “ Without distinction” means without mixing them.

original: 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: “ To go” means to approach.

original: rdzas las byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni rdzas gang dag dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni rdzas gang dag dang bral ba ste /
translated: “ Not derived from substance” means that they are not dependent on any substance,

original: sa gzhi la sogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gzhi la sogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not dependent on the earth, etc.

original: grong tshigs ga ge mo zhes bya ba ni grong gi phyogs gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: grong tshigs ga ge mo zhes bya ba ni grong gi phyogs gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: “ In such and such a village” means in any region of the village.

original: dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po nges par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa thob par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po nges par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa thob par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “ To obtain the attainment of the great joy and supreme joy” means

original: dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “joy and supreme joy” means

original: 'phags pa'i lam thob pa'i gang zag gi yul la dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam thob pa'i gang zag gi yul la dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba 'thob pa'o //
translated: that the person who has attained the noble path obtains joy and supreme joy in the object.

original: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya /
analyzed: rgya chen po zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya /
translated: “ Great” means that one should see,

original: bsnyen bkur bya /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya /
translated: honor, and

original: chos mnyan par bya ba'o /
analyzed: chos mnyan par bya ba'o /
translated: listen to the Dharma.

original: de'i tsig rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kun nas slong nus pa kha phyir bltas te 'jug pa dang / kha nang du bltas te 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tsig rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa kun nas slong nus pa kha phyir bltas te 'jug pa dang / kha nang du bltas te 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: and so on, which are the motivating factors of physical indicative and nonindicative form that engage their object externally and engage their object internally.

original: sems 'ba' zhig rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhir smra ba dag ni rgya chen po zhes bya ba che ba ste /
analyzed: sems 'ba' zhig rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhir smra ba dag ni rgya chen po zhes bya ba che ba ste /
translated: Those who assert that merit alone is not derived from substance are called “those who assert the vast,” which is great.

original: rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba cha phra mo skye bar nus pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba cha phra mo skye bar nus pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: They say that merit is the subtle aspect of the transformation of the mindstream that is capable of generating merit.

original: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa la zhen pa dang / dge ba'i sems nyid dang mi ldan pas dge ba'i sems de dang sems las byung ba shin tu phra mo yang rgyud las 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir rtag tu rgyun mi 'chang par bsod nams 'ba' zhig mngon par 'phel ba dang /
analyzed: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa la zhen pa dang / dge ba'i sems nyid dang mi ldan pas dge ba'i sems de dang sems las byung ba shin tu phra mo yang rgyud las 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir rtag tu rgyun mi 'chang par bsod nams 'ba' zhig mngon par 'phel ba dang /
translated: They assert that merit alone increases without interruption because they are not attached to attachment and so on and they do not possess a virtuous mind and the virtuous mind and its subtle mental factors do not transform the mindstream.

original: bsod nams 'ba' zhig mngon par nye bar skye ba zhes bya ba de mi rung ste /
analyzed: bsod nams 'ba' zhig mngon par nye bar skye ba zhes bya ba de mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable to say that merit alone is generated.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i gnas skabs dag phan @185b tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i gnas skabs dag phan @185b tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the states of virtue and nonvirtue are mutually exclusive.

original: gal te sems 'ba' zhig rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun pa yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sems 'ba' zhig rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun pa yin par gyur na /
translated: If the seven bases of the generation of merit that are not derived from material generosity are the mind alone,

original: de ltar rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun pa la /
analyzed: de ltar rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun pa la /
translated: then the seven bases of the generation of merit that are not derived from material generosity are🔽taking refuge in the Buddha and taking the precepts.

original: sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro zhing bslab pa'i gzhi dag len par byed pa 'di ni rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun pa yin no /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro zhing bslab pa'i gzhi dag len par byed pa 'di ni rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun pa yin no /
translated: This is the seventh base of the generation of merit that is not derived from material generosity.

original: bya ba de re zhig mig gsung ba der yang bslab pa'i gzhi dag blangs nas kyang dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge ba des par 'byung ba dang ldan pa 'thob par byed pa 'di ni rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams
analyzed: bya ba de re zhig mig gsung ba der yang bslab pa'i gzhi dag blangs nas kyang dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge ba des par 'byung ba dang ldan pa 'thob par byed pa 'di ni rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams
translated: Even if one sees that action, one should take the precepts and generate joy and supreme joy through that extensive virtue.🔽This is the seventh base of the generation of merit that is not derived from material generosity.

original: bya ba'i gzhi bdun pa yin no zhes sems kyi bye brag bstan pa'i tshig bka' stsal pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: bya ba'i gzhi bdun pa yin no zhes sems kyi bye brag bstan pa'i tshig bka' stsal pa'i rigs na /
translated: The seven bases of action are the basis of meritorious action.

original: de skad ma gsungs pas sems pa'i rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhir mi 'gyur ro /🔽gang dag rnam par rig byed dang rnam par reg byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya pa'i gzhir 'dod pa de dag la ni skyabs su 'gro ba dang bslab pa'i gzhi blang pa'i tshig nyid kyis rnam
analyzed: de skad ma gsungs pas sems pa'i rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhir mi 'gyur ro / gang dag rnam par rig byed dang rnam par reg byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya pa'i gzhir 'dod pa de dag la ni skyabs su 'gro ba dang bslab pa'i gzhi blang pa'i tshig nyid kyis rnam
translated: But since the Buddha did not say this, it is not a basis of meritorious action that is not derived from substance.🔽Those who assert that the basis of meritorious action not derived from substance is indicative form, nonindicative form and nonindicative form are🔽established by the mere words of taking refuge and the basis of training, since they are described as nonindicative form.

original: par rig byed ma yin pa brjod bas rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bstan pa grub pas de'i 'og tu dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa thob par byed pa zhes
analyzed: par rig byed ma yin pa brjod bas rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bstan pa grub pas de'i 'og tu dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa thob par byed pa zhes
translated: Therefore, after that, one should obtain vast joy and supreme joy that are virtuous and possess renunciation.

original: bya ba'i tshig ma smos kyang thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i tshig ma smos kyang thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Although the verbal root kr does not appear in the compound, it is understood as being there.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //🔽nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'gro bas na nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o // nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'gro bas na nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Joy is the delight in virtue and so on.🔽The joy of renunciation is the joy of one who is free from attachment.

original: 'dod pa dang bral ba'i ming ngo //🔽de'i dngos po ni nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa ste chags pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang bral ba'i ming ngo // de'i dngos po ni nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa ste chags pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Renunciation is the name for freedom from attachment.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba ni nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa yin no /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba ni nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa yin no /
translated: The joy and supreme joy associated with that renunciation are the joy of renunciation.

original: tshur gshegs par rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni tshur byon par brtsams pa'o /
analyzed: tshur gshegs par rtsol ba zhes bya ba ni tshur byon par brtsams pa'o /
translated: The joy of striving is the joy of one who has begun to strive.

original: grong tshigs de nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid du 'dug pa'i grong gi gnas su'o /
analyzed: grong tshigs de nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid du 'dug pa'i grong gi gnas su'o /
translated: The joy of dwelling is the joy of one who dwells in a village or town.

original: mthong nas kyang dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'di ni zhi ba nyid kyis 'di las bdag gis chos mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs🔽par rig byed kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'di ni zhi ba nyid kyis 'di las bdag gis chos mnyan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs par rig byed kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: This is the motivation of the indicative action that thinks, “I will listen to the Dharma from this noble one because he is peaceful.”🔽Having heard the Dharma, one generates the great joy and supreme joy that is virtuous and conducive to definite release.

original: @186a * // thos nas kyang dga' ba dang ma chog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos 'di ni bzang gi rjes su bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rig byed kun nas
analyzed: @186a * // thos nas kyang dga' ba dang ma chog tu dga' ba rgya chen po dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni chos 'di ni bzang gi rjes su bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i rig byed kun nas
translated: This is the motivation of the indicative action that thinks, “This Dharma is good and should be practiced,” and so on.

original: slong ba'o // gzung sla bar bya ba dang skye bo ma thos pa rnams nyan du gzhug pa'i phyir ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa brtsams so //
analyzed: slong ba'o // gzung sla bar bya ba dang skye bo ma thos pa rnams nyan du gzhug pa'i phyir ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa brtsams so //
translated: In order to make it easy to grasp and to make those who have not heard it listen, the Teacher also said this and so on, and composed the verses.

original: mtsho mchog ces bya ba ni gting dang pha rol med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtsho mchog ces bya ba ni gting dang pha rol med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The best lake is so called because it has no depth or far shore.

original: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho ni lha brgya phrag du mas gang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho ni lha brgya phrag du mas gang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The auspicious is so called because the ocean is filled with hundreds of gods.

original: gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni gtsang ba nyid de /
analyzed: gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni gtsang ba nyid de /
translated: The pure is so called because of its purity.

original: gtsang ba'i gnas su bya ba gang g'a la sogs pa thams cad pas kyang 'di shi ba'i ro dang lhan cig mi gnas pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsang ba'i gnas su bya ba gang g'a la sogs pa thams cad pas kyang 'di shi ba'i ro dang lhan cig mi gnas pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pure abode is so called because it is superior to all other pure abodes such as the Ganges, since it does not remain with a dead body.

original: ngogs bde ba zhes bya ba'i rim gyis gzhol ba'i phyir dang / ngogs thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngogs bde ba zhes bya ba'i rim gyis gzhol ba'i phyir dang / ngogs thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pleasant shore is so called because it is gradually sloping and because it is the abode of all shores.

original: rin chen 'byung gnas zhes bya ba ni rin po che 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung gnas zhes bya ba ni rin po che 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The source of jewels is so called because jewels are produced there.

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin te gang g'a la sogs pa mi dang ri dags kyis bsten pa'i chu klung tha dad par 'beb par gyur pa dag rgya mtshor 'gro ba de bzhin du bsod nams kyi rgyun tha dad pa dag kyang sbyin bdag gos dang /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin te gang g'a la sogs pa mi dang ri dags kyis bsten pa'i chu klung tha dad par 'beb par gyur pa dag rgya mtshor 'gro ba de bzhin du bsod nams kyi rgyun tha dad pa dag kyang sbyin bdag gos dang /
translated: The meaning here is this. Just as the Ganges and other rivers, frequented by humans and animals, flow separately and enter the ocean, so too the different streams of merit enter the ocean of the buddhas.🔽

original: zas dang / skom dang / mal cha dang / stan dang gding ba sbyin par byed pa'i mi la rnam pa kun gyi sgo nas 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽chu klung chu 'bab rgya mtsho ji bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba yang bzlas te gsungs pa ni bsod nams kyi rgyu tshad med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zas dang / skom dang / mal cha dang / stan dang gding ba sbyin par byed pa'i mi la rnam pa kun gyi sgo nas 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // chu klung chu 'bab rgya mtsho ji bzhin no // zhes bya ba yang bzlas te gsungs pa ni bsod nams kyi rgyu tshad med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The meaning here is as follows: Just as the Ganges and other rivers, which flow separately and are frequented by humans and deer, enter the ocean, so also the different streams of merit come to the person who gives gifts of clothing, food, drink, bedding, seats, and cushions, in every way.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The verse “Just as rivers flow into the ocean” is stated again to show that the cause of merit is immeasurable.

original: ji ltar chu klung 'bab cing chus gang ba tha dad pa dag la tshad med pa bzhin du bsod nams kyi rgyun de dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar chu klung 'bab cing chus gang ba tha dad pa dag la tshad med pa bzhin du bsod nams kyi rgyun de dag kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as the different rivers that flow and are full of water are immeasurable, so also those streams of merit are like that. This is the meaning.

original: skad phyung zhes bya ba ni gdangs phyung ba'o //
analyzed: skad phyung zhes bya ba ni gdangs phyung ba'o //
translated: The phrase with a loud voice means with a loud sound.

original: de'i tshe yang rgyal po shar bas gdangs las shes par 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni skad phyung ba 'dis de dag spyan drangs so zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i tshe yang rgyal po shar bas gdangs las shes par 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni skad phyung ba 'dis de dag spyan drangs so zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: At that time, the king understood from the sound, By this loud voice, they invited him.

original: / stong thub ces bya ba ni gcig pus stong thub cing mi 'pham pa'o //
analyzed: / stong thub ces bya ba ni gcig pus stong thub cing mi 'pham pa'o //
translated: The phrase a thousand-winner means that he was invincible in single combat.

original: mda' lnga brgya pa'i dong pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni mda' lnga brgya lnga brgyas gang ba'i dong pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mda' lnga brgya pa'i dong pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni mda' lnga brgya lnga brgyas gang ba'i dong pa gnyis so //
translated: The phrase two quivers of five hundred arrows means two quivers filled with five hundred arrows each.

original: dpa' bo yongs su spang ba zhes bya ba ni lam dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo yongs su spang ba zhes bya ba ni lam dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase the hero was abandoned means that the path was divided.

original: phan tshun mda' khar dgye ba zhes bya ba ni mda' 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun mda' khar dgye ba zhes bya ba ni mda' 'phangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase they shot arrows at each other means that they shot arrows.

original: @186b khyed kyang dung ste nged kyang rung //
analyzed: @186b khyed kyang dung ste nged kyang rung //
translated: Whether you live or we live,

original: zhes bya ba ni khyod gson par gyur kyang rung nged gson par gyur kyang rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyod gson par gyur kyang rung nged gson par gyur kyang rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that whether you live or we live.

original: be reg ces bya ba ni snum khur nang tshangs can no //
analyzed: be reg ces bya ba ni snum khur nang tshangs can no //
translated: The phrase the Bhima means the Bhima of the inner circle.

original: ri lu zhes bya ba ni mon sran gre'u la sogs pa las byas pa'i ri lu kha rar btsos ba'o //
analyzed: ri lu zhes bya ba ni mon sran gre'u la sogs pa las byas pa'i ri lu kha rar btsos ba'o //
translated: A pill is a pill made from beans, etc., and cooked in the mouth.

original: tshong dus zhes bya ba ni btsong ba'i gnas kyi tshar ro //
analyzed: tshong dus zhes bya ba ni btsong ba'i gnas kyi tshar ro //
translated: A market is a place for selling.

original: zhal ta pa zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhal ta pa zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'o //
translated: A servant is one who does the work.

original: bag ma btang ba zhes bya ba ni bu mo sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bag ma btang ba zhes bya ba ni bu mo sbyin pa'o //
translated: A marriage is the giving of a daughter.

original: bag ma len pa zhes bya ba ni bu mo bsu ba'o //
analyzed: bag ma len pa zhes bya ba ni bu mo bsu ba'o //
translated: A wedding is the taking of a daughter.

original: grong dpon zhes bya ba ni mi'i gtso bo'o //
analyzed: grong dpon zhes bya ba ni mi'i gtso bo'o //
translated: A village headman is the chief of men.

original: rdzing bu 'bu zhes bya ba ni lteng ka kha bsro ba'o //
analyzed: rdzing bu 'bu zhes bya ba ni lteng ka kha bsro ba'o //
translated: A pond is a place for bathing.🔽A vital part is a vital part of the body that becomes the cause of death.

original: gnad gcod kha zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i lus kyi phyogs kyi gnad de dag tu sems med pa'i 'gyur ba'i tshe zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
