analyzed: gnad gcod kha zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i lus kyi phyogs kyi gnad de dag tu sems med pa'i 'gyur ba'i tshe zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When one is in that condition means when one is in that state without consciousness.

original: gnas skabs de ltar byas na zhes bya ba ni nges par byas pas te khrims bcas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas skabs de ltar byas na zhes bya ba ni nges par byas pas te khrims bcas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having made such a rule means having made a definite rule, that is, having made a law.

original: khyim byang zhes bya ba ni khyim khol gyi ming byad do //
analyzed: khyim byang zhes bya ba ni khyim khol gyi ming byad do //
translated: A houseboy is the name of a servant.

original: dbyangs te bzhag ces bya ba ni 'phyang du gzhug pa'o ;
analyzed: dbyangs te bzhag ces bya ba ni 'phyang du gzhug pa'o ;
translated: The word placed means hung down.

original: / bdag nyid dang mnyam pa'i sngag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid phangs pa dang 'dra ba'i phangs pa gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / bdag nyid dang mnyam pa'i sngag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid phangs pa dang 'dra ba'i phangs pa gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One's own equal means another equal to oneself, that is, another dear one like oneself.

original: gsol ba gdab par brtsams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gsol ba gdab par brtsams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having begun to pray, etc.

original: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams na'o //🔽dge ba rnams zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams na'o // dge ba rnams zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa rnams so //
translated: In the world means in the world system.🔽The virtuous means the holy men.

original: dul ba rnams zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: dul ba rnams zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: The disciplined means those who have moral discipline.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i bsam gtan pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i bsam gtan pa rnams so //
translated: The peaceful means those who are absorbed in the meditation of serenity.

original: dbang thul rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po bsrungs shing thul ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dbang thul rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po bsrungs shing thul ba rnams kyis so //
translated: The self-controlled means those who have guarded and controlled their eyes, etc.

original: mi stong bas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na de lta bu yod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi stong bas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na de lta bu yod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The non-empty means that such people exist in the world.

original: bu'i don du zhes bya ba ni bu bskyab pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bu'i don du zhes bya ba ni bu bskyab pa'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of the son means for the sake of protecting the son.

original: der 'dud kyis zhes bya ba ni de dag la skyabs su gsol gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der 'dud kyis zhes bya ba ni de dag la skyabs su gsol gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By bowing to them means by supplicating them for protection.

original: bdag gi byis pa bskyab tu gsol zhes bya ba ni byis pa skyob par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi byis pa bskyab tu gsol zhes bya ba ni byis pa skyob par gyur cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Protect my child means may the child be protected.

original: chu klung skal ldan shing rta pa //
analyzed: chu klung skal ldan shing rta pa //
translated: The river Pushpabhadra

original: zhes bya ba ni gang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang ba'o //
translated: is full.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsol bal sogs pa la nor zhes bya ba ni rdzas so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsol bal sogs pa la nor zhes bya ba ni rdzas so //
translated: In the verse wealth means property.

original: legs spyad ces bya ba ni shin tu goms pa'o //
analyzed: legs spyad ces bya ba ni shin tu goms pa'o //
translated: Good conduct means complete familiarity.

original: bde spyod ces bya ba ni bde ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: bde spyod ces bya ba ni bde ba skye ba'o //
translated: Happy conduct means the arising of happiness.

original: ro rnams nang na mngar mchog ces bya ba ni ro dag pas ches mngar ba'o //🔽ji ltar 'tsho na zhes bya @187a * //
analyzed: ro rnams nang na mngar mchog ces bya ba ni ro dag pas ches mngar ba'o // ji ltar 'tsho na zhes bya @187a * //
translated: Among tastes, sweetness is supreme means sweeter than the sweetest taste.

original: ba ni rnam pa gang gis 'tsho na'o //
analyzed: ba ni rnam pa gang gis 'tsho na'o //
translated: How does one live? means by what means does one live?

original: dad pa skyes bu'i nor mchog yin //
analyzed: dad pa skyes bu'i nor mchog yin //
translated: Faith is the supreme human wealth.

original: zhes bya ba ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dad pa phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because faith is the forerunner of all perfections.

original: chos la legs spyad bde spyod 'gyur //
analyzed: chos la legs spyad bde spyod 'gyur //
translated: One enjoys the good life through the good life of Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang sgom pa la sogs pa dag gis 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang sgom pa la sogs pa dag gis 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one accomplishes the mundane and supramundane happiness through generosity, morality, meditation, etc.

original: bden pa ro rnams mngar mchog yin //
analyzed: bden pa ro rnams mngar mchog yin //
translated: The truth is the supreme taste.

original: zhes bya ba ni bden par smra ba dag gis 'di dang phyi ma'i 'bras bu 'dod pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa rnams yongs su dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bden par smra ba dag gis 'di dang phyi ma'i 'bras bu 'dod pa mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa rnams yongs su dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the good people are delighted by the truth-speakers, since they accomplish the desired results in this life and the next.🔽One lives through knowledge.

original: shes pas 'tsho na zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yul du gyur pa mi slob pa'i shes rab kyis 'tsho na ste /
analyzed: shes pas 'tsho na zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yul du gyur pa mi slob pa'i shes rab kyis 'tsho na ste /
translated: This is because one lives through the knowledge of the four noble truths, which is the knowledge of the non-learner.

original: zag pa zad na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zag pa zad na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “through the destruction of the contaminants.”🔽The supreme living is taught.

original: 'tsho mchog bstan zhes bya ba ni dgos pa thams cad grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho mchog bstan zhes bya ba ni dgos pa thams cad grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all purposes are accomplished.

original: grags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba gang la yon tan brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi grags pa yod pa'o ;
analyzed: grags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba gang la yon tan brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi grags pa yod pa'o ;
translated: One who is renowned is one who is known for his good qualities.

original: / snyan pa zhes bya ba ni mi'i yon tan grags pa'o //
analyzed: / snyan pa zhes bya ba ni mi'i yon tan grags pa'o //
translated: One who is famous is one who is known for his human qualities.

original: mdza' bshes ji ltar rnyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //🔽tshul khrims kyis ni grags ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: mdza' bshes ji ltar rnyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'thob par 'gyur ba'o // tshul khrims kyis ni grags ldan 'gyur //
translated: How does one acquire friends? means How does one obtain them?

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sgras khyab pa'i phyir ro //🔽bden pa snyan pa 'thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sgras khyab pa'i phyir ro // bden pa snyan pa 'thob 'gyur te //
translated: One becomes renowned through morality means that one's fame spreads in all directions.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One obtains truth and fame means that one's fame is not distorted.

original: 'dris pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa ste byams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa ste byams pa'o //
translated: One becomes intimate means that one becomes familiar and loving.

original: bkur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gzung bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: bkur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gzung bar 'os pa'o //
translated: One is respected means that one is worthy of being held in esteem.

original: zil gnon zhes bya ba ni smas shing nyams pa'o //
analyzed: zil gnon zhes bya ba ni smas shing nyams pa'o //
translated: One is victorious means that one is not defeated.

original: drug gis 'jig rten 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni mngal na gnas pa'i tshe 'byung ba drug gis te /
analyzed: drug gis 'jig rten 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni mngal na gnas pa'i tshe 'byung ba drug gis te /
translated: The world arises through six means that the world arises through the six elements at the time of being in the womb.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis so //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis so //
translated: the elements of earth, water, fire, air, space, and consciousness.

original: drug gis 'dris pa 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: drug gis 'dris pa 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: Six are the means of acquiring friends.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po drug gi tha snyad gdags pa'i don du de dag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po drug gi tha snyad gdags pa'i don du de dag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Six are the means of acquiring friends, because they are applied to the six sense-faculties, eye, etc., for the purpose of designating them.

original: drug gis 'jig rten bkur 'gyur te //
analyzed: drug gis 'jig rten bkur 'gyur te //
translated: Six are the means of being honored in the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gzhi drug gis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gzhi drug gis te /
translated: Six are the means of being honored in the world, because they are the six bases of true satisfaction:

original: byams pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las dang / tshul khrims dang / rnyed pa dang / lta ba mthun pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: byams pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las dang / tshul khrims dang / rnyed pa dang / lta ba mthun pa nyid kyis so //
translated: the activity of love in body, speech, and mind, morality, material things, and agreement in views.

original: drug gis 'jig rten zil gnon 'gyur //
analyzed: drug gis 'jig rten zil gnon 'gyur //
translated: Six are the means of overcoming the world.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / @187b ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ba'i yul drug gis de yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba dag gis rjes su chags pa dang khong khro skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / @187b ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ba'i yul drug gis de yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba dag gis rjes su chags pa dang khong khro skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six sense objects, form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects, are pleasant and unpleasant, and so they generate attachment and aversion.

original: gdugs mtshan g-yeng ba ma mchis pa //
analyzed: gdugs mtshan g-yeng ba ma mchis pa //
translated: Who, day and night, is not distracted,

original: gang zhig 'dod pa 'di las rgal //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod pa 'di las rgal //
translated: and who crosses over this desire?

original: zhes bya ba ni zhu ba gcig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhu ba gcig ste /
translated: This is one question.

original: sems can gang zhig nyin mtshan du g-yel ba med par brtson pas nang gir brjod par 'dod pa'i 'dod pa bzhi po 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid 'di las brgal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can gang zhig nyin mtshan du g-yel ba med par brtson pas nang gir brjod par 'dod pa'i 'dod pa bzhi po 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid 'di las brgal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Who, with effort day and night, without distraction, crosses over this desire, which is the four desires to be expressed internally, having the characteristics of desire, existence, view, and ignorance?

original: dmigs na brten pa ma mchis pa //
analyzed: dmigs na brten pa ma mchis pa //
translated: When there is an object, there is no support.

original: zab mor gang zhig 'bying mi 'gyur //
analyzed: zab mor gang zhig 'bying mi 'gyur //
translated: Who does not sink in the profound?

original: zhes bya ba ni zhu ba gnyis te sems can gang zhig dmigs pa med pa dang rten med pa'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zab mor 'bying bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhu ba gnyis te sems can gang zhig dmigs pa med pa dang rten med pa'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zab mor 'bying bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: These are the two questions: which sentient beings will not sink into the profound suffering of cyclic existence, which is without reference point and without support?

original: de la dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
translated: Therein, “without reference point” means the peak of cyclic existence.

original: de'i gong na dmigs pa'i yul gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong na dmigs pa'i yul gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other object of reference above that.

original: rten med pa zhes bya ba ni ngan song sems can dmyal ba chen po'i gnas te /
analyzed: rten med pa zhes bya ba ni ngan song sems can dmyal ba chen po'i gnas te /
translated: “Without support” means the great hells, the lower miserable destinies.

original: de'i 'og tu ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rten gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rten gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other support for the opposing factors below that.

original: zab mo zhes bya ba ni rang gi dus kyi sdug bsngal zad pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo zhes bya ba ni rang gi dus kyi sdug bsngal zad pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Profound” means that the suffering of one’s own time is endless.

original: rnam kun tshul khrims ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam kun tshul khrims ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Possessing morality in all ways” and so on.

original: rnam kun zhes bya ba ni lus dad ngag dang yid kyi sgo rnam pa thams cad nas tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam kun zhes bya ba ni lus dad ngag dang yid kyi sgo rnam pa thams cad nas tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “In all ways” means possessing morality through all aspects of body, speech, and mind.

original: legs mnyam gzhag ces bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pa'o //
analyzed: legs mnyam gzhag ces bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pa'o //
translated: “Well-equipoised” means having attained the four meditations.

original: shes rab ldan zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ldan zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Endowed with wisdom” means being endowed with the vision of the four noble truths.

original: nang du sems zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa lhag ma spang ba'i phyir mngon par brtson pa ste bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nang du sems zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa lhag ma spang ba'i phyir mngon par brtson pa ste bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'o //
translated: “Mind inward” means being intent on eliminating the remaining afflictions, abiding on the path of cultivation.

original: dran ldan zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: dran ldan zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: “Mindful” means being established in the foundations of mindfulness.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i rkyen las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i rkyen las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: “Liberated” means being liberated from the conditions of complete degeneration.

original: 'dod pa'i 'du shes chags bral zhing //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'du shes chags bral zhing //
translated: “Free from attachment to the perception of the desire realm”

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: means being liberated from the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi kun sbyor mthar gyur pa //
analyzed: gzugs kyi kun sbyor mthar gyur pa //
translated: “Having reached the end of the fetters of the form realm”

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol la bas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol la bas te /
translated: means being liberated from the afflictions of the formless realm.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa nyid yin pas gcig tu bstan to //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa nyid yin pas gcig tu bstan to //
translated: Since it is the level of equipoise, it is taught as one.

original: ji yis 'od pa rgal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji yis 'od pa rgal bar 'gyur //
translated: By what does one cross over the flood?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and other passages.🔽🔽

original: 'dir 'od pa zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi 'ching ba'o//
analyzed: 'dir 'od pa zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi 'ching ba'o//
translated: Here, the “light” is the bondage of the household.

original: @188a * // rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: @188a * // rgya mtsho zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: The “ocean” is the afflictions of the three realms to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The “suffering” is the five aggregates of the desire realm to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: yongs dag ces bya ba ni 'dir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phung po lnga spong ba'o //
analyzed: yongs dag ces bya ba ni 'dir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phung po lnga spong ba'o //
translated: “Purification” is the abandonment of the five aggregates of the form and formless realms to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: dang pas 'od pa rgal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dang pas 'od pa rgal bar 'gyur //
translated: By the first, one crosses the light.

original: zhes bya ba ni dad pas rab tu byung ba la brten pas de'i khyim gyi 'od pa gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dad pas rab tu byung ba la brten pas de'i khyim gyi 'od pa gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that by relying on going forth through faith, one abandons the light of the household.

original: bag yod pas ni rgya mtsho rgal //
analyzed: bag yod pas ni rgya mtsho rgal //
translated: By heedfulness, one crosses the ocean.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir bag yod pa lhur len pa la mthong ba'i lam skye ba'i sgo nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bar 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir bag yod pa lhur len pa la mthong ba'i lam skye ba'i sgo nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bar 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, by striving in heedfulness, one accomplishes the abandonment of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing through the arising of the path of seeing.

original: brtson par sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: brtson par sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te //
translated: He suffers when he is diligent.

original: zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa la bdud 'khor dang bcas pa pham pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa la bdud 'khor dang bcas pa pham pas /
translated: This is because when he is diligent, Mara and his retinue are defeated.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa las yang dag par 'da' bar 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa las yang dag par 'da' bar 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because he is established in transcending the realm of desire.

original: shes rab kyis ni yongs dag 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni yongs dag 'gyur //
translated: He becomes purified by wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes rab sgron mas mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i nyon mongs pa'i tsher ma phra mo'i rang bzhin 'byin par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes rab sgron mas mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i nyon mongs pa'i tsher ma phra mo'i rang bzhin 'byin par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is established in removing the subtle defilement-thorns of the stage of meditative concentration by means of the lamp of wisdom.

original: mi 'jigs pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / yid ches par bya ba'i phyir /🔽bde 'dul gtong ba ma gtogs pa'i //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / yid ches par bya ba'i phyir / bde 'dul gtong ba ma gtogs pa'i //
translated: In order to generate fearlessness and in order to generate confidence,🔽he said:🔽Do you have any other Dharma

original: chos gzhan 'ba' zhig yod dam zhes //🔽dge slong bram ze so so la //
analyzed: chos gzhan 'ba' zhig yod dam zhes // dge slong bram ze so so la //
translated: except for the relinquishment of happiness and self-discipline?🔽You should ask the monks and the brahmins

original: gzhan dang gzhan du khyod dris shig / ces bya ba bka' stsal te /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du khyod dris shig / ces bya ba bka' stsal te /
translated: one by one.

original: bden pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Here, morality is called truth.

original: dul ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: dul ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan no //
translated: Concentration is called self-discipline.

original: gtong ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'dir 'khor ba gtong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtong ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'dir 'khor ba gtong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Giving is the wisdom that gives up cyclic existence.

original: de gsum gyis ni bslab pa gsum bstan par shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: de gsum gyis ni bslab pa gsum bstan par shes par bya'o ;
translated: It should be understood that these three indicate the three trainings.

original: / so so la zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa la'o //
analyzed: / so so la zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa la'o //
translated: To each one means to each individual.

original: legs par rab tu bshad ces bya ba ni ma nor bar bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: legs par rab tu bshad ces bya ba ni ma nor bar bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: Well-taught means taught without error.

original: kye ma gnod sbyin bong bu ba //
analyzed: kye ma gnod sbyin bong bu ba //
translated: Alas, you are a demon donkey!

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word “alas” is a word of lamentation.

original: thag ring po nas bod pa'i phyir kye ma zhes skad kyi gsang bstod de brjod pa'o //
analyzed: thag ring po nas bod pa'i phyir kye ma zhes skad kyi gsang bstod de brjod pa'o //
translated: It is said with a loud voice in order to lament from afar.

original: kye ma ston pa bdag don du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kye ma ston pa bdag don du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Alas, Teacher, for my sake!

original: kye ma zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rab tu rangs pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rab tu rangs pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word “alas” is a word of great delight.

original: phyi ma yin zhes bya ba 'jig rten pha rol gyi'o //
analyzed: phyi ma yin zhes bya ba 'jig rten pha rol gyi'o //
translated: The future is the next world.

original: gnod sbyin zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'o //
translated: Demon is secret.

original: rang gi gnas tshol zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid khyod 'dam pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi gnas tshol zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid khyod 'dam pa'o //
translated: Seeking your own place is seeking your own benefit.

original: sems bsdus te zhes bya ba ni der gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: sems bsdus te zhes bya ba ni der gzhol ba'o //
translated: Concentrating the mind is being intent on that.

original: bag yod par zhes bya ba @188b ni las gzhan mi byed par ro //
analyzed: bag yod par zhes bya ba @188b ni las gzhan mi byed par ro //
translated: “Attentively” means not doing anything else.

original: phyir phyogs te zhes bya ba ni yid bsad de'o //
analyzed: phyir phyogs te zhes bya ba ni yid bsad de'o //
translated: “Turned away” means with a focused mind.

original: bag tsha zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyal po bshes 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: bag tsha zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyal po bshes 'jigs pa'o //
translated: “Embarrassed” means afraid of offending the king.

original: yid mi bde nas zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang bral ba nas so //
analyzed: yid mi bde nas zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang bral ba nas so //
translated: “Unhappy” means separated from what is dear.

original: mtshan mo ba lang gi lam du rtsva bting ba la gnas par zhal gyis bzhes so zhes bya ba ni ba lang ni 'jig rten bas gtsang bar bkur ba dang / snang yal che ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan mo ba lang gi lam du rtsva bting ba la gnas par zhal gyis bzhes so zhes bya ba ni ba lang ni 'jig rten bas gtsang bar bkur ba dang / snang yal che ba'i phyir te /
translated: “He agreed to stay at night in the cow pen, lying on the straw spread out for the cows” means that cows are considered pure and great by the world, because they are useful and have great luster.

original: des na lag brgyud 'brog gnas kyis thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas thos shing sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i dran pas gus pa dang bcas pas mtshan mo gnas pa na rgyud yongs su smin cing gzhan la g-yeng ba med pas snga dro mthong na bden pa
analyzed: des na lag brgyud 'brog gnas kyis thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas thos shing sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i dran pas gus pa dang bcas pas mtshan mo gnas pa na rgyud yongs su smin cing gzhan la g-yeng ba med pas snga dro mthong na bden pa
translated: Therefore, when Gopa heard this from the cowherds, and with respect and mindfulness focused on the Buddha, he spent the night with his mindstream fully ripened, without distraction to anything else. In the morning, he saw the truth.

original: dag mthong bar 'gyur ro snyam pas de'i don du mtshan mo ba lang gi lam du gnas par zhal gyis bzhes kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dag mthong bar 'gyur ro snyam pas de'i don du mtshan mo ba lang gi lam du gnas par zhal gyis bzhes kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the sake of staying in the path of the cows at night.

original: khyim bdag gis so sor kun nas dga' bar byas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gis so sor kun nas dga' bar byas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The householder was delighted, as he wished.

original: yongs su gdung ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan no //
translated: Distressed means grieving.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dag bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dag bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Blessed One spoke these verses, and so on.

original: bram ze skyes bu sdig pa med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa'i yon tan dag gis ma gos pa khams gsum gyi phung po dag las rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa kun du bde bar nyal ba yin te /
analyzed: bram ze skyes bu sdig pa med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa'i yon tan dag gis ma gos pa khams gsum gyi phung po dag las rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa kun du bde bar nyal ba yin te /
translated: The brahmin, a person without evil, who is completely liberated from the aggregates of the three realms, is completely at ease,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yongs su gdung ba dag las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yongs su gdung ba dag las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is completely liberated from the distress of attachment and so on.

original: ji ltar bde bar nyal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar nyal ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is he completely at ease?🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / 'di la 'dod pa kun bcad cing //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di la 'dod pa kun bcad cing //
translated: Here, all desires are cut off,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: gang gi phyir sred pa thams cad bcad cing sems kyi yongs su gdung ba bsal ba lus dang ngag gnyis kyis nye bar zhi ba'i skyes bu ni legs par mnyam par gzhag pa ni zhi ba thob pa'i sems zag pa med pa'i sgrub pa med pas bde bar
analyzed: gang gi phyir sred pa thams cad bcad cing sems kyi yongs su gdung ba bsal ba lus dang ngag gnyis kyis nye bar zhi ba'i skyes bu ni legs par mnyam par gzhag pa ni zhi ba thob pa'i sems zag pa med pa'i sgrub pa med pas bde bar
translated: Because he has cut off all craving and removed the burning of the mind, the person who is tranquil in body and speech, well-equipoised, sleeps happily without the practice of the mind which has attained tranquility and is free from the asravas.

original: nyal ba yin te /
analyzed: nyal ba yin te /
translated: He sleeps well,

original: gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is free from all harm.

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi chos nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni chung ma la zas dang / gos kyis mkho ba stobs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi chos nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni chung ma la zas dang / gos kyis mkho ba stobs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten gyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the nature of things in the world. The nature of things in the world is that the husband provides his wife with food and clothing.

original: lus rags par mngon par sprul la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i reg par ro //
analyzed: lus rags par mngon par sprul la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i reg par ro //
translated: Having manifested a gross body in the desire realm,

original: sa'i 'du shes skyed de zhes bya ba ni 'og gzhi'i blo ste nye bar zhog shig pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i 'du shes skyed de zhes bya ba ni 'og gzhi'i blo ste nye bar zhog shig pa'o //
translated: he generates the perception of earth, the idea of a foundation, and lies down.

original: 'dug pa'i mtshan ma yid la gyis shig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid mi g-yo ba'i blo sngon @189a * //🔽du gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: 'dug pa'i mtshan ma yid la gyis shig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid mi g-yo ba'i blo sngon @189a * // du gyis shig pa ste /
translated: The phrase keep in mind the sign of sitting means to keep in mind the thought of not moving.

original: 'gro ba'i blo ma bskyed cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i blo ma bskyed cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase do not generate the thought of going means do not generate the thought of leaving.

original: bde bar gyur bas zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems las su rung bas so //
analyzed: bde bar gyur bas zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems las su rung bas so //
translated: The phrase in a state of ease means with a serviceable body and mind.

original: mngon par brjod pa bgyid do zhes bya ba ni thos pa nyams su myong zhing tshig gi don mngon du gyur pa ste dran pa'i yul du gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa bgyid do zhes bya ba ni thos pa nyams su myong zhing tshig gi don mngon du gyur pa ste dran pa'i yul du gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase we will recite means we will experience what we have heard and will make the meaning of the words manifest, that is, we will make it an object of memory.

original: ma ngoms zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na phyir ma phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma ngoms zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na phyir ma phyogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase we are not satisfied means we are not turning away from that at that time.

original: phyir ma spangs zhes bya ba ni sems gtan du phyir ma log pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ma spangs zhes bya ba ni sems gtan du phyir ma log pa'o //
translated: The phrase we are not rejecting it means we are not turning our minds away from it forever.

original: ma myong ngo zhes bya ba ni ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma myong ngo zhes bya ba ni ma gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase we are not experiencing it means we are not making it manifest.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa med pa'i chos rnams te bden pa mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa med pa'i chos rnams te bden pa mthong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the noble dharmas refers to the dharmas that are not subject to affliction, that is, the dharmas that are associated with the vision of the truth, etc.

original: ser sna 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni ser sna spong bas te /
analyzed: ser sna 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni ser sna spong bas te /
translated: The phrase subduing miserliness means abandoning miserliness.

original: sbyin pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la brtson pa'o //
translated: It means being diligent in generosity.

original: bzhin bsgyur te zhes bya ba ni mi sdug par ro //
analyzed: bzhin bsgyur te zhes bya ba ni mi sdug par ro //
translated: The phrase with a contorted face means with an unpleasant face.

original: lag pa gnyis brkyang nas zhes bya ba ni bsrang nas so //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis brkyang nas zhes bya ba ni bsrang nas so //
translated: The phrase with both hands extended means with both arms extended.

original: mig dmar por byas nas zhes bya ba ni mig khrag can du byas nas so //
analyzed: mig dmar por byas nas zhes bya ba ni mig khrag can du byas nas so //
translated: The phrase with red eyes means with bloodshot eyes.

original: mig gnyis bgrad de zhes bya ba ni gdangs te'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis bgrad de zhes bya ba ni gdangs te'o //
translated: The phrase with wide-open eyes means with staring eyes.

original: 'dra ba'i gang zag ces bya ba ni mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i gang zag ces bya ba ni mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase a person who is similar means a person who is the same.

original: brtul zhugs lnga zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs lnga zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the five austerities refers to the avoidance of killing and so on.

original: rkang lag dra ba can zhes bya ba ni ngang pa bzhin du rkang pa dra bar 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rkang lag dra ba can zhes bya ba ni ngang pa bzhin du rkang pa dra bar 'brel pa'o //
translated: The phrase with webbed hands and feet means that the hands and feet are connected by webs, like a goose.

original: nags na shing shun pa'i gos gyon pa zhes bya ba ni nags khrod na gnas shing shing shun dang shun pa'i gos gyon pa'o //
analyzed: nags na shing shun pa'i gos gyon pa zhes bya ba ni nags khrod na gnas shing shing shun dang shun pa'i gos gyon pa'o //
translated: The phrase wearing bark garments in the forest means living in the forest and wearing garments made of bark and tree-barks.

original: 'bras bu za zhes bya ba ni zas su'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu za zhes bya ba ni zas su'o //
translated: The phrase eating fruits means eating them as food.

original: ri dags gdug pa rnams dang lhan cig gnas bla'i zhes bya ba ni stag la sogs pa gcan gzan khro bo dag dang lhan cig gnas pa bla'i zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: ri dags gdug pa rnams dang lhan cig gnas bla'i zhes bya ba ni stag la sogs pa gcan gzan khro bo dag dang lhan cig gnas pa bla'i zhes bya ba'i //
translated: It is better to live with wild beasts means it is better to live with fierce beasts such as tigers, etc.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab can no //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab can no //
translated: The wise are those who have wisdom.

original: 'jig rten pha rol 'jigs pas zhes bya ba ni ngan song gi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol 'jigs pas zhes bya ba ni ngan song gi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The fear of the next world is the fear of the miserable realms.

original: rgyal srid phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyal srid kyi chad du'o //
analyzed: rgyal srid phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyal srid kyi chad du'o //
translated: For the sake of a kingdom means for the sake of a kingdom's wealth.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang ; sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang ; sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The five superknowledges are the superknowledge of magical power, the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of the minds of others, and the recollection of former lives.

original: gsos shes zhes bya ba ni btsos pa'o //🔽chos kyi rgyud las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsos shes zhes bya ba ni btsos pa'o // chos kyi rgyud las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nourishment is the cooking.🔽The Dharma stream is the stream of Dharma.

original: chos kyi rgyud skyed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyud skyed pa'o //
translated: The Dharma stream is the generation of the Dharma stream.

original: da ni ji ltar sdo ba sangs can shi nas btsun mo dpal ldan byung ba de la brten nas btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du 'jug pa rjes su @189b gnas pa de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar sdo ba sangs can shi nas btsun mo dpal ldan byung ba de la brten nas btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du 'jug pa rjes su @189b gnas pa de bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to show how, after the death of the king, the queen Śrīsaṃbhava arose and entered the retinue of queens, it is said:🔽When the world is to be converted, the wandering mendicant Maṇḍavya,

original: sna tshogs gdul na kun du rgyu ma du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sna tshogs gdul na kun du rgyu ma du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi skus so //
analyzed: mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi skus so //
translated: Beautiful means by the form body.

original: dad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gzigs pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba la sogs pa'i bya bas so //
analyzed: dad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gzigs pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba la sogs pa'i bya bas so //
translated: Faithful means by the actions of looking, bending, stretching, and so on.

original: dbang po zhi ba zhes bya ba ni dbang bo mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po zhi ba zhes bya ba ni dbang bo mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Calm faculties means the faculties are in equipoise.

original: thugs zhi ba zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: thugs zhi ba zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Calm mind means the mind is in equipoise.

original: sems dul ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems dul ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la gnas pa'o //
translated: Tamed mind means abiding in concentration.

original: nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Tranquil means free from attachment.

original: des tshigs su bcad pa smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des tshigs su bcad pa smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He spoke this verse and so on.

original: bram ze zhes bya ba ni ma du la bod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bram ze zhes bya ba ni ma du la bod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term brahmin means one who is born from the mouth of Brahmā.

original: khyim thab ces bya ba yang ma du la bod pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: khyim thab ces bya ba yang ma du la bod pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The term husband also means one who is born from the mouth of Brahmā.

original: de ni gzhon nu mi bsten gyi zhes bya ba ni de ni bu mo bdag gir mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni gzhon nu mi bsten gyi zhes bya ba ni de ni bu mo bdag gir mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase he does not take a young girl means he does not take a daughter.

original: gal te brtul zhugs thabs kyis blangs gyur na //
analyzed: gal te brtul zhugs thabs kyis blangs gyur na //
translated: If he takes her through the rite of sexual union,

original: de ni phyir yang 'dod yon bsten par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni phyir yang 'dod yon bsten par 'gyur //
translated: he will again enjoy the pleasures of love.

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes pa nyid ma nyams pa ma yin zhing tshangs par spyod pa'i brtul zhugs dgos pa 'ba' zhig gi dbang du bya ba'i thabs kyis blangs par gyur nas des dpe med pa mthong na phyir yang 'dod pa'i yon tan dag par 'gyur
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes pa nyid ma nyams pa ma yin zhing tshangs par spyod pa'i brtul zhugs dgos pa 'ba' zhig gi dbang du bya ba'i thabs kyis blangs par gyur nas des dpe med pa mthong na phyir yang 'dod pa'i yon tan dag par 'gyur
translated: If a man who has not lost his potency takes a wife through the rite of sexual union, which is the only rite that is required for the practice of pure conduct, and if he sees something that is unprecedented, he will again enjoy the pleasures of love.

original: ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the text.

original: chags par gyur pa'i mal ni 'khrug par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chags par gyur pa'i mal ni 'khrug par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bed of one who is passionate is disturbed.

original: 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dag gis 'khrug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dag gis 'khrug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are disturbed by the activities of change, etc.

original: sdang ba'i mal ni gya tshom par ma 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khro ba'i dbang gis bar mar lhags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sdang ba'i mal ni gya tshom par ma 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khro ba'i dbang gis bar mar lhags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The bed of hatred is not level, because one becomes depressed due to the power of anger.

original: rmongs pa'i mal ni rkang pa'i mthar 'gror 'gyur zhes bya ba ni brnag pa'i mi mnga' bas rten ma logs su rnyil bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i mal ni rkang pa'i mthar 'gror 'gyur zhes bya ba ni brnag pa'i mi mnga' bas rten ma logs su rnyil bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The bed of delusion is crooked, because one's support is not firm due to lack of resolve.

original: shin tu chags bral zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags spangs pa yin gyi 'dod chags rnam par mnan pa'i ni ma yin no //🔽skyes bu chags pa'i rjes ni gsal mi 'gyur //
analyzed: shin tu chags bral zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags spangs pa yin gyi 'dod chags rnam par mnan pa'i ni ma yin no // skyes bu chags pa'i rjes ni gsal mi 'gyur //
translated: The meaning of free from attachment is that one abandons attachment, not that one suppresses attachment.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba rtal byed pa'i phyir sor mo'i rjes dag mi gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽zhe sdang ldan pa'i rjes ni zab pa yin //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba rtal byed pa'i phyir sor mo'i rjes dag mi gsal bar 'gyur ba'o // zhe sdang ldan pa'i rjes ni zab pa yin //
translated: The meaning of the trace of an elephant is that it is not clear, because it is broken.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro ba'i dbang gis zabs che ba'o //🔽rmongs par 'gyur ba'i rjes ni nogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro ba'i dbang gis zabs che ba'o //🔽rmongs par 'gyur ba'i rjes ni nogs par 'gyur //
translated: The meaning of the trace of a dog is that it is deep, because one is depressed due to the power of anger.🔽The meaning of the trace of a donkey is that it is uneven, because one's support is not firm due to lack of resolve.

original: zhes bya ba ni gti mug chen po'i dbang gis gzugs brnyan phyis pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gti mug chen po'i dbang gis gzugs brnyan phyis pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the power of great delusion, the voice becomes like a polished mirror.

original: chags pa'i mi yi skad ni @190a * //🔽dar ngar po //
analyzed: chags pa'i mi yi skad ni @190a * // dar ngar po //
translated: The voice of an angry man is harsh.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun du chags par 'gyur ba'i skad ni snga ma bas rdos shing 'dar 'dar por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun du chags par 'gyur ba'i skad ni snga ma bas rdos shing 'dar 'dar por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The voice of one who is attached becomes more and more feeble, because of the weakness of one who is attached.

original: sdang ba'i mi yi skad ni rtsub pa yin //
analyzed: sdang ba'i mi yi skad ni rtsub pa yin //
translated: The voice of a hateful man is rough,

original: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi sgra drag po 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi sgra drag po 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a harsh sound is produced through hatred.

original: rmongs pa'i mi yi skad ni 'khrugs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i mi yi skad ni 'khrugs par 'gyur //
translated: The voice of a deluded man is confused,

original: zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi dbang gis skad mi gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi dbang gis skad mi gsal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because the voice becomes unclear through the power of delusion.🔽The voice of a man who is neither attached, hateful, nor deluded is like the sound of a drum,

original: rnga sgra zhes bya ba ni skad gsal zhing snyan pa'o //
analyzed: rnga sgra zhes bya ba ni skad gsal zhing snyan pa'o //
translated: clear and pleasant.

original: chags pa'i mig ni rig rig lta bar byed //
analyzed: chags pa'i mig ni rig rig lta bar byed //
translated: The eyes of an attached man roll around.

original: ces bya ba ni chags pa ni rgod bag che ba'i phyir mi brtan par lta bar byed do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chags pa ni rgod bag che ba'i phyir mi brtan par lta bar byed do //
translated: Because one who is attached is very fickle, he looks around unsteadily.

original: sdang pa'i mig ni dug drag sbrul bzhin lta //
analyzed: sdang pa'i mig ni dug drag sbrul bzhin lta //
translated: The eyes of a hateful man are like a poisonous snake.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi 'bras bu ni drag shul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gi 'bras bu ni drag shul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the result of hatred is violence.

original: sbrul gdug drag po bzhin du drag shul du lta ba'o //
analyzed: sbrul gdug drag po bzhin du drag shul du lta ba'o //
translated: So, violence is seen as like a fierce poisonous snake.

original: rmongs pa'i mig ni mun khrod rtog bzhin lta //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i mig ni mun khrod rtog bzhin lta //
translated: The eye of delusion is like a blind man’s perception in the dark.

original: zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi mun pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mun khrod ni 'thob ci rtog pa bzhin du lta ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi mun pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mun khrod ni 'thob ci rtog pa bzhin du lta ba'o //
translated: This is because the nature of delusion is darkness. So, perception in the dark is like a blind man’s perception.

original: gnya' shing gang tsam du lta zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang tsam du lta ba'o //
analyzed: gnya' shing gang tsam du lta zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang tsam du lta ba'o //
translated: “Looking only a yoke’s length ahead” means looking only the length of a yoke’s tie pole ahead.🔽How are your eyes? How do you look?🔽How is your body? How do you walk?

original: ji ltar 'di spyan ji ltar gzigs pa dang // ji ltar 'di sku brtan par gshegs pa dang // ji ltar 'di yi sgros dang zhal dag ni //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di spyan ji ltar gzigs pa dang // ji ltar 'di sku brtan par gshegs pa dang // ji ltar 'di yi sgros dang zhal dag ni //
translated: How are your teeth and face?

original: rdul dang bral ba nyid du snang ba las //
analyzed: rdul dang bral ba nyid du snang ba las //
translated: How do they appear to be free of dust?

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'di'i mig mi rgod pa dang / ji ltar 'di'i mig lta stangs zhi zhing ma 'khrugs pa dang / ji ltar 'di'i 'gro ba'i lus mi g-yo bar brtan par 'gro ba dang / ji ltar 'di'i mchu gnyis dang kha dag chags dang bral ba nyid du snang ba las na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'di'i mig mi rgod pa dang / ji ltar 'di'i mig lta stangs zhi zhing ma 'khrugs pa dang / ji ltar 'di'i 'gro ba'i lus mi g-yo bar brtan par 'gro ba dang / ji ltar 'di'i mchu gnyis dang kha dag chags dang bral ba nyid du snang ba las na /
translated: This is what it means: Just as his eyes are not restless, just as his eyes are peaceful and calm in their gaze, just as his body moves steadily and firmly when he walks, just as his lips and mouth appear to be free from attachment,

original: 'di gzhon nu mi 'dod kyi phyir log la rang gi sdum par 'dong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di gzhon nu mi 'dod kyi phyir log la rang gi sdum par 'dong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is clear that he does not want a young woman. Therefore, let us return home.

original: gnas 'jog gser mdog ao ta la dag kyang //
analyzed: gnas 'jog gser mdog ao ta la dag kyang //
translated: The sage Vasistha and the king of Otalā

original: bu yi don du 'dod pas rmongs 'gyur te //
analyzed: bu yi don du 'dod pas rmongs 'gyur te //
translated: were also confused by desire for a son.

original: 'di ni chos bzhin phul bas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir drang srong gnas 'jog dang ao ta la dag kyang bu'i don du 'dod pas rmongs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bu mo chos bzhin du phul ba 'di la dogs par byar ci yod ces bya ba'i
analyzed: 'di ni chos bzhin phul bas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir drang srong gnas 'jog dang ao ta la dag kyang bu'i don du 'dod pas rmongs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bu mo chos bzhin du phul ba 'di la dogs par byar ci yod ces bya ba'i
translated: This is a proper gift, means that because the sage Vasistha and the king of Otalā were also confused by desire for a son, what is the doubt in this proper gift of the girl?

original: tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means.

original: gal te gnas 'jog la sogs pa bu dag gi bu bskyed par gyur ces te gzhan dag kyang bu dag bskyed par bya 'am zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te gnas 'jog la sogs pa bu dag gi bu bskyed par gyur ces te gzhan dag kyang bu dag bskyed par bya 'am zhe na ;
translated: If, as you say, the sages, such as Marici, beget sons, then others also should beget sons.

original: de'i phyir thub pa rnams kyis rtag par rgyun du bu dag bskyed par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thub pa rnams kyis rtag par rgyun du bu dag bskyed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the sages would always beget sons.

original: gang gi phyir thub pa rnams kyis rtag par rgyun du bu dag bskyed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'di yang bu'i don du chung ma len par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thub pa rnams kyis rtag par rgyun du bu dag bskyed par 'gyur ba de'i phyir 'di yang bu'i don du chung ma len par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the sages would always beget sons, therefore, he would also take a wife for the sake of a son. This is the meaning.

original: bdag gi bu mo zhes bya ba ni kho bo'i bu @190b mo'o ;
analyzed: bdag gi bu mo zhes bya ba ni kho bo'i bu @190b mo'o ;
translated: My daughter means my daughter.

original: / dam pa zhes bya ba ni bzang zhing mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: / dam pa zhes bya ba ni bzang zhing mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Excellent means good and virtuous.

original: gzugs ldan zhes bya ba ni gzugs mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs ldan zhes bya ba ni gzugs mthong ba'o //
translated: Having form means having a visible form.

original: dar ba zhes bya ba ni dar la bab pa'o //
analyzed: dar ba zhes bya ba ni dar la bab pa'o //
translated: Mature means having reached maturity.

original: mkha' la dgung zla smin drug mjal ba ltar //
analyzed: mkha' la dgung zla smin drug mjal ba ltar //
translated: Like the full moon in the autumn sky,

original: 'di dang lhan cig legs par khyod dgyes mdzod //
analyzed: 'di dang lhan cig legs par khyod dgyes mdzod //
translated: rejoice with her.

original: ces bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la gza' zla ba dang / rgyu skad smin drug phrad pa mdzes pa ltar khyod kyang bu mo 'di dang lhan cig legs par dga' bar byos shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la gza' zla ba dang / rgyu skad smin drug phrad pa mdzes pa ltar khyod kyang bu mo 'di dang lhan cig legs par dga' bar byos shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means: Just as the moon and the Pleiades are beautiful when they meet in the sky, so you should enjoy yourself well with this girl.🔽The brahmin Dadhikaraka

original: bram ze da yis bdud kyi bu mo ni //
analyzed: bram ze da yis bdud kyi bu mo ni //
translated: defeated the daughters of Mara,🔽Tsarani, Rati, and Priti, and never🔽had a lustful thought toward any woman.🔽I never had a lustful thought toward any woman.🔽I never had a lustful thought toward any woman.

analyzed: sred pa dga' byed de bzhin dga' mo dag / pham byas 'dod pa dag la lan 'ga' yang //

analyzed: nga yis 'dun pas sems bskyed ma gyur pas // bshang dang gci bas gang ba 'di la ni //
