original: rkang pas spro ba'ang mi skyed do //
analyzed: rkang pas spro ba'ang mi skyed do //
translated: I never had a lustful thought toward any woman.🔽I never had a

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ngas bdud kyi bu mo sred ma la sogs pa dag pham par byas shing 'dod pa'i yon tan dag la lan 'ga' yang 'dun pa'i sems ma bskyed pa de'i phyir khyod kyi bu mo bshang ba dang / gci bas gang ba 'di la rkang pas reg par yang mi spro na len pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ngas bdud kyi bu mo sred ma la sogs pa dag pham par byas shing 'dod pa'i yon tan dag la lan 'ga' yang 'dun pa'i sems ma bskyed pa de'i phyir khyod kyi bu mo bshang ba dang / gci bas gang ba 'di la rkang pas reg par yang mi spro na len pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning: “Since I have defeated the demon daughters Craving and so on, and have never generated a desirous mind toward the sense objects, therefore I have no interest in even touching with my foot this daughter of yours, who is filled with feces and urine, much less take her as a wife.”

original: bdag gi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag gi bu mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “My daughter,” and so on.

original: yan lag nyams gyur cing zhes bya ba ni yan lag ma tshang bar gyur cing ngo //🔽'dod ldan yon tan bral bar gzigs sam ci //
analyzed: yan lag nyams gyur cing zhes bya ba ni yan lag ma tshang bar gyur cing ngo // 'dod ldan yon tan bral bar gzigs sam ci //
translated: “Her limbs are impaired” means that her limbs are incomplete.🔽“Do you see her as lacking the qualities of one who enjoys desire?”

original: zhes bya ba ni bud med 'dod pa spyod pa'i yon tan kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'dod pa spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rtags dag dang / mi ldan par gzigs sam ci zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bud med 'dod pa spyod pa'i yon tan kha dog dang dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'dod pa spyod pa dang ldan pa'i rtags dag dang / mi ldan par gzigs sam ci zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means, “Do you see her as lacking the signs of one who enjoys desire, such as the qualities of complexion and shape that are the qualities of one who enjoys desire, such as women?”

original: 'dun drag ces bya ba ni 'dun pa shas chen po'i bram ze rmongs ba gang zhig yul 'dod pa de ni khyod kyi bu mo 'di sgrub cis zhes bya ba ni skye bo rmongs pa gang zhig yul 'dod pa de ni khyod kyi bu mo 'di sgrub cing
analyzed: 'dun drag ces bya ba ni 'dun pa shas chen po'i bram ze rmongs ba gang zhig yul 'dod pa de ni khyod kyi bu mo 'di sgrub cis zhes bya ba ni skye bo rmongs pa gang zhig yul 'dod pa de ni khyod kyi bu mo 'di sgrub cing
translated: The phrase one who is very desirous refers to a brahman who is deluded and desirous of sense objects. The phrase he would seek to obtain your daughter means that he would seek to obtain your daughter because he is deluded and desirous of sense objects.

original: 'dod de khro ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod de khro ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase he would be subject to faults such as anger means that he would be subject to faults such as anger.

original: yul la chags shing zhes bya ba 'dis ni nye bar spyod pa nyid yod par ston to ;
analyzed: yul la chags shing zhes bya ba 'dis ni nye bar spyod pa nyid yod par ston to ;
translated: The phrase he would be attached to sense objects indicates that he would be a consumer of sense objects.

original: / khro bar zhugs gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni kun nas mnar sems mang ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: / khro bar zhugs gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis ni kun nas mnar sems mang ba nyid ston to //
translated: The phrase he would be prone to anger indicates that he would be one who is full of malice.

original: 'dir rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause of this, he says:

original: 'di la srab rmongs skye bo chags bral min //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la srab rmongs skye bo chags bral min // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Here, the deluded person is not free from attachment.

original: rab rmongs zhes bya ba ni khyon yongs su rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: rab rmongs zhes bya ba ni khyon yongs su rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
translated: The phrase the deluded person means that he is not capable of fully understanding.

original: nga ni sangs rgyas zhes @191a * //
analyzed: nga ni sangs rgyas zhes @191a * //
translated: I am a buddha.

original: bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag las de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyad par ston te /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag las de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyad par ston te /
translated: By the words “acts” and so on, he shows the superiority of the Tathāgata over others.

original: sangs rgyas ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: “ What kind of Buddha is he? ”

original: de'i phyir thub gtso zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thub gtso zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “the chief of sages” and so on.

original: thub gtso ni drang srong gi mchog ste dka' thub kyis mchog tu gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thub gtso ni drang srong gi mchog ste dka' thub kyis mchog tu gyur ba'o //
translated: The chief of sages is the best of seers, the best through his austerities.

original: mnga' bdag ces bya ba ni rang byung ste rang dbang can no //
analyzed: mnga' bdag ces bya ba ni rang byung ste rang dbang can no //
translated: The “lord” is the self-originated one, the independent one.

original: des ni mthu thogs pa med pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mthu thogs pa med pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows his unimpeded power.

original: ji ltar na thub gtso dang mnga' bdag min zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / nga yis byang chub bla med zhi ba brnyes //
analyzed: ji ltar na thub gtso dang mnga' bdag min zhe na / de'i phyir / nga yis byang chub bla med zhi ba brnyes //
translated: How is he the chief of sages and the lord?

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “I have attained the unsurpassed enlightenment of peace. ”

original: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the knowledge of destruction and non-arising.

original: bla med ces bya ba ni rigs mchog gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bla med ces bya ba ni rigs mchog gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: “ Unsurpassed” is included in the highest lineage.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhi ba ste /
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhi ba ste /
translated: “ Peace” is complete peace,

original: skyon thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: skyon thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: completely beyond all faults.

original: chags pa med pa nyid du 'jig rten rgyu //
analyzed: chags pa med pa nyid du 'jig rten rgyu //
translated: He is the cause of the world’s non-attachment.

original: zhes bya ba ni sred pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral bas gzhan gyi don du rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sred pa la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral bas gzhan gyi don du rgyu'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that he is the cause for the benefit of others, because he is free from the faults of craving, etc.

original: kun du gzigs pa bud med blangs pa mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kun du gzigs pa bud med blangs pa mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He took a wife, etc.

original: kun du gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: kun du gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The all-seer is the Omniscient One.

original: ji nas rjes su mthun par spyad par gyis //
analyzed: ji nas rjes su mthun par spyad par gyis //
translated: You should practice in accordance with that.

original: zhes bya ba ni rkyen du 'bab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rkyen du 'bab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means in accordance with the circumstances.

original: zad gyur cig ces bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa 'di dag zad par gyur ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zad gyur cig ces bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa 'di dag zad par gyur ces bya ba'o //
translated: May they be exhausted! means May these alms-bowls, etc. be exhausted!

original: ring bsrel gcig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid srungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ring bsrel gcig ces bya ba ni bdag nyid srungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One relic means protect yourself.

original: rogs pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i khye'u'o //🔽nga rgyal bcag par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rogs pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze'i khye'u'o // nga rgyal bcag par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: A companion means a young brahmin.🔽 In order to break his pride,

original: zhes bya ba ni rlom pa bcag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlom pa bcag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means in order to break his conceit.

original: phan tshun bde ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig bde ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: phan tshun bde ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig bde ba nyid kyis so //
translated: By their mutual happiness means by their happiness with each other.

original: ku ba'i gzings zhes bya ba ni ku ba bkram pa'i steng du shing sprel pa'o //
analyzed: ku ba'i gzings zhes bya ba ni ku ba bkram pa'i steng du shing sprel pa'o //
translated: A raft means a tree placed on the water with a rope tied around it.

original: khyim thab ces bya ba ni bdag gis byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyim thab ces bya ba ni bdag gis byed pa'o //
translated: A husband means one who acts as master.

original: bdag po zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyod pa'o //
translated: A master means one who enjoys the use of things.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni rlung dang nyi ma la sogs pa glo bur gyi gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni rlung dang nyi ma la sogs pa glo bur gyi gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o //
translated: A shelter means protection from the sudden harm of wind, sun, and so on.

original: gling zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i chu'i gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o //🔽skyob pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o //
analyzed: gling zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i chu'i gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o // skyob pa zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o //
translated: An island means protection from the harm of water such as an ocean.🔽A refuge means protection from the harm of those of the same kind.

original: skyabs zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las gyur pa'i gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o //
translated: A haven means protection from the harm of those of a different kind.

original: dpung gnyen zhes bya ba ni nang gi rims nad la sogs pa'i gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o //
analyzed: dpung gnyen zhes bya ba ni nang gi rims nad la sogs pa'i gnod pa las bsrungs pa'o //
translated: A friend means protection from the harm of internal illness and so on.

original: @191b lho lam zhes bya ba ni lho phyogs kyi lam mo //
analyzed: @191b lho lam zhes bya ba ni lho phyogs kyi lam mo //
translated: The southern path is the path to the south.

original: chags par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags bskyed pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyags par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dregs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags bskyed pa'i phyir ro // rgyags par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dregs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a path of passion because it generates passion.🔽It is a path of pride because it generates pride.

original: 'dod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a path of desire because it generates desire.

original: sdug par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni phrad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni phrad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a path of beauty because it generates desire having the characteristic of union.

original: byams par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a path of love because it generates afflicted joy.

original: brjod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ser sna'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bad pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ser sna'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bad pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a path of speech because it generates effort having the characteristic of miserliness.

original: brgyal bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags las gyur pa'i g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi brgyal ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyal bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags las gyur pa'i g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi brgyal ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a path of fainting because it generates fainting having the characteristic of movement born of passion.

original: 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi gtong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi byams pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi gtong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi byams pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “They will die” means that they will not be abandoned.

original: bsgrub par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa thob par 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa thob par 'dod pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “They will be accomplished” means that they will be generated as the desire to attain what has not been attained.

original: kun du sbyor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phan tshun sbyor ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du sbyor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phan tshun sbyor ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “They will be bound” means that they will be generated as mutual bonds.

original: gnyid log pa zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis non pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid log pa zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis non pa'o //
translated: “They will sleep” means that they will be overcome by sleep.

original: mal du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni mal du sgyel ba'o //
analyzed: mal du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni mal du sgyel ba'o //
translated: “They will go to bed” means that they will lie down in bed.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling dga' bar 'gyur ba khyod kyis bdag cag spangs sam zhes bya ba ni thag ring por yongs su spangs sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling dga' bar 'gyur ba khyod kyis bdag cag spangs sam zhes bya ba ni thag ring por yongs su spangs sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “You have abandoned us in the delightful continent of Jambu” means that you have abandoned us far away.

original: 'phang mtho ba zhes bya ba ni gnam 'phang mtho ba'o //
analyzed: 'phang mtho ba zhes bya ba ni gnam 'phang mtho ba'o //
translated: “High” means high in the sky.

original: tha gru che ba zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: tha gru che ba zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba'o //
translated: “Large” means extensive.

original: byi la 'dzul ba zhes bya ba ni byi la 'gro ba'i sgo'o //
analyzed: byi la 'dzul ba zhes bya ba ni byi la 'gro ba'i sgo'o //
translated: “The cat’s hole” means the cat’s entrance.

original: 'ongs shing 'ongs shing zhes bya ba ni gzung zhing gzung zhing ngo //
analyzed: 'ongs shing 'ongs shing zhes bya ba ni gzung zhing gzung zhing ngo //
translated: Having come, having come means having seized, having seized.

original: rnam par rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun 'gro ba'o //
translated: Moving about means going back and forth.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni tshim pa'i bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni tshim pa'i bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: Happy means having attained the happiness of satisfaction.

original: nad med pa zhes bya ba ni bkres pa'i nad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nad med pa zhes bya ba ni bkres pa'i nad dang bral ba'o //
translated: Healthy means being free from the illness of hunger.

original: stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni spro ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni spro ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Strong means being full of enthusiasm.

original: dbang po tshim pa zhes bya ba ni lus nye bar btsags pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po tshim pa zhes bya ba ni lus nye bar btsags pa'o //
translated: Satisfied in the senses means having nourished the body.

original: legs par shin tu bzung ste zhes bya ba ni blangs te'o //
analyzed: legs par shin tu bzung ste zhes bya ba ni blangs te'o //
translated: Having well and thoroughly grasped means having taken up.

original: kun chub par byas nas zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du bsams shing yongs su rdzogs par byas nas so //
analyzed: kun chub par byas nas zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du bsams shing yongs su rdzogs par byas nas so //
translated: Having mastered means having reflected again and again and brought it to completion.

original: dal bu dal bus nyal lo zhes bya ba ni dal bus reg par byas shing 'khyud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dal bu dal bus nyal lo zhes bya ba ni dal bus reg par byas shing 'khyud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Lying down slowly, slowly means slowly touching and embracing.

original: yang dag par bsgo yang dag par bstan zhes bya ba ni byed du 'jud pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgo yang dag par bstan zhes bya ba ni byed du 'jud pa'o //
translated: Having admonished and instructed means having made them do it.

original: lus kyi mthu dang stobs bskyed nas //
analyzed: lus kyi mthu dang stobs bskyed nas //
translated: Having generated the power and strength of the body,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: mthu zhes bya ba @192a * //
analyzed: mthu zhes bya ba @192a * //
translated: power

original: ni ba rtan pa'o //
analyzed: ni ba rtan pa'o //
translated: is firmness.

original: stobs zhes bya ba ni spro ba'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: stobs zhes bya ba ni spro ba'i nus pa'o //
translated: Strength is the ability to be enthusiastic.

original: sangs rgyas bstan la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pa la'o //
translated: The teaching of the Buddha is the teaching of the four noble truths.

original: ma dad ces bya ba ni yid mi ches pa'o //
analyzed: ma dad ces bya ba ni yid mi ches pa'o //
translated: Lack of faith is lack of confidence.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Suffering is the suffering of the hells and so on.

original: pha rol 'gro ba zhi zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol 'gro ba zhi zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Going to the other shore, peace is becoming nirvāṇa.

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni bkren pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni bkren pa'o //
translated: Affliction is poverty.

original: thabs soms shig ces bya ba ni thabs ji ltar bya ba ni soms shig pa'o //
analyzed: thabs soms shig ces bya ba ni thabs ji ltar bya ba ni soms shig pa'o //
translated: Think of a means is think of what kind of means to use.

original: snying stobs can zhes bya ba ni brtan pa'o //
analyzed: snying stobs can zhes bya ba ni brtan pa'o //
translated: The courageous are the steadfast.

original: byung ste zhes bya ba ni bstan te'o //
analyzed: byung ste zhes bya ba ni bstan te'o //
translated: Having arisen is having been taught.

original: dus tshigs sar pa zhes bya ba ni dus dang por 'byung ba'i lo ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus tshigs sar pa zhes bya ba ni dus dang por 'byung ba'i lo ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first season is the leaves and so on that appear in the first part of the year.

original: rgyu med par yang zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du ma btang ba ste zhar la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu med par yang zhes bya ba ni blo sngon du ma btang ba ste zhar la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Without a cause means without prior intention, which is to say, incidentally.

original: shing bal zhes bya ba ni ras bal mar me la sogs pa la dgos pa'o //
analyzed: shing bal zhes bya ba ni ras bal mar me la sogs pa la dgos pa'o //
translated: Cotton is cotton fluff, which is needed for lamps, etc.

original: chog gis zhes bya ba ni mthar thug gis so //
analyzed: chog gis zhes bya ba ni mthar thug gis so //
translated: Enough means final.

original: thong shig ces bya ba ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: thong shig ces bya ba ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: Give up means to stop.

original: me spar ba des zhes bya ba ni mched pa des so //
analyzed: me spar ba des zhes bya ba ni mched pa des so //
translated: By that fire means by that which is burning.

original: rtsig ngos skar khung nas zhes bya ba ni ra ba'i skar khung bu ga nas so //
analyzed: rtsig ngos skar khung nas zhes bya ba ni ra ba'i skar khung bu ga nas so //
translated: Through a hole in the wall means through a hole in the wall.

original: chu'i stor khung nas zhes bya ba ni chu 'bab pa'i bu ga nas so //
analyzed: chu'i stor khung nas zhes bya ba ni chu 'bab pa'i bu ga nas so //
translated: Through a hole in the water means through a hole in the water.

original: 'bras bu med par dus la bab pha ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snying po blangs pa ste ;
analyzed: 'bras bu med par dus la bab pha ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snying po blangs pa ste ;
translated: The time has come for you to be without fruit means that the essence has been taken out.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu las skye pa'i 'bras bu blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu las skye pa'i 'bras bu blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fruit of the ascetic has been taken out.

original: tha ma'i cha dang ldan pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sgrib pa lnga'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang ldan pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sgrib pa lnga'o //
translated: The five fetters belonging to the lower part means the five hindrances of the desire realm.

original: rdzus te skye zhing zhes bya ba ni skye gnas gzhan du mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzus te skye zhing zhes bya ba ni skye gnas gzhan du mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Born supernaturally” means not being born in any other birth-state.

original: der yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: der yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: “Attaining parinirvāṇa there” means in the form realm.

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom mo //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang the tshom mo //
translated: “The three fetters” are the view of the transitory aggregates, clinging to the precepts, and doubt.

original: lan cig 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'jig rten 'dir ro //
analyzed: lan cig 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'jig rten 'dir ro //
translated: “Having come to this world once” means having come to this human world.

original: log par mi ltung ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs par mi ltung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par mi ltung ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs par mi ltung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “One who will never fall back” means one who will not fall back into the hells, etc.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nges par gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nges par gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One who is certain to attain complete enlightenment” means one who will certainly attain nirvāṇa by completely abandoning all afflictions.

original: re ltar thogs pa ni srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams kyi nang du @192b skye ba lan bdun pa dang / de dag gi bar ma do'i srid pa skye ba lan bdun dang / mi rnams kyi nang du skye ba lan bdun dang /
analyzed: re ltar thogs pa ni srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams kyi nang du @192b skye ba lan bdun pa dang / de dag gi bar ma do'i srid pa skye ba lan bdun dang / mi rnams kyi nang du skye ba lan bdun dang /
translated: He takes birth seven times among the gods of the desire realm, seven times in the intermediate state as a desire realm god, and seven times among humans.

original: de dag gi bar ma do'i srid par lan bdun len pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bar ma do'i srid par lan bdun len pa'o //
translated: He takes birth seven times in the intermediate state as a human.

original: rang gi srog gi phyir yang bslab pa dag las 'da' bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ston te /
analyzed: rang gi srog gi phyir yang bslab pa dag las 'da' bar mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ston te /
translated: He does not transgress the precepts even for the sake of his life. This shows the purity of his morality.

original: ngal sems dad pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa kun du spyod pa ston to //
analyzed: ngal sems dad pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa kun du spyod pa ston to //
translated: He is always mindful and has faith. This shows his practice of faith.

original: gang la bad sa'i rgyal po shar pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽chags pa la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kun du spyod pas so //
analyzed: gang la bad sa'i rgyal po shar pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / chags pa la zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kun du spyod pas so //
translated: The king of Benares named Prasenajit, etc.🔽He is attached because he practices desire realm attachment.

original: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni drung du 'gro bas 'dun pas so //
analyzed: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni drung du 'gro bas 'dun pas so //
translated: He is greedy because he is intent on going to her.

original: chums pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag nas 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: chums pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag nas 'dzin pas so //
translated: “Squeezing” means holding the limb.

original: mdud pa bor ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis sprod par 'dun pas so //
analyzed: mdud pa bor ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis sprod par 'dun pas so //
translated: “Knotting” means the desire to unite the two.

original: brgyal ba zhes bya ba ni sems chags pa nyid kyis sam lus 'gyur ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: brgyal ba zhes bya ba ni sems chags pa nyid kyis sam lus 'gyur ba nyid kyis so //
translated: “Fainting” means either the mind is attached or the body changes.

original: lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa las byung ba med pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas na /
analyzed: lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa las byung ba med pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas na /
translated: “Excessive attachment” means not having the non-existence that arises from sexual misconduct, and not being fully complete.

original: bar mi chad par 'dun pas so //
analyzed: bar mi chad par 'dun pas so //
translated: “Intentionally” means without interruption.

original: lhag par chags shing 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag de la spyod pa zlog pas 'dug pas so //🔽'jig rten snying po med brel la //
analyzed: lhag par chags shing 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag de la spyod pa zlog pas 'dug pas so // 'jig rten snying po med brel la //
translated: “Sitting in excessive attachment” means sitting by stopping others from engaging in it.

original: zhes bya ba ni lus snying po med pa don med pa 'bras bu med pa dang brel ba la'o //🔽skal ldan gzugs bzhin ldan par byed //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus snying po med pa don med pa 'bras bu med pa dang brel ba la'o // skal ldan gzugs bzhin ldan par byed //
translated: “The world is without essence, and is busy” means the body is without essence, meaningless, and fruitless, and is busy.

original: ces bya ba ni snying po dang ldan pa'i gzugs nyid du rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni snying po dang ldan pa'i gzugs nyid du rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: “Like a fortunate form, it is made to be endowed” means it is imagined to be a form endowed with essence.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar lta zhe na /
translated: Why is it viewed in that way?

original: de'i phyir // byis pa nyon mongs bcings gyur cing //
analyzed: de'i phyir // byis pa nyon mongs bcings gyur cing //
translated: The childish, bound by afflictions,

original: mun pas yongs su bskor ba dag / dam pa min la dam par lta //
analyzed: mun pas yongs su bskor ba dag / dam pa min la dam par lta //
translated: Surrounded by darkness, see the non-sacred as sacred.
